translated: This is the section on the sūtra.

original: ji ltar na go rims bzhin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na go rims bzhin zhe na /
translated: How is it in order?

original: don la myur bar 'jug pa'i phyir shes rab myur ba yin no //
analyzed: don la myur bar 'jug pa'i phyir shes rab myur ba yin no //
translated: The one who has swift wisdom is the one who engages quickly in the meaning.

original: don mang po la 'jug pa'i phyir shes rab mgyogs pa yin no //
analyzed: don mang po la 'jug pa'i phyir shes rab mgyogs pa yin no //
translated: The one who has quick wisdom is the one who engages in many meanings.

original: don phra ba la 'jug pa'i phyir shes rab rno ba yin no //
analyzed: don phra ba la 'jug pa'i phyir shes rab rno ba yin no //
translated: The one who has sharp wisdom is the one who engages in subtle meanings.

original: 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ba dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ba dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The passage continues:

original: 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ba ni nges par 'byung ba ste mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ba ni nges par 'byung ba ste mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: “Liberation from cyclic existence” is nirvana.🔽Since he has the wisdom of liberation, he is the one with the wisdom of liberation.🔽“The wisdom that discerns reality” is the wisdom that discerns reality.

original: 'di la nges par 'byung ba de'i shes rab yod pas de'i phyir nges bar 'byung ba'i shes rab can no //🔽de kho na nges par 'byed pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di la nges par 'byung ba de'i shes rab yod pas de'i phyir nges bar 'byung ba'i shes rab can no // de kho na nges par 'byed pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Since he has the wisdom that discerns reality, he is the one with the wisdom that discerns reality.🔽How does he have the wisdom that discerns reality?

original: de kho na 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i mtshan nyid nges par 'byed pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes par byed pas na nges par 'byed pa'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: de kho na 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i mtshan nyid nges par 'byed pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes par byed pas na nges par 'byed pa'i shes rab bo //
translated: He has the wisdom that discerns reality because he has the wisdom of the four noble truths.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i shes rab yod pas na de'i phyir nges par 'byed pa'i shes rab can no //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i shes rab yod pas na de'i phyir nges par 'byed pa'i shes rab can no //
translated: Since he has the wisdom that discerns reality, he is the one with the wisdom that discerns reality.

original: ji ltar byas pas go rims bzhin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas go rims bzhin zhe na /
translated: How does he have the wisdom of liberation?🔽He has the wisdom of liberation because he has the wisdom of the four noble truths.🔽Since he has the wisdom of liberation, he is the one with the wisdom of liberation.

original: 'di la shes rab chen po yod de /
analyzed: 'di la shes rab chen po yod de /
translated: How does he have great wisdom?

original: 'dri ba dang lan gdab pa dag la phugs thug par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dri ba rnams dang lan 'debs pa rnams la yongs su gtugs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽shes rab che ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dri ba dang lan gdab pa dag la phugs thug par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dri ba rnams dang lan 'debs pa rnams la yongs su gtugs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // shes rab che ba yin no //
translated: because there is no end to questions and answers.🔽He has great wisdom.

original: shes rab che ba ni yangs pa yang yin te /
analyzed: shes rab che ba ni yangs pa yang yin te /
translated: He has vast wisdom.

original: gang gi phyir zhen /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhen /
translated: Why is that?

original: mngon par shes pa lnga rgya che ba dang yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga rgya che ba dang yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because his five superknowledges are vast and complete.

original: mngon par shes pa rgya che ba'i phyir dang mngon par shes pa lnga char yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir shes rab yangs pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rgya che ba'i phyir dang mngon par shes pa lnga char yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir shes rab yangs pa yin no //
translated: His wisdom is vast because his superknowledges are vast, and it is complete because all five superknowledges are complete.

original: rgya che ba ni de dag gi yul thag ring ba dang / phra ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: rgya che ba ni de dag gi yul thag ring ba dang / phra ba nyid yin no //
translated: Vast means that their objects are distant and subtle.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa nyid ni gcig ma yin la bzhi'i bar ma yin gyi'o na ci zhe na lnga char yin no //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa nyid ni gcig ma yin la bzhi'i bar ma yin gyi'o na ci zhe na lnga char yin no //
translated: Complete means that they are not one, nor are they up to four, but rather all five.

original: shes rab de ni zab pa dang yangs pa yin te /
analyzed: shes rab de ni zab pa dang yangs pa yin te /
translated: That wisdom is profound and vast.

original: gzhan dag gis rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni shes rab zab pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni shes rab zab pa yin no //
translated: It is profound because it is difficult for others to understand.

original: shes rab de ni mnyam pa med pa yang yin te /
analyzed: shes rab de ni mnyam pa med pa yang yin te /
translated: That wisdom is also unequaled,

original: 'jig rten thams cad las khyad par du 'phags @226b pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad las khyad par du 'phags @226b pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is superior to all mundane [wisdoms].

original: de'i phyir shes rab mnyam pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab mnyam pa med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, wisdom is unequaled.

original: shes rab de ni rin po che lta bu yang yin te /🔽rnyed par dka' ba'i phyir dang / don che ba yang dag par sgrub pa'i phyir dang / dga' bar byed pa'i phyir na nor bu rin po che dang chos mthun pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: shes rab de ni rin po che lta bu yang yin te / rnyed par dka' ba'i phyir dang / don che ba yang dag par sgrub pa'i phyir dang / dga' bar byed pa'i phyir na nor bu rin po che dang chos mthun pa'i phyir te /
translated: That wisdom is also like a jewel,🔽because it is difficult to obtain, because it accomplishes great meaning, and because it delights, it has the same qualities as a precious jewel.

original: nor bu rin po che yang rnyed par dka' ba dang / don chen po yang dag par sgrub pa dang / dga' bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: nor bu rin po che yang rnyed par dka' ba dang / don chen po yang dag par sgrub pa dang / dga' bar byed pa yin no //
translated: A precious jewel is difficult to obtain, accomplishes great meaning, and delights.

original: de la don chen po yang dag par sgrub pa dang / dga' bar byed pa yin par ni rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud dag la rnam par grol ba dang / dga' ba skyed pa'i phyir ro zhes sgrub bar byed do //
analyzed: de la don chen po yang dag par sgrub pa dang / dga' bar byed pa yin par ni rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud dag la rnam par grol ba dang / dga' ba skyed pa'i phyir ro zhes sgrub bar byed do //
translated: The great meaning is accomplished and it delights, because it generates liberation and delight in one's own and others' mind-streams.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud la rnam par grol ba skyed pa'i phyir na don chen po yang dag par 'grub pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud la rnam par grol ba skyed pa'i phyir na don chen po yang dag par 'grub pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the great meaning is accomplished because it generates liberation in one's own and others' mind-streams.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud la dga' ba skyed pa'i phyir na dga' bar byed pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud la dga' ba skyed pa'i phyir na dga' bar byed pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that it delights because it generates delight in one's own and others' mind-streams.

original: de lta bu ni shes rab rin po che dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu ni shes rab rin po che dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: This is the possession of the jewel of wisdom.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
translated: Here, the passage is a fragment of a sutra.

original: 'dir shes rab kyi yon tan gsum dag tu ste /
analyzed: 'dir shes rab kyi yon tan gsum dag tu ste /
translated: Here, the three virtues of wisdom are:

original: shes rab myur ba nyid dang / shes rab mgyogs pa nyid dang / shes rab rno ba nyid ni gnyi ga'i don gyi dbang du mdzad pa'i chos kyi don las brtsams nas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab myur ba nyid dang / shes rab mgyogs pa nyid dang / shes rab rno ba nyid ni gnyi ga'i don gyi dbang du mdzad pa'i chos kyi don las brtsams nas rig par bya'o //
translated: The swiftness, speed, and sharpness of wisdom should be understood in terms of the meaning of the Dharma for both oneself and others.

original: gnyi ga ni bdag dang gzhan gnyis yin la /
analyzed: gnyi ga ni bdag dang gzhan gnyis yin la /
translated: Both refers to oneself and others.

original: don ni ched yin pas /
analyzed: don ni ched yin pas /
translated: Meaning is the purpose.

original: gnyis ka'i don to //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is the meaning for both.

original: dbang du bya ba chos kyi don 'di la yod pa ni bstan pa'i chos kyi don gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: dbang du bya ba chos kyi don 'di la yod pa ni bstan pa'i chos kyi don gang yin pa ste /
translated: The meaning of the Dharma is present in this, which is under the influence of both.

original: de la yod pa de ni gnyi ga'i don gyi dbang du mdzad pa'i //
analyzed: de la yod pa de ni gnyi ga'i don gyi dbang du mdzad pa'i //
translated: That which is present in that is the meaning for both.

original: gnyis ka'i don gyi dbang du mdzad pa'i chos kyi don de las brtsams nas te /
analyzed: gnyis ka'i don gyi dbang du mdzad pa'i chos kyi don de las brtsams nas te /
translated: In terms of the meaning of the Dharma for both,

original: ched du byas nas yon tan gsum po 'di dag rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ched du byas nas yon tan gsum po 'di dag rig par bya'o //
translated: one should understand these three qualities.

original: shes rab kyi yon tan gnyis te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi yon tan gnyis te /
translated: There are two qualities of wisdom:

original: nges par 'byung pa'i shes rab can nyid dang / nges par 'byed pa'i shes rab can no //
analyzed: nges par 'byung pa'i shes rab can nyid dang / nges par 'byed pa'i shes rab can no //
translated: the wisdom of renunciation and the wisdom of differentiation.

original: rang gi don las brtsams nas rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rang gi don las brtsams nas rig par bya ste /
translated: One should understand in terms of one's own purpose.

original: 'di gnyis ni 'jig rten las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni 'jig rten las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because these two are supramundane.

original: shes rab kyi yon tan lhag ma rnams te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi yon tan lhag ma rnams te /
translated: The remaining qualities are those of wisdom.

original: shes rab che ba la sogs pa lnga ni mi gzhan gyi don las brtsams nas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab che ba la sogs pa lnga ni mi gzhan gyi don las brtsams nas rig par bya'o //
translated: The five beginning with great wisdom should be understood in terms of the benefit for others.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: shes rab che ba nyid kyis ni gzhan gyi the tshom gcod pa'i phyir ro //🔽shes rab yangs pa nyid kyis ni gzhan dag 'dud pa'i phyir ro //🔽shes rab zab pa nyid kyis ni gzhan @227a * //
analyzed: shes rab che ba nyid kyis ni gzhan gyi the tshom gcod pa'i phyir ro // shes rab yangs pa nyid kyis ni gzhan dag 'dud pa'i phyir ro // shes rab zab pa nyid kyis ni gzhan @227a * //
translated: Because one who has great wisdom eliminates the doubts of others.🔽One who has vast wisdom is honored by others.

original: dag ri mo'i khyad par skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dag ri mo'i khyad par skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One who has profound wisdom generates special reverence in others.

original: shes rab rin po che dang ldan pa nyid kyis ni don gyi mchog thob bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab rin po che dang ldan pa nyid kyis ni don gyi mchog thob bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One who has precious wisdom obtains the highest goal.

original: gzhan yang 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu'i dbang du mdzad nas tshig 'di dag gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu'i dbang du mdzad nas tshig 'di dag gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, these words were spoken with reference to the noble Śāriputra.

original: gang gi phyir tshe dang ldan pa btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshe dang ldan pa btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa /
translated: Because the Venerable Bhadanta Śāriputra was one of moral discipline,

original: 'dod pa chung ba /
analyzed: 'dod pa chung ba /
translated: Having few desires,

original: chog shes pa /
analyzed: chog shes pa /
translated: being content,

original: rab tu dben pa /
analyzed: rab tu dben pa /
translated: being secluded,

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa /
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa /
translated: having begun effort,

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa /
translated: having established mindfulness,

original: shes rab mnyam par gzhag pa /
analyzed: shes rab mnyam par gzhag pa /
translated: having equipoised wisdom,

original: shes rab myur ba zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: shes rab myur ba zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: and having swift wisdom.

original: lan cig tshigs su bcad pa thos pas don la zhugs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lan cig tshigs su bcad pa thos pas don la zhugs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because he engages in the meaning by hearing a verse just once.🔽Because he engages in the meaning by hearing this verse just once:🔽Whatever arises from a cause

original: chos gang rgyus byung de dag gi / rgyu dang de 'gog gang yin pa //
analyzed: chos gang rgyus byung de dag gi / rgyu dang de 'gog gang yin pa //
translated: and the cessation of that cause

original: de bzhin gshegs pas bka' stsal te //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas bka' stsal te //
translated: has been taught by the Tathāgata

original: dge sbyong chen pos de skad gsungs //🔽zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di lan cig thos pas don la zhugs pa'i phyir ro //🔽de nyid las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'di ltar tshigs su bcad pa thos pa de nyid las 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab thob pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dge sbyong chen pos de skad gsungs // zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di lan cig thos pas don la zhugs pa'i phyir ro // de nyid las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'di ltar tshigs su bcad pa thos pa de nyid las 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab thob pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ste /
translated: and also by the great ascetic.🔽Because he obtains supramundane wisdom from just hearing that verse.

original: zag pa med pa'i shes rab thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i shes rab thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he obtains uncontaminated wisdom from just hearing that verse.

original: nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang / de kho na rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang / de kho na rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they eliminate the defilements and because they understand reality.

original: nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir nges par 'byung ba'i shes rab can no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir nges par 'byung ba'i shes rab can no //
translated: They are endowed with the wisdom of deliverance because they eliminate the defilements.

original: de kho na rtogs pa'i phyir nges bar 'byed pa'i shes rab can no //
analyzed: de kho na rtogs pa'i phyir nges bar 'byed pa'i shes rab can no //
translated: They are endowed with the wisdom of discernment because they understand reality.

original: rnam par thar ba brgyad las bsam gtan byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par thar ba brgyad las bsam gtan byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: They are meditators on the eight liberations.🔽The eight liberations are as follows:

original: rnam par thar ba brgyad po de dag kyang gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa dang po'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar ba brgyad po de dag kyang gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa dang po'o //
translated: The first liberation is for one who has form to see visible forms.

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes shing phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes shing phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second is for one who has no notion of inner form to see visible forms.

original: sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa lus kyis mngon sum du byas nas rdzogs par byas te gnas pa ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa lus kyis mngon sum du byas nas rdzogs par byas te gnas pa ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The third is for one who has attained and is dwelling in the liberation that is the beauty of the formless.🔽The four formless liberations are the base of infinite space, the base of infinite consciousness, the base of nothingness, and the base of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: gzugs med pa bzhi dang / brgyad pa 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa bzhi dang / brgyad pa 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa'o //
translated: The eighth liberation is the cessation of perception and feeling.

original: phyogs thams cad du rnam par rgyug bar byed do zhes bya ba ni rnam par thar pa brgyad lus kyis mngon sum du byas te rdzogs par byas nas gnas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyogs thams cad du rnam par rgyug bar byed do zhes bya ba ni rnam par thar pa brgyad lus kyis mngon sum du byas te rdzogs par byas nas gnas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He moves about in all directions means he dwells having manifested and completed the eight liberations with his body.

original: der yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mdo der yang ngo //
analyzed: der yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mdo der yang ngo //
translated: In that sutra means in that sutra.

original: bsam gtan rnams la mngon par shes pa dang rnam par thar pa rten pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams la mngon par shes pa dang rnam par thar pa rten pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: Because the higher perceptions and liberations are based on the absorptions.

original: mngon par shes pa rten pa nyid dang rnam par thar pa rten pa nyid kyi phyir @227b ni rgyus zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rten pa nyid dang rnam par thar pa rten pa nyid kyi phyir @227b ni rgyus zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The word cause should be understood as the basis of the higher perceptions and the basis of the liberations.

original: 'di skad du sngar bsam gtan bskyed nas de las bsam gtan la brten te mngon par shes pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad bskyed pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du sngar bsam gtan bskyed nas de las bsam gtan la brten te mngon par shes pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad bskyed pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches that having previously generated the absorptions, one generates the eight liberations and higher perceptions based on those absorptions.

original: skyes bu cang mkhyen ni skyes bu cang shes te /
analyzed: skyes bu cang mkhyen ni skyes bu cang shes te /
translated: One who knows a person is a person who knows.

original: gang zhig sems la dbang byed pa thob cing sems kyis mi 'phrogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig sems la dbang byed pa thob cing sems kyis mi 'phrogs pa'o //
translated: He has attained mastery over his mind and is not carried away by his mind.

original: shes rab rin po che dang ldan pa yang snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: shes rab rin po che dang ldan pa yang snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: He is endowed with the jewel of wisdom, as above.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: rin po che ltar rnyed bar dka' ba'i phyir dang / don chen po yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phyir dang / dga' bar byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rin po che ltar rnyed bar dka' ba'i phyir dang / don chen po yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phyir dang / dga' bar byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because wisdom is difficult to obtain like a jewel, because it accomplishes the great meaning, and because it delights.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud dag la rnam par grol ba dang / dga' ba bskyed pa'i phyir na shes rab rin po che dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud dag la rnam par grol ba dang / dga' ba bskyed pa'i phyir na shes rab rin po che dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: He is endowed with the jewel of wisdom because he generates the joy of liberation in his own and others' continuums.

original: 'di la 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa ni bdag ni skye dgu ser sna'i dri mas kun nas dkris pa rnams las sems dri ma'i ser sna dang bral bas lhug par gtong ba dang / lag brkyang pa dang / rnam par gtong ba la dga' ba dang /
analyzed: 'di la 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa ni bdag ni skye dgu ser sna'i dri mas kun nas dkris pa rnams las sems dri ma'i ser sna dang bral bas lhug par gtong ba dang / lag brkyang pa dang / rnam par gtong ba la dga' ba dang /
translated: Here, the noble disciple who is endowed with learning thinks, I am free from the stain of stinginess, which is the stain that wraps around the mind of those who are wrapped in the stain of stinginess. I am generous, open-handed, and delight in giving.

original: sbyin pa rgyun mi 'chad pa dang gtong ba bun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyin pa la bged par dga' bas khyim na gnas pa ni bdag gi rnyed pa legs par rnyed do zhes sbyin par bya ba'i chos kyi rnam pa yang dag par rjes su dran no zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa rgyun mi 'chad pa dang gtong ba bun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyin pa la bged par dga' bas khyim na gnas pa ni bdag gi rnyed pa legs par rnyed do zhes sbyin par bya ba'i chos kyi rnam pa yang dag par rjes su dran no zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
translated: He recollects the aspects of the things to be given, thinking: “The one who lives at home, having obtained goods, can say: ‘I have gained a good gain, for I delight in sharing with those who ask, and in giving and sacrificing.’

original: de'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni ser sna'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni ser sna'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ” The cause of stinginess is the cause of that.

original: 'bras bu'i shing lta bu ni ji ltar shing gang las 'bras bu 'byung ba de ni 'bras bu'i shing zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i shing lta bu ni ji ltar shing gang las 'bras bu 'byung ba de ni 'bras bu'i shing zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
translated: The tree of fruit is like a tree from which fruit grows.

original: de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like that.

original: ser ba'i sprin lta bu yang ji ltar sprin gang las ser ba 'bab pa de ni ser ba'i sprin zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: ser ba'i sprin lta bu yang ji ltar sprin gang las ser ba 'bab pa de ni ser ba'i sprin zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
translated: The rain cloud is like a cloud from which rain falls.

original: de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar chags pa'i rnam pa de ni de'i rgyu yin pas so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar chags pa'i rnam pa de ni de'i rgyu yin pas so //
translated: For that very reason means: because that form of attachment is its cause.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ji skad bstan pa de ltar na ser sna'i dri ma zhes ser sna sngar smos pa ni khyad par du bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ji skad bstan pa de ltar na ser sna'i dri ma zhes ser sna sngar smos pa ni khyad par du bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: Thus, etc. means: thus, as it has been taught, the stain of avarice is the cause of the stain of attachment.

original: 'bras bu'i shing lta bu dang / ser ba'i sprin lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i shing lta bu dang / ser ba'i sprin lta bu'o //
translated: The stain of avarice is like a fruit tree, and the stain of attachment is like a rain cloud.

original: de ltar na dri ma'i khyad par chags pa'i rnam pa 'ga' zhig rgyu yin gyi dri ma gang yang rung ngo cog ni ser sna'i rgyu ma yin no zhes de ltar khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na dri ma'i khyad par chags pa'i rnam pa 'ga' zhig rgyu yin gyi dri ma gang yang rung ngo cog ni ser sna'i rgyu ma yin no zhes de ltar khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, a certain aspect of the stain of attachment is the cause, but any stain whatsoever is not the cause of avarice. Thus, it is in order to specify.

original: dri ma'i ser sna dang bral ba zhes ser sna phyis smos pa ni lhog pa'i go rims yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri ma'i ser sna dang bral ba zhes ser sna phyis smos pa ni lhog pa'i go rims yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The stain of avarice is the cause of the stain of attachment. The stain of avarice is mentioned later in order to demonstrate the correct order.

original: lhog pa'i go rims yang dag par bstan pa yang ser sna'i @228a * //
analyzed: lhog pa'i go rims yang dag par bstan pa yang ser sna'i @228a * //
translated: The demonstration of the correct order is as follows:🔽the stain of avarice is the cause of the stain of attachment.

original: dri ma chags pa dang sngar bral nas phyis ser sna dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: dri ma chags pa dang sngar bral nas phyis ser sna dang bral ba yin no //
translated: Having previously been freed from the stain of attachment, one later becomes freed from the stain of avarice.

original: ji ltar na sems dri ma'i ser sna dang bral bas khyim du gnas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sems dri ma'i ser sna dang bral bas khyim du gnas she na /
translated: How does he live in a house free of the stain of stinginess?

original: lhug par gtong ba zhes rgyas par 'byung ba yin te /🔽de la lhug par gtong ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni mi gnas par sbyin pa byed pa nyid yin par ston la /🔽sbyin pa la bged par dga' ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni phyogs med par sbyin pa byin pa'i bar yin par ston to //
analyzed: lhug par gtong ba zhes rgyas par 'byung ba yin te / de la lhug par gtong ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni mi gnas par sbyin pa byed pa nyid yin par ston la / sbyin pa la bged par dga' ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni phyogs med par sbyin pa byin pa'i bar yin par ston to //
translated: He is openhanded, etc.🔽This shows that he gives without attachment.🔽He is fond of giving gifts shows that he gives impartially.

original: de la lhug par gtong ba zhes bya ba ni mi gnas par sbyin pa byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de la lhug par gtong ba zhes bya ba ni mi gnas par sbyin pa byed pa yin no //
translated: Here, openhanded means giving without attachment.

original: lag brkyang ba zhes bya ba ni rgya cher sbyin pa byed pa yin te /
analyzed: lag brkyang ba zhes bya ba ni rgya cher sbyin pa byed pa yin te /
translated: Openhanded means giving extensively.

original: sbyin pa la ma 'khums pa yin no //🔽rnam par gtong ba la dga' ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sbyin pa la ma 'khums pa yin no // rnam par gtong ba la dga' ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: He is not closedfisted about giving.🔽He is fond of giving gifts means

original: gzhan dag la gser la sogs pa rnam par gtong bar byed pa ni rnam par gtong ba ste /🔽de la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag la gser la sogs pa rnam par gtong bar byed pa ni rnam par gtong ba ste /🔽de la dga' ba'o //
translated: he is fond of giving gold, etc. to others.

original: sbyin pa rgyun mi 'chad pa dang zhes bya ba ni sbyin par byed pa'i dang tshul can yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa rgyun mi 'chad pa dang zhes bya ba ni sbyin par byed pa'i dang tshul can yin no //
translated: He is a constant giver, meaning he is a person who gives.

original: dge sbyong rnams nas slong mo pa rnams kyi bar dag la zhes bya ba ni dge sbyong rnams dang / bram ze rnams dang / slong mo pa bkren pa rnams dang / sdug phongs pa rnams dang / lam nas 'gro ba rnams la'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong rnams nas slong mo pa rnams kyi bar dag la zhes bya ba ni dge sbyong rnams dang / bram ze rnams dang / slong mo pa bkren pa rnams dang / sdug phongs pa rnams dang / lam nas 'gro ba rnams la'o //
translated: To ascetics, brahmins, and beggars, meaning to ascetics, brahmins, the poor, the destitute, and travelers.

original: de la rigs kyi bu dga' bo'i zas la tshod 'dzin pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la rigs kyi bu dga' bo'i zas la tshod 'dzin pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: Noble sir, this is how a son of noble family should regulate his meals.

original: dge slong dag rigs kyi bu dag dga' bo ni longs pa'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: dge slong dag rigs kyi bu dag dga' bo ni longs pa'i phyir ma yin /
translated: Monks, a son of noble family should not eat for the sake of enjoyment,

original: rgyags pa'i phyir ma yin /🔽cha ba'i phyir ma yin /🔽brgyan pa'i phyir ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyags pa'i phyir ma yin / cha ba'i phyir ma yin / brgyan pa'i phyir ma yin gyi /
translated: for the sake of intoxication,🔽for the sake of physical beauty and attractiveness.

original: lus 'di kho na gnas par bya ba'i phyir dang / gso ba'i phyir dang / bkres pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir dang / tshangs par spyod pa rjes su gzung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: lus 'di kho na gnas par bya ba'i phyir dang / gso ba'i phyir dang / bkres pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir dang / tshangs par spyod pa rjes su gzung ba'i phyir te /
translated: He should eat only to maintain and nourish this body, to shelter it from harm, to support religious practice,🔽thinking, “I shall get rid of old feelings and not create new ones. I shall maintain myself, be blameless, and live in comfort.”

original: da lta bus tshor ba rnying ni gzhil bar bya la /
analyzed: da lta bus tshor ba rnying ni gzhil bar bya la /
translated: I will now put an end to old feelings and not produce new ones.

original: tshor ba gsar ni mi skye bar byas na bdag 'tsho ba dang stobs dang bde ba dang kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / rigs par gnas par 'gyur ro zhes so sor brtags nas zas za'o //🔽dge slong dag dper na skyes bu shing rta bas /
analyzed: tshor ba gsar ni mi skye bar byas na bdag 'tsho ba dang stobs dang bde ba dang kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / rigs par gnas par 'gyur ro zhes so sor brtags nas zas za'o // dge slong dag dper na skyes bu shing rta bas /
translated: If I do this, I will live with vigor, happiness, and without reproach, and in a fitting manner.

original: mar ram 'bru mar gyis shing rta'i srog shing la skud par byed pa na longs pa'i phyir ni ma yin /🔽rgyags pa'i phyir ni ma yin /🔽cha ba'i phyir ni ma yin /
analyzed: mar ram 'bru mar gyis shing rta'i srog shing la skud par byed pa na longs pa'i phyir ni ma yin / rgyags pa'i phyir ni ma yin / cha ba'i phyir ni ma yin /
translated: Monks, for example, suppose a man were to smear oil on the axle of a chariot.🔽He would not do so for the sake of ornament,

original: brgyan pa'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: brgyan pa'i phyir ma yin /
translated: for the sake of decoration,🔽for the sake of display,

original: khal kho na theg par bya ba'i phyir yin /
analyzed: khal kho na theg par bya ba'i phyir yin /
translated: but only for the sake of carrying the load.

original: skyes bu rmas pa ser ba yang mar ram 'bru mar gyis rma la skud pa na longs pa'i phyir ma yin /🔽rgyags pa'i phyir ma yin /🔽cha ba'i @228b phyir ma yin /
analyzed: skyes bu rmas pa ser ba yang mar ram 'bru mar gyis rma la skud pa na longs pa'i phyir ma yin / rgyags pa'i phyir ma yin / cha ba'i @228b phyir ma yin /
translated: Suppose a man were to smear oil on a wound.🔽He would not do so for the sake of ornament,

original: brgyan ba'i phyir ma yin gyi /
analyzed: brgyan ba'i phyir ma yin gyi /
translated: for the sake of decoration,🔽for the sake of display,

original: rma kho na gso ba'i phyir yin no //
analyzed: rma kho na gso ba'i phyir yin no //
translated: but only for the sake of healing the wound.

original: de bzhin du rigs kyi bu dga' po yang longs pa'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du rigs kyi bu dga' po yang longs pa'i phyir ma yin /
translated: Likewise, son of noble family, Nanda does not eat for the sake of enjoyment,

original: rgyags pa'i phyir ma yin /🔽cha ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: rgyags pa'i phyir ma yin / cha ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: not for the sake of intoxication,🔽not for the sake of physical beauty,

original: brgyan pa'i phyir ma yin gyi /🔽lus 'di kho na gnas par bya ba'i phyir dang / gso ba'i phyir dang / bkres pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir dang / tshangs par spyod pa rjes su gzung ba'i phyir de lta bus tshor ba rnying ni gzhil bar bya la /
analyzed: brgyan pa'i phyir ma yin gyi / lus 'di kho na gnas par bya ba'i phyir dang / gso ba'i phyir dang / bkres pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir dang / tshangs par spyod pa rjes su gzung ba'i phyir de lta bus tshor ba rnying ni gzhil bar bya la /
translated: not for the sake of adornment.🔽But rather, in order to maintain this very body, in order to nourish it, in order to be free from hunger, and in order to maintain pure conduct, he eats food after careful consideration, thinking, “I will put an end to old feelings and not give rise to new feelings.

original: tshor ba gsar ni mi skye bar byas nas bdag 'tsho ba dang / stobs dang bde ba dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / reg par gnas par 'gyur ro zhes so sor brtags nas zas za'o zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba gsar ni mi skye bar byas nas bdag 'tsho ba dang / stobs dang bde ba dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / reg par gnas par 'gyur ro zhes so sor brtags nas zas za'o zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
translated: I will live, be strong, be free from illness, and live pleasantly.” This is the passage from the sutra.🔽All of this is for those who enjoy sense pleasures.

original: 'di thams cad ni 'dod pa la longs spyod pa kho na dag la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni slob dpon nyid kyi lugs rab tu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni 'dod pa la longs spyod pa kho na dag la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni slob dpon nyid kyi lugs rab tu bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the extensive explanation of the master’s own system.

original: 'di thams cad de longs pa'i phyir yin pa ni gzhon nu rnams lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'di thams cad de longs pa'i phyir yin pa ni gzhon nu rnams lta bu ste /
translated: All of this is because of indulgence, like young people.

original: de rnams ni dgod pa dang rtsed mo'i bsam pa nyid kyis longs pa'i phyir za'o zhes rgyas par bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni dgod pa dang rtsed mo'i bsam pa nyid kyis longs pa'i phyir za'o zhes rgyas par bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: They eat because of the intention to indulge, because of the intention to laugh and play, as explained at length.🔽Since all of this occurs only in the enjoyment of desire, one stops the function of food with the intention that is like the intention to laugh and play, and so on.

original: 'di thams cad ni 'dod pa la longs spyod pa kho na dag la 'byung bas dgod pa dang rtsed mo la sogs pa'i bsam pa de lta bu'i bsam pas zas kyi bya ba 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni 'dod pa la longs spyod pa kho na dag la 'byung bas dgod pa dang rtsed mo la sogs pa'i bsam pa de lta bu'i bsam pas zas kyi bya ba 'gog par byed do //
translated: One should understand that the intention to laugh and play, and so on, is the intention to enjoy the body.

original: lus 'di kho na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: lus 'di kho na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The intention to enjoy the body is the intention to indulge the body.🔽The intention to indulge the body is the intention to indulge the five senses.🔽The intention to indulge the five senses is the intention to indulge desire.🔽The intention to indulge desire is the intention to laugh and play, and so on.🔽The intention to laugh and play, and so on, is the intention to stop the function of food.

original: lus 'di kho na gnas par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni lus 'di 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: lus 'di kho na gnas par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni lus 'di 'ba' zhig go //
translated: The intention to stop the function of food is the intention to abandon desire.🔽The intention to abandon desire is the intention to abandon the five senses.🔽The intention to abandon the five senses is the intention to abandon the body.

original: gnas bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni srog yod par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni srog yod par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The intention to abandon the body is the intention to abandon the life force.

original: gso ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni stobs yod par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gso ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni stobs yod par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The intention to abandon the life force is the intention to abandon strength.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: shing rta'i srog shing bsku ba bzhin te /
analyzed: shing rta'i srog shing bsku ba bzhin te /
translated: Like the axle of a chariot.

original: longs pa'i phyir ma yin zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni bkres pa dang 'bral bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba zas 'dod pa ni bkres pa'o //🔽de dang bral ba ni bkres pa dang bral ba ste de'i phyir na /🔽bkres pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: longs pa'i phyir ma yin zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni bkres pa dang 'bral bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba zas 'dod pa ni bkres pa'o // de dang bral ba ni bkres pa dang bral ba ste de'i phyir na / bkres pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “not for the sake of enjoyment” means that one does not eat food for the sake of enjoyment, for the sake of physical beauty, for the sake of strength, and for the sake of the experience of pleasure.🔽The phrase “not for the sake of enjoyment” means that one does not eat food for the sake of enjoyment, for the sake of physical beauty, for the sake of strength, and for the sake of the experience of pleasure.

original: lus gnas pa dang / lus kyi stobs dang / lus kyi nyon mongs pa med pa de dag la brten nas zhes bya ba ni 'dir lus gnas pa dang / lus kyi stobs ni ji skad du bshad ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: lus gnas pa dang / lus kyi stobs dang / lus kyi nyon mongs pa med pa de dag la brten nas zhes bya ba ni 'dir lus gnas pa dang / lus kyi stobs ni ji skad du bshad ma thag pa'o //
translated: The phrase “not for the sake of enjoyment” means that one does not eat food for the sake of enjoyment, for the sake of physical beauty, for the sake of strength, and for the sake of the experience of pleasure.

original: lus kyi nyon mongs pa med pa ni zas 'dod pa'i sdug bsngal bzlog pa'i phyir ro //🔽'dis ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni lung phog pa 'dis so //
analyzed: lus kyi nyon mongs pa med pa ni zas 'dod pa'i sdug bsngal bzlog pa'i phyir ro // 'dis ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni lung phog pa 'dis so //
translated: The phrase “not for the sake of enjoyment” means that one does not eat food for the sake of enjoyment, for the sake of physical beauty, for the sake of strength, and for the sake of the experience of pleasure.🔽The phrase “not for the sake of enjoyment” means that one does not eat food for the sake of enjoyment, for the sake of physical beauty, for the sake of strength, and for the sake of the experience of pleasure.

original: @229a * // zas chung du yongs su spong bar byed pa ni bkres pas kun nas slong ba'i tshor ba gang yin pa zhes bya ba 'dis so //
analyzed: @229a * // zas chung du yongs su spong bar byed pa ni bkres pas kun nas slong ba'i tshor ba gang yin pa zhes bya ba 'dis so //
translated: The phrase “not for the sake of enjoyment” means that one does not eat food for the sake of enjoyment, for the sake of physical beauty, for the sake of strength, and for the sake of the experience of pleasure.🔽The phrase “not for the sake of enjoyment” means that one does not eat food for the sake of enjoyment, for the sake of physical beauty, for the sake of strength, and for the sake of the experience of pleasure.🔽The phrase “not for the sake of enjoyment” means that one does not eat food for the sake of enjoyment, for the sake of physical beauty, for the sake of strength, and for the sake of the experience of pleasure.🔽The phrase “not for the sake of enjoyment” means that one does not eat food for the sake of enjoyment, for the sake of physical beauty, for the sake of strength

original: zas lhag par za bar byed pa yongs su spong par byed pa ni ha cang bza' ba drags pa las skye ba gang yin pa zhes bya ba 'dis so //
analyzed: zas lhag par za bar byed pa yongs su spong par byed pa ni ha cang bza' ba drags pa las skye ba gang yin pa zhes bya ba 'dis so //
translated: One abandons eating excessively, which is that arising from eating too much.

original: de lta bus zhes smos pa ni de lta bus tshor ba rnying ni zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: de lta bus zhes smos pa ni de lta bus tshor ba rnying ni zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: The phrase “in that way” refers to “the old feeling is in that way.”

original: de dag kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'tsho ba dang stobs dang bde ba de dag kyang lus la gnas pa la sogs pa sngar bstan pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'tsho ba dang stobs dang bde ba de dag kyang lus la gnas pa la sogs pa sngar bstan pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Those, i.e., the life, strength, and happiness, are the previously mentioned “abiding of the body, etc.”

original: lus gnas pa dang / stobs dang / bkres pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: lus gnas pa dang / stobs dang / bkres pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The abiding of the body, strength, and freedom from hunger.

original: de dag kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid dang / reg par gnas pa de dag kyang tshangs par spyod pa rjes su bzung ba sngar bstan pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid dang / reg par gnas pa de dag kyang tshangs par spyod pa rjes su bzung ba sngar bstan pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Those, i.e., the absence of demerit and the abiding of contact, are the previously mentioned “the acceptance of pure conduct.”

original: 'phags pa'i las sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i las sgrub pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of the ārya’s action.

original: de la skyon ni lnga dag ste zhes bya ba ni de la ha cang bza' drags pa las skyon lnga de dag ste /
analyzed: de la skyon ni lnga dag ste zhes bya ba ni de la ha cang bza' drags pa las skyon lnga de dag ste /
translated: The verse states, “There are five faults in that regard.” The five faults arise from eating too much.

original: sems las byung ba snyom pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems las byung ba snyom pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: They are mental factors such as lethargy.

original: de la snyom pa ni ha cang bza' drags pa las gnyid kyi rnam pa 'ga' zhig 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de la snyom pa ni ha cang bza' drags pa las gnyid kyi rnam pa 'ga' zhig 'byung ba'o //
translated: Lethargy is a type of sleepiness that arises from eating too much.

original: mi dga' ba ni de nyid kyi phyir stan la sogs pa dag la'o //
analyzed: mi dga' ba ni de nyid kyi phyir stan la sogs pa dag la'o //
translated: Discontent is the desire for more food and drink.

original: glal ba ni sems las byung ba'i chos gang zhig yod na ha cang bza' drags pa las lus rnam par shig shig bor gyis pa'o //
analyzed: glal ba ni sems las byung ba'i chos gang zhig yod na ha cang bza' drags pa las lus rnam par shig shig bor gyis pa'o //
translated: Yawning is a mental factor that causes the body to shake from eating too much.

original: zas kyis gsud pa nyid ni gang zhig yod na ha cang bza' drags pa las spos te 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: zas kyis gsud pa nyid ni gang zhig yod na ha cang bza' drags pa las spos te 'dug pa'o //
translated: Satiation is the desire to lie down from eating too much.

original: sems zhum pa nyid ni gang zhig yod nas ha cang bza' drags pa las sems las su mi rung zhing sems blun pa'o //
analyzed: sems zhum pa nyid ni gang zhig yod nas ha cang bza' drags pa las sems las su mi rung zhing sems blun pa'o //
translated: Mental lassitude is the unserviceability and dullness of the mind from eating too much.

original: de ltar na bsam pa gang gis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ji skad bstan pa de ltar na bsam pa gang gis te /
analyzed: de ltar na bsam pa gang gis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ji skad bstan pa de ltar na bsam pa gang gis te /
translated: By what intention, as previously explained, does one not eat?

original: longs pa nyid kyi bsam pa nas brgyan pa'i bsam pa'i bar gyis mi bza' ba ste /
analyzed: longs pa nyid kyi bsam pa nas brgyan pa'i bsam pa'i bar gyis mi bza' ba ste /
translated: By the intention of satiety, up to the intention of adornment.

original: de la so sor brtags nas zas za ba'i phyir so sor brtags nas zas za ba yin no //
analyzed: de la so sor brtags nas zas za ba'i phyir so sor brtags nas zas za ba yin no //
translated: Here, one eats food after careful consideration, thus one eats food after careful consideration.

original: bsam pa gang gis yin pa ni lus 'di kho na gnas par bya ba'i phyir dang / gso ba'i phyir dang / bkris pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir dang / tshangs par spyod pa rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: bsam pa gang gis yin pa ni lus 'di kho na gnas par bya ba'i phyir dang / gso ba'i phyir dang / bkris pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir dang / tshangs par spyod pa rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: By what intention? One should say: in order to maintain this very body, in order to care for it, in order to be without misfortune, and in order to maintain pure conduct.

original: de la so sor brtags nas zas za ba'i phyir so sor brtags nas zas za ba yin no //
analyzed: de la so sor brtags nas zas za ba'i phyir so sor brtags nas zas za ba yin no //
translated: Here, one eats food after careful consideration, thus one eats food after careful consideration.

original: tshod ji tsam du bza' ba zhes bya ba ni de lta bus tshor ba rnying ni gzhil bar bya la /
analyzed: tshod ji tsam du bza' ba zhes bya ba ni de lta bus tshor ba rnying ni gzhil bar bya la /
translated: How much should one eat? One should say: to the extent that one alleviates old feelings and does not create new feelings.

original: tshor ba gsar ni mi skye bar @229b bya ba ste /
analyzed: tshor ba gsar ni mi skye bar @229b bya ba ste /
translated: One should not generate new feelings.

original: de la so sor brtags nas zas za ba'i phyir so sor brtags nas za ba'o //
analyzed: de la so sor brtags nas zas za ba'i phyir so sor brtags nas za ba'o //
translated: One eats in moderation because one eats after careful consideration of the food.

original: zas la tshod zin pa'i phan yon gang yin pa ste bdag 'tsho ba ste /
analyzed: zas la tshod zin pa'i phan yon gang yin pa ste bdag 'tsho ba ste /
translated: The benefit of eating in moderation is that one lives with strength,

original: stobs dang / bde ba dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / reg pa la gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: stobs dang / bde ba dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / reg pa la gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: happiness, and without reproach, and one abides in contact with feelings.

original: de la so sor brtags nas zas za ba'i phyir so sor brtags nas zas za ba'o //🔽gzhan dag na re so sor brtags pa bzhi dag gis zhes bya ba brgyas par 'byung ba ni gzhan dag na re so sor brtags pa bzhi dag gis so sor brtags nas zas za ba ste /
analyzed: de la so sor brtags nas zas za ba'i phyir so sor brtags nas zas za ba'o // gzhan dag na re so sor brtags pa bzhi dag gis zhes bya ba brgyas par 'byung ba ni gzhan dag na re so sor brtags pa bzhi dag gis so sor brtags nas zas za ba ste /
translated: One eats in moderation because one eats after careful consideration of the food.🔽Others say that one eats in moderation because of four kinds of careful consideration.🔽Others say that one eats in moderation because of four kinds of careful consideration.

original: de lta bu ni so sor brtags nas zas za ba yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: de lta bu ni so sor brtags nas zas za ba yin no zhes zer te /
translated: One eats in moderation because of four kinds of careful consideration.

original: so sor brtags pa bzhi po de dag kyang spong bar bya ba so sor brtags pa ni 'di ni bla na med pa zhes so sor brtags pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: so sor brtags pa bzhi po de dag kyang spong bar bya ba so sor brtags pa ni 'di ni bla na med pa zhes so sor brtags pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: 1) the discrimination of rejection, which is the discrimination of what is unsurpassed,

original: de ni longs pa'i phyir ma yin pa dang / brgyan pa'i phyir ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i bar tshig bzhi dag gis so //
analyzed: de ni longs pa'i phyir ma yin pa dang / brgyan pa'i phyir ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i bar tshig bzhi dag gis so //
translated: and which is indicated by the four phrases beginning with “not for the sake of enjoyment” and ending with “not for the sake of adornment.”

original: ched so sor brtags pa ni bya ba'i don so sor brtags pa ste /🔽de yang lus 'di kho na gnas par bya ba'i phyir dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: ched so sor brtags pa ni bya ba'i don so sor brtags pa ste / de yang lus 'di kho na gnas par bya ba'i phyir dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: 2) The discrimination of purpose is the discrimination of the meaning of what is to be done.

original: tshangs par spyod pa rjes su gzung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i bar tshig bzhi dag gis so //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa rjes su gzung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i bar tshig bzhi dag gis so //
translated: And that is indicated by the four phrases beginning with “for the sake of maintaining this very body” and ending with “for the sake of supporting pure conduct.”

original: tshod gzung ba so sor brtags pa ni de lta bus tshor ba rnyid pa ni gzhil bar bya la /🔽tshor ba gsar ba ni mi skye bar byas na zhes bya ba gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: tshod gzung ba so sor brtags pa ni de lta bus tshor ba rnyid pa ni gzhil bar bya la / tshor ba gsar ba ni mi skye bar byas na zhes bya ba gnyis kyis so //
translated: 3) The discrimination of measure is the discrimination of the measure of food.🔽And that is indicated by the two phrases beginning with “I will allay the discomfort of this body” and ending with “I will maintain it.”🔽4) The discrimination of the benefits of moderation is the discrimination of the benefits of moderation.

original: tshod zin pa'i phan yon so sor brtags pa ni bdag 'tsho ba dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: tshod zin pa'i phan yon so sor brtags pa ni bdag 'tsho ba dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: And that is indicated by the two phrases beginning with “I will live healthily” and ending with “I will live happily.”

original: reg par gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar tshig lhag ma rnams kyis so //
analyzed: reg par gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar tshig lhag ma rnams kyis so //
translated: The remaining words are for the purpose of showing the manner of abiding.

original: yong ni zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyi dgongs pa'i don ston pa yin te /
analyzed: yong ni zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyi dgongs pa'i don ston pa yin te /
translated: “Indeed” shows the meaning intended by the master.

original: tshig bzhi dag gis ni longs pa'i phyir ma yin pa nas brgyan pa'i phyir ma yin zhes bya ba'i bar 'di dag gis so //
analyzed: tshig bzhi dag gis ni longs pa'i phyir ma yin pa nas brgyan pa'i phyir ma yin zhes bya ba'i bar 'di dag gis so //
translated: The first four words are for the purpose of showing that the body is not to be used for the sake of pleasure, etc.

original: gsum dag gis ni lus 'di kho na gnas par bya ba'i phyir dang / gso ba'i phyir dang / bkres pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di dag gis so //
analyzed: gsum dag gis ni lus 'di kho na gnas par bya ba'i phyir dang / gso ba'i phyir dang / bkres pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di dag gis so //
translated: The next three words are for the purpose of showing that the body is to be used for the sake of abiding in this very life, for the sake of nourishing the body, and for the sake of freedom from hunger.

original: tshig gcig gis ni tshangs bar spyod rjes su gzung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis so //
analyzed: tshig gcig gis ni tshangs bar spyod rjes su gzung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis so //
translated: The next one word is for the purpose of showing that the body is to be used for the sake of maintaining pure conduct.

original: tshig lnga dag gis ni de lta bus tshor ba rnying ni gzhil bar bya la zhes bya ba nas bde ba dang zhes bya ba'i bar 'di dag gis so //
analyzed: tshig lnga dag gis ni de lta bus tshor ba rnying ni gzhil bar bya la zhes bya ba nas bde ba dang zhes bya ba'i bar 'di dag gis so //
translated: The next five words are for the purpose of showing that the body is to be used for the sake of alleviating old feelings, for the sake of not producing new feelings, for the sake of curing illness, for the sake of experiencing pleasure, and for the sake of experiencing the pleasure of meditation.

original: gnyis kyis ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni tshig gnyis po kha na mtho ba med pa dang / reg pa la gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di gnyis kyis te /🔽dbu ma'i lam gyis sgrub pa'i @230a * //
analyzed: gnyis kyis ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni tshig gnyis po kha na mtho ba med pa dang / reg pa la gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di gnyis kyis te / dbu ma'i lam gyis sgrub pa'i @230a * //
translated: The two lines beginning “Two” indicate the two lines “without offense” and “abiding in contact” as the two.

original: phan yon no //
analyzed: phan yon no //
translated: This is the benefit of establishing the middle way.🔽The two examples of the axle of a chariot and a wound are applied as before.

original: shing rta'i srog shing dang rma'i dpe gnyis ni sngar sbyar ba kho na ni chos mthun par sngar bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: shing rta'i srog shing dang rma'i dpe gnyis ni sngar sbyar ba kho na ni chos mthun par sngar bstan pa nyid do //
translated: The similarity of the Dharma is taught as before.

original: de la rigs kyi bu dga' bo dran pa dang shes bzhin ma chog dang ldan pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la rigs kyi bu dga' bo dran pa dang shes bzhin ma chog dang ldan pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: “Son of good family, this is how Nanda is endowed with mindfulness and introspection.

original: dge slong dag rigs kyi bu dga' bo ni /
analyzed: dge slong dag rigs kyi bu dga' bo ni /
translated: Bhikṣus, the son of good family Nanda,

original: gal te shar phyogs su rnam par lta na /
analyzed: gal te shar phyogs su rnam par lta na /
translated: if he looks to the east,

original: de sems thams cad kyis bsams nas rnam par lta'o //
analyzed: de sems thams cad kyis bsams nas rnam par lta'o //
translated: he looks with all his mind.

original: de de ltar rnam par lta ba na brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams sems la rjes su mi 'dzag par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de de ltar rnam par lta ba na brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams sems la rjes su mi 'dzag par 'gyur la /
translated: When he looks in that way, covetousness, mental dissatisfaction, and sinful, unwholesome dharmas do not flow into his mind.

original: gal te lho dang nub dang byang phyogs su rnam par lta na yang sems thams cad kyis bsams nas rnam par lta'o //
analyzed: gal te lho dang nub dang byang phyogs su rnam par lta na yang sems thams cad kyis bsams nas rnam par lta'o //
translated: If he looks to the south, west, or north, he looks with full awareness.

original: de de ltar rnam par lta ba na snga ma bzhin du sems la rjes su mi 'dzag pa'i bar du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de de ltar rnam par lta ba na snga ma bzhin du sems la rjes su mi 'dzag pa'i bar du 'gyur te /
translated: When he looks in this way, his mind does not get caught up in anything, as before.

original: dge slong dag rigs kyi bu dga' bo'i tshor ba yang shes bzhin du skye /
analyzed: dge slong dag rigs kyi bu dga' bo'i tshor ba yang shes bzhin du skye /
translated: “Bhikṣus, the feelings of the son of a good family Nanda arise with full awareness.

original: shes bzhin du gnas /
analyzed: shes bzhin du gnas /
translated: They remain with full awareness.

original: shes bzhin du nub pa dang / zad pa dang gtugs par 'gyur la /🔽'du shes kyang shes bzhin du skye /
analyzed: shes bzhin du nub pa dang / zad pa dang gtugs par 'gyur la / 'du shes kyang shes bzhin du skye /
translated: They disappear, end, and vanish with full awareness.🔽His perceptions arise with full awareness.

original: rnam par rtog pa yang shes bzhin du skye /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yang shes bzhin du skye /
translated: His thoughts arise with full awareness.

original: shes bzhin du gnas /
analyzed: shes bzhin du gnas /
translated: They remain with full awareness.🔽They disappear, end, and vanish with full awareness.”

original: shes bzhin du nub ba dang / zad pa dang / gzugs par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
analyzed: shes bzhin du nub ba dang / zad pa dang / gzugs par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
translated: This is the section on the sūtra passage.

original: rigs kyi bu dga' bo dran pa dang shes bzhin mchod dang ldan pa ni 'di yin te zhes bya ba ni dran pa mchog dang ldan pa dang shes bzhin mchog dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dga' bo dran pa dang shes bzhin mchod dang ldan pa ni 'di yin te zhes bya ba ni dran pa mchog dang ldan pa dang shes bzhin mchog dang ldan pa'o //
translated: This, son of noble family, is mindfulness and introspection. Mindfulness is the highest mindfulness. Introspection is wisdom.

original: de la dran pa ni dran pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la dran pa ni dran pa nyid do //
translated: Here, mindfulness is just mindfulness.

original: shes bzhin ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: shes bzhin ni shes rab bo //
translated: Introspection is wisdom.

original: sems thams cad kyis bsams nas zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa byas te'o //
analyzed: sems thams cad kyis bsams nas zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa byas te'o //
translated: Having reflected with all the minds means having performed the foundations of mindfulness.

original: rgyu ba na yin par rig par bya'o bya ba ni bsod snyoms la rgyu ban yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
analyzed: rgyu ba na yin par rig par bya'o bya ba ni bsod snyoms la rgyu ban yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
translated: One should know that it is when moving, which means one should know that it is when moving for alms.

original: de de ltar rnam par lta ba na bran ba sems dang / yid mi bde ba dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams sems la rjes su mi 'dzag par 'gyur ba ni dmigs pa gzugs dang / sgra la sogs pa la rnam par shes pa skye ba na chos de dag sems la rje su mi 'dzag bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de de ltar rnam par lta ba na bran ba sems dang / yid mi bde ba dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams sems la rjes su mi 'dzag par 'gyur ba ni dmigs pa gzugs dang / sgra la sogs pa la rnam par shes pa skye ba na chos de dag sems la rje su mi 'dzag bar 'gyur /
translated: When he observes in that way, the defilements, mental dissatisfaction, and sinful unwholesome phenomena do not flow into the mind. When consciousness arises in relation to the observed forms, sounds, etc., those phenomena do not flow into the mind.

original: rje su mi 'brang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rje su mi 'brang bar 'gyur te /
translated: Who would not follow the Exalted One?

original: de dang lhan cig mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not that they do not occur together.

original: go rims bzhin no zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan la gnas pan ni tshor ba shes bzhin pa yin la /
analyzed: go rims bzhin no zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan la gnas pan ni tshor ba shes bzhin pa yin la /
translated: In accordance with the order, when one is established in the absorptions, one is mindful of feeling.

original: gzugs med pa la gnas pa na ni 'du shes shes bzhin pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa la gnas pa na ni 'du shes shes bzhin pa yin te /
translated: When one is established in the formless states, one is mindful of perception.

original: bsam gtan rnams ni tshor bas rab tu phye ba yin la /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams ni tshor bas rab tu phye ba yin la /
translated: The absorptions are distinguished by feeling,

original: gzugs med pa rnams @230b ni 'du shes kyis rab tu phye ba yin pas so //
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams @230b ni 'du shes kyis rab tu phye ba yin pas so //
translated: and the formless states are distinguished by perception.

original: ji ltar na de dag shes bzhin pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na de dag shes bzhin pa yin zhe na /
translated: How are they mindful?

original: gal te de dag gis zil gyis mi non na'o //🔽gsum 'dus pa las reg pa 'byung ba'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa 'byung ba gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa gsum 'dus pa las tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang /
analyzed: gal te de dag gis zil gyis mi non na'o // gsum 'dus pa las reg pa 'byung ba'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa 'byung ba gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa gsum 'dus pa las tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang /
translated: If they are not overwhelmed by them.🔽The condition of contact that arises from the convergence of the three is the cause of the arising of feeling, perception, and intention.

original: sems pa 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems pa 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The condition of contact that arises from the convergence of the three is the cause of the arising of feeling, perception, and intention.

original: sems pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'dir rnam par rtog pa yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la rnam par rtog pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: sems pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'dir rnam par rtog pa yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la rnam par rtog pa ni gnyis te /
translated: The characteristic of intention should be understood here as conception. Conception is twofold:

original: shes rab kyi mtshan nyid dang / sems pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi mtshan nyid dang / sems pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the characteristic of wisdom and the characteristic of intention.

original: de la shes rab kyi mtshan nyid ni de khon shes par bya ba'i phyir spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de la shes rab kyi mtshan nyid ni de khon shes par bya ba'i phyir spyod pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of wisdom is the activity of understanding reality.

original: sems pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig bya'o snyam du sems mngon par 'du byed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: sems pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig bya'o snyam du sems mngon par 'du byed pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The characteristic of intention is the mental activity that thinks, “I will do this or that.”

original: de la tshor ba dang / 'di shes dang sems pa zhes bya ba 'di rnams las sems pa ni rnam par rtog pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la tshor ba dang / 'di shes dang sems pa zhes bya ba 'di rnams las sems pa ni rnam par rtog pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Among these, feeling, perception, and intention, intention should be understood as conception.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni rnam grangs gzhan yang sems thams cad kyis bsam nas rnam par lta ba'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa ni rnam par lta ba kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni rnam grangs gzhan yang sems thams cad kyis bsam nas rnam par lta ba'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa ni rnam par lta ba kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa ste /
translated: Moreover, the absence of afflictions in the view is the absence of afflictions in the view.

original: de'i phyir gzugs la dran pa dang shes bzhin mchog dan ldan pa nyid yin par yongs su ston pa yin no /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs la dran pa dang shes bzhin mchog dan ldan pa nyid yin par yongs su ston pa yin no /
translated: Therefore, it is the supreme mindfulness and vigilance with regard to form that is being taught.

original: shes bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa skye ba la sogs pa nyid kyi tshor ba dang / 'di shes dang 'du byed rnams la dran pa dang shes bzhin mchog dang ldan pa nyid yin par yongs su ston pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: shes bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa skye ba la sogs pa nyid kyi tshor ba dang / 'di shes dang 'du byed rnams la dran pa dang shes bzhin mchog dang ldan pa nyid yin par yongs su ston pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is the supreme mindfulness and vigilance with regard to the arising, etc. of feeling, etc. when one is fully aware.

original: shes bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa dag ni tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams so //
analyzed: shes bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa dag ni tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams so //
translated: Feeling, perception, and the formative forces are feeling, perception, and the formative forces.

original: skye ba la sogs pa dag ni skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / zag pa rnams te /🔽'di la de yod pas na shes bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa skye ba la sogs pa'o //🔽de'i dngos po ni shes bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa skye ba la sogs pa nyid do /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa dag ni skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / zag pa rnams te / 'di la de yod pas na shes bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa skye ba la sogs pa'o // de'i dngos po ni shes bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa skye ba la sogs pa nyid do /
translated: Arising, etc. are birth, continuance, senescence and impermanence.🔽Since these exist in this, there is the arising, etc. of feeling, etc. when one is fully aware.🔽The state of that is the arising, etc. of feeling, etc. when one is fully aware.

original: shes bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa skye ba la sogs pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: shes bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa skye ba la sogs pa nyid kyis so //
translated: It is through the arising, etc. of feeling, etc. when one is fully aware.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba rgyas bar 'byung ba ni ji skad bstan pa de ltar na rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi dag ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba dang tshor bar nye bar 'gro ba dang / 'du shes su nye bar 'gro ba dang /🔽'du byed du nye bar 'gro ba dag la dran pa dang shes bzhin mchog dang ldan pa @231a * //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba rgyas bar 'byung ba ni ji skad bstan pa de ltar na rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi dag ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba dang tshor bar nye bar 'gro ba dang / 'du shes su nye bar 'gro ba dang / 'du byed du nye bar 'gro ba dag la dran pa dang shes bzhin mchog dang ldan pa @231a * //
translated: Thus, as extensively explained, the four abodes of consciousness are the abodes of consciousness that approach form, that approach feeling, that approach discernment and that approach formation.🔽They possess supreme mindfulness and supreme vigilance.🔽

original: nyid yin par yongs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nyid yin par yongs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, as extensively explained, since the four abodes of consciousness are taught in this way, they are taught to be the supreme mindfulness and supreme vigilance with regard to the abodes of consciousness that approach form, that approach feeling, that approach discernment and that approach formation.

original: dge slong dag rgyal po legs mthong chen po ni ha cang mi grang zhing /
analyzed: dge slong dag rgyal po legs mthong chen po ni ha cang mi grang zhing /
translated: Monks, King Mahāsudarśana was not too cold,

original: ha cang mi dro ba dang / dus tshigs bde ba dang / gnod pa med pa dang / gang gis na des zos pa dang / 'thungs pa dang / 'chos pa dang / myangs pa rnams legs par bde bar 'ju ste /
analyzed: ha cang mi dro ba dang / dus tshigs bde ba dang / gnod pa med pa dang / gang gis na des zos pa dang / 'thungs pa dang / 'chos pa dang / myangs pa rnams legs par bde bar 'ju ste /
translated: not too hot, had pleasant seasons, was not harmful, and by which whatever he ate, drank, consumed, and tasted was well digested with ease.

original: pho ba'i drod snyoms shing 'ju bar byed pa dang ldan pas gnod pa nyung ba dang / nad med pa'i rang bzhin du gyur to zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
analyzed: pho ba'i drod snyoms shing 'ju bar byed pa dang ldan pas gnod pa nyung ba dang / nad med pa'i rang bzhin du gyur to zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
translated: Because of that, he has little illness and is by nature free from disease.🔽Because of that, he has little illness and is by nature free from disease.
