original: spong par byed la sel bar byed cing byang bar byed do zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
analyzed: spong par byed la sel bar byed cing byang bar byed do zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
translated: but abandons it, dispels it, and clears it away. This is the passage from the sutra.

original: de la 'dod pa la rnam par rtog pa byung ba zhes bya ba la 'dod pa'i gzhi ni 'dod pa rnams te /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa la rnam par rtog pa byung ba zhes bya ba la 'dod pa'i gzhi ni 'dod pa rnams te /
translated: In this passage, “a conceptual thought of sensuality arises” means that sensuality is the basis of sensuality.

original: gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya rnams so //
translated: Sensuality is the objects of sense desire, namely, forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and tangible things.

original: de la dmigs par byed pa'i sems mngon par 'du byed pa ni 'dod pa la rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: de la dmigs par byed pa'i sems mngon par 'du byed pa ni 'dod pa la rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: The mental activity that takes them as its object is a conceptual thought of sensuality.

original: 'dod pa la rnam par rtog pa de spong bar byed do //
analyzed: 'dod pa la rnam par rtog pa de spong bar byed do //
translated: He abandons the conceptual thought of sensuality.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: de'i dmigs pa'i mtshan ma sel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa'i mtshan ma sel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: By eliminating the sign of its object.

original: 'dod pa la rnam par rtog pa de'i dmigs pa ni de'i dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa la rnam par rtog pa de'i dmigs pa ni de'i dmigs pa'o //
translated: The object of that conceptual thought of sensuality is its object.

original: mtshan ma ni don gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa 'du shes kyis yongs su gcad par bya ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma ni don gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa 'du shes kyis yongs su gcad par bya ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The sign is the object, form, sound, etc. , which is discriminated by perception.

original: de'i dmigs pa la brten pa'i mtshan ma ni de'i dmigs pa'i mtshan ma ste /
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa la brten pa'i mtshan ma ni de'i dmigs pa'i mtshan ma ste /
translated: The sign of its object is the sign of that object.

original: de sel ba ni yid la mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: de sel ba ni yid la mi byed pa'o //
translated: Its elimination is non-attention to it.

original: de'i gnyen bo bsgoms pas de'i dmigs pa'i mtshan ma sel ba ste /
analyzed: de'i gnyen bo bsgoms pas de'i dmigs pa'i mtshan ma sel ba ste /
translated: By cultivating its antidote, the sign of its object is eliminated.

original: de ci'i phyir na de'i dmigs pa'i mtshan ma sel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir na de'i dmigs pa'i mtshan ma sel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is that? Because the sign of its object is eliminated.

original: bzlog tu zin kyang rgyu bsags pa las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bzlog tu zin kyang rgyu bsags pa las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Even though it is eliminated, the conceptual thought that arises from the accumulation of its cause is called “arisen from the cause.

original: rgyu ni de'i bag chags yin pas sel bar byed do //
analyzed: rgyu ni de'i bag chags yin pas sel bar byed do //
translated: ” Since the cause is its residual impression, it is eliminated.

original: ji lta zhe na /🔽sel bar byed /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na / sel bar byed /
translated: How?🔽It is eliminated.

original: 'dor bar byed de /
analyzed: 'dor bar byed de /
translated: It is abandoned.

original: so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis rgyun gcod pa'i phyir ro //🔽don 'di nyid 'di dag gzhi ni rnam par rtog la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'i tshigs su bcad par sdebs pa yin no //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis rgyun gcod pa'i phyir ro // don 'di nyid 'di dag gzhi ni rnam par rtog la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'i tshigs su bcad par sdebs pa yin no //
translated: because they are eliminated by the power of analytical discrimination.🔽This very point is expressed in the verse:

original: 'di dag gzhi ni dang du mi len cing zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs pa gang yin pa ni'o //
analyzed: 'di dag gzhi ni dang du mi len cing zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs pa gang yin pa ni'o //
translated: “They do not tolerate the basis of these, etc.

original: rnam par rtog pa la mi mthun par byed pas na dang du len pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la mi mthun par byed pas na dang du len pa ma yin no //
translated: They do not tolerate conceptualization because they oppose it.

original: de'i rgyu rnam par spong ba'i phyir na spong bar byed pa yin no //🔽rgyun gcod pa'i phyir na sel bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rgyu rnam par spong ba'i phyir na spong bar byed pa yin no // rgyun gcod pa'i phyir na sel bar byed pa yin no //
translated: They eliminate it because they abandon its cause.🔽They remove it because they interrupt its continuity.

original: rjes su 'ching ba gcod pa'i phyir na byung bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'ching ba gcod pa'i phyir na byung bar byed pa yin no //
translated: They destroy it because they sever its bond.

original: skyon nyid du 'dzin pa'i phyir na dang du mi len pa yin no //
analyzed: skyon nyid du 'dzin pa'i phyir na dang du mi len pa yin no //
translated: They do not tolerate it because they apprehend it as a fault.

original: ji ltar na skyon nyid du 'dzin pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na skyon nyid du 'dzin pa yin zhe na /
translated: How do they apprehend it as a fault?

original: bdag 'dod pa la rnam par rtog pa 'byung ba ni bdag la gnod pa dang / gzhan la gnod pa dang / gnyi ga la gnod par 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: bdag 'dod pa la rnam par rtog pa 'byung ba ni bdag la gnod pa dang / gzhan la gnod pa dang / gnyi ga la gnod par 'gyur ba yin /
translated: The thought of desire that occurs in the self is harmful to oneself, harmful to others, and harmful to both.

original: mthong ba'i chos la kha na ma tho ba 'phel ba yin zhing /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la kha na ma tho ba 'phel ba yin zhing /
translated: It increases the demerit of this life.

original: tshe phyi ma la kha na ma tho ba 'phel ba yin no //
analyzed: tshe phyi ma la kha na ma tho ba 'phel ba yin no //
translated: It increases the demerit of the next life.🔽It increases the demerit of both this life and the next.

original: mthong ba'i chos dang tshe phyi ma la kha na ma tho ba 'phel ba yin la de las skyes pa'i sems las byung ba sdug bsngal dang / @233a * //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos dang tshe phyi ma la kha na ma tho ba 'phel ba yin la de las skyes pa'i sems las byung ba sdug bsngal dang / @233a * //
translated: It produces suffering and mental dissatisfaction born from that.

original: yid mi bde ba yang so sor nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro zhes rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba yang so sor nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro zhes rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The Sūtra Elaborating the Negations says:

original: bram ze'i khye'u sems can rnams ni las bdag gir bya ba /🔽las kyi bgo skal la spyod pa /🔽las kyi skye gnas pa /
analyzed: bram ze'i khye'u sems can rnams ni las bdag gir bya ba / las kyi bgo skal la spyod pa / las kyi skye gnas pa /
translated: Brahmin, sentient beings are the owners of their actions.🔽They experience the results of their actions.🔽They have actions as their womb.

original: las la ston pa /
analyzed: las la ston pa /
translated: They have actions as their refuge.

original: las kyis sems can rnams la mthon po dang / dma' ba dang / ngan pa dang / gya nom pa 'ged par byed pa dag yin no zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
analyzed: las kyis sems can rnams la mthon po dang / dma' ba dang / ngan pa dang / gya nom pa 'ged par byed pa dag yin no zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
translated: This is a passage from a sutra.

original: bgo skal te longs spyod don du gnyer bar byed ces bya ba la bgo skal ni longs spyod ces bya ba 'dis ston bar byed do //
analyzed: bgo skal te longs spyod don du gnyer bar byed ces bya ba la bgo skal ni longs spyod ces bya ba 'dis ston bar byed do //
translated: The word “share” is used to indicate “enjoyment.”

original: bdag gi skye ba'i khyad par don du nger bar byed pa ni lha dang mi la sogs pa rnams su'o //
analyzed: bdag gi skye ba'i khyad par don du nger bar byed pa ni lha dang mi la sogs pa rnams su'o //
translated: One seeks a special birth for oneself among gods, humans, and so on.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: As the text says,

original: de ltar byed pa na ste /🔽lha rnams la bgo skal te longs spyod dang bdag gi skye ba'i khyad par don du gnyer bar byed cing /
analyzed: de ltar byed pa na ste / lha rnams la bgo skal te longs spyod dang bdag gi skye ba'i khyad par don du gnyer bar byed cing /
translated: “One who acts in this way🔽seeks a share of enjoyment and a special birth for oneself among the gods.🔽When one’s own life is in decline, one seeks to propitiate the gods.

original: bdag rgud par gyur na lha rnams la ston pa yin par rten par byed pa na lha rgyu ma yin pa la rgyur lta bas bslus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag rgud par gyur na lha rnams la ston pa yin par rten par byed pa na lha rgyu ma yin pa la rgyur lta bas bslus par 'gyur ro //
translated: One is deceived by the view that noncauses are causes.

original: sems can rnams kyi las khon bdag gir bya ba yin zhing zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba na /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi las khon bdag gir bya ba yin zhing zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba na /
translated: “The karma of sentient beings is to be taken as one’s own.”

original: las kho na ston pa yin gyi lha rnams ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa 'di la rigs pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: las kho na ston pa yin gyi lha rnams ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa 'di la rigs pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the logic of the statement that karma alone is the teacher, not the gods?

original: las ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: las ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Karma is the teacher,

original: las ni rgyal po dang / chom rkun dang / lha dang / mi la sogs pa rnams dang / thun mongs ma yin pa'i phyir dang / las ni shi ba'i tshe yang mi gtong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las ni rgyal po dang / chom rkun dang / lha dang / mi la sogs pa rnams dang / thun mongs ma yin pa'i phyir dang / las ni shi ba'i tshe yang mi gtong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because karma is not shared in common with kings, thieves, gods, humans, and so on, and because karma does not abandon one at the time of death.

original: sems can rnams kyi las kho na bdag gir bya ba yin gyi nor dang / khyim dang / bu dang chung ma la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi las kho na bdag gir bya ba yin gyi nor dang / khyim dang / bu dang chung ma la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The karma of sentient beings is to be taken as one’s own, but not wealth, home, sons, wives, and so on.

original: de rnams ni rgyal po la sogs pa dang thun mong yin pa'i phyir dang / shi ba'i tshe yang gtong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams ni rgyal po la sogs pa dang thun mong yin pa'i phyir dang / shi ba'i tshe yang gtong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because these are shared in common with kings and so on, and because they abandon one at the time of death.

original: lha la gus pa rnams longs spyod rgud par dmigs pa'i phyir dang / lha la ma gus pa rnams la longs spyod phun sum tshogs par dmigs pa'i phyir sems can rnams ni sngon gyi las kyi bgo skal la spyod cing za ba yin no //🔽lha la gus pa dang ma gus pa rnams la go rims bzhin du skye ba dman pa dang khyad par du 'phags pa dmigs pa'i phyir de rnams ni las kho na'i skye gnas las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: lha la gus pa rnams longs spyod rgud par dmigs pa'i phyir dang / lha la ma gus pa rnams la longs spyod phun sum tshogs par dmigs pa'i phyir sems can rnams ni sngon gyi las kyi bgo skal la spyod cing za ba yin no // lha la gus pa dang ma gus pa rnams la go rims bzhin du skye ba dman pa dang khyad par du 'phags pa dmigs pa'i phyir de rnams ni las kho na'i skye gnas las byung ba yin no //
translated: Because those who respect the gods are seen to have poor resources and those who do not respect the gods are seen to have abundant resources, sentient beings enjoy and consume the results of their own previous actions.🔽Because those who respect the gods and those who do not are seen to have inferior and superior births, respectively, they are born from the wombs of women through the power of karma alone.

original: lha la gus pa dang ma gus pa rnams la yams kyi nad dang gnod pa nye bar ma zhi ba dang zhi ba dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha la gus pa dang ma gus pa rnams la yams kyi nad dang gnod pa nye bar ma zhi ba dang zhi ba dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those who respect the gods and those who do not are seen to have epidemics and calamities that are not pacified and are pacified, respectively.

original: lha la gus pa @233b rnams la yams kyi nad dang / gnod pa nye bar ma zhi ba dmigs pa'i phyir dang / lha la ma gus pa rnams la yams kyi nad dang gnod pa nye bar zhi ba dmigs pa'i phyir rgud par gyur pa rnams la las kho na ston pa yin gyi lha rnams ni ma yin no //🔽'dod pa rnams la yid 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir dang / 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir dang / 'gog par 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //🔽de la 'dod pa rnams kyi ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs rnams kyi mdo sde'i dum bu yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: lha la gus pa @233b rnams la yams kyi nad dang / gnod pa nye bar ma zhi ba dmigs pa'i phyir dang / lha la ma gus pa rnams la yams kyi nad dang gnod pa nye bar zhi ba dmigs pa'i phyir rgud par gyur pa rnams la las kho na ston pa yin gyi lha rnams ni ma yin no // 'dod pa rnams la yid 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir dang / 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir dang / 'gog par 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no // de la 'dod pa rnams kyi ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs rnams kyi mdo sde'i dum bu yang de bzhin no //
translated: The gods are not the cause of prosperity, but karma is.🔽The gods are not the cause of prosperity, but karma is.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na sdug bsngal gyi phung po can gyi mdo sde dang po las 'dod pa rnams dang / gzugs rnams gsungs pa bzhin no //🔽ji skad du zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na sdug bsngal gyi phung po can gyi mdo sde dang po las 'dod pa rnams dang / gzugs rnams gsungs pa bzhin no //🔽ji skad du zhe na /

original: rgyas par gsungs nas /
analyzed: rgyas par gsungs nas /
translated: Having stated this extensively,

original: dge slong dag 'dod pa rnams la ro myang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'dod pa rnams la ro myang ba gang zhe na /
translated: “Monks, what is relishing of desire?

original: dge slong dag 'di dag ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dag go //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di dag ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dag go //
translated: Monks, these are the five sense objects.

original: lnga gang zhe na /🔽mig gis rnam par shes par bya ba'i phyir gzugs sdug pa mdzes pa dga' ba yid du 'ong ba 'dod pa dang ldan pa chags par bya ba zhes rgyas par 'byung ba nas /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na / mig gis rnam par shes par bya ba'i phyir gzugs sdug pa mdzes pa dga' ba yid du 'ong ba 'dod pa dang ldan pa chags par bya ba zhes rgyas par 'byung ba nas /
translated: What are the five?

original: lus kyis rnam par shes par bya ba sdug pa mdzes pa dga' ba yid du 'ong ba 'dod pa dang ldan pa chags par bya ba'i bar du 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: lus kyis rnam par shes par bya ba sdug pa mdzes pa dga' ba yid du 'ong ba 'dod pa dang ldan pa chags par bya ba'i bar du 'byung ba ste /
translated: Forms that are attractive, beautiful, pleasing, delightful, associated with desire, and arousing passion, which are objects of eye consciousness, up to forms that are attractive, beautiful, pleasing, delightful, associated with desire, and arousing passion, which are objects of body consciousness.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po 'di dag la brten nas bde ba'am yid bde ba skye ba gang yin pa 'di ni 'dod pa rnams la ro myang ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po 'di dag la brten nas bde ba'am yid bde ba skye ba gang yin pa 'di ni 'dod pa rnams la ro myang ba yin no //
translated: Whatever pleasure or mental pleasure arises in dependence on these five sense objects is relishing of desire.

original: 'on kyang 'di la nyes dmigs ni ches mang ba yin no zhes rgyas par 'byung ba dang / dge slong dag gzugs la ro myang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di la nyes dmigs ni ches mang ba yin no zhes rgyas par 'byung ba dang / dge slong dag gzugs la ro myang ba gang zhe na /
translated: “Bhikṣus, what is the enjoyment of form?

original: dge slong dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di lta ste /
translated: Bhikṣus, it is like this:

original: bram ze'i bu mo'am /
analyzed: bram ze'i bu mo'am /
translated: a brahmin girl,

original: rgyal rigs kyi bu mo'am /🔽khyim bdag gi bu mo lo bco lnga lon pa'am /
analyzed: rgyal rigs kyi bu mo'am / khyim bdag gi bu mo lo bco lnga lon pa'am /
translated: a kṣatriya girl,🔽or a householder’s daughter, fifteen or sixteen years old,

original: lo bcu drug lon pa zhig gang gi tshe legs par khrus byas /
analyzed: lo bcu drug lon pa zhig gang gi tshe legs par khrus byas /
translated: when she has bathed well,

original: legs par byugs /
analyzed: legs par byugs /
translated: anointed herself well,

original: skra dang sen mo byi dor byas /
analyzed: skra dang sen mo byi dor byas /
translated: and had her hair and nails manicured,

original: gos dkar po bgos pa de'i tshe de kha dog bzang po rgyas pa mchog dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: gos dkar po bgos pa de'i tshe de kha dog bzang po rgyas pa mchog dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: and is dressed in white clothes, at that time she has the best, most excellent complexion.

original: kha dog bzang po de la brten nas bde ba'am yid bde ba skye ba gang yin pa de ni gzugs rnams la ro myang ba yin no //
analyzed: kha dog bzang po de la brten nas bde ba'am yid bde ba skye ba gang yin pa de ni gzugs rnams la ro myang ba yin no //
translated: The pleasure or mental satisfaction that arises in dependence on that excellent complexion is the enjoyment of forms.

original: 'on kyang 'di la nyes dmigs ni ches mang ba yin no zhes rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di la nyes dmigs ni ches mang ba yin no zhes rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: But there are many more faults than advantages in this.

original: ji ltar na go rims bzhin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na go rims bzhin zhe na /
translated: How are they in order?

original: ji skad du gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'dod pa rnams dang / gzugs de rnams la yid 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir ni sdug bsngal nyid @234a * //
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'dod pa rnams dang / gzugs de rnams la yid 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir ni sdug bsngal nyid @234a * //
translated: The truth of origination is established in order to become free from desire, i.e. in order to abandon the origination of suffering.

original: yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir sgrub pa yin no //
translated: The truth of cessation is established in order to realize cessation, i.e. in order to realize the cessation of suffering.

original: de ltar na sdug bsngal nyid yongs su shes pa ni yid 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na sdug bsngal nyid yongs su shes pa ni yid 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the realization of the truth of suffering is the same as the disenchantment with it.

original: 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir ni kun 'byung ba spong bar bya ba'i phyir sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir ni kun 'byung ba spong bar bya ba'i phyir sgrub pa yin no //
translated: The truth of origination is established in order to become free from desire, i.e. in order to abandon the origination of suffering.

original: 'dod chags ni sdug bsngal gyi kun 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags ni sdug bsngal gyi kun 'byung ba yin te /
translated: Desire is the origination of suffering.

original: de zad pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba yin no //🔽'gog par gyur par bya ba'i phyir ni 'gog pa mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: de zad pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba yin no // 'gog par gyur par bya ba'i phyir ni 'gog pa mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir sgrub pa yin no //
translated: The cessation of that is freedom from desire.🔽The truth of the path is established in order to realize cessation, i.e. in order to realize the cessation of suffering.

original: bsgrub pas ni lam bsgom pa yongs su ston to //
analyzed: bsgrub pas ni lam bsgom pa yongs su ston to //
translated: The establishment of the truth of the path reveals the cultivation of the path.

original: de ltar na bden pa bzhi mthong bar bya ba'i phyir sgrub pa yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na bden pa bzhi mthong bar bya ba'i phyir sgrub pa yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the establishment of the truths should be understood as being for the sake of the realization of the four truths.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Moreover,🔽

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams ni 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams gnyis na yod de /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams ni 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams gnyis na yod de /
translated: Moreover, the five appropriated aggregates exist in the desire realm and form realm.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po ldas bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po ldas bsdus pa yin no //
translated: They are subsumed by the five appropriated aggregates.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni nye bar len pa'i phung po bzhis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni nye bar len pa'i phung po bzhis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: In the formless realm, they are subsumed by the four appropriated aggregates.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni sred pas spungs pa'i phyir de rnams ni sred pas sbyar ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de ni sred pas spungs pa'i phyir de rnams ni sred pas sbyar ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Because craving heaps them up, they are joined by craving.

original: des nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po gzhan dag tu spong bar byed do /
analyzed: des nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po gzhan dag tu spong bar byed do /
translated: When they link with a new birth, they abandon the other five appropriated aggregates.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: Moreover,

original: yang rnam grangs gzhan yang chags pa dang sred pa gnyis ni 'dod pa dang / sred pa'i 'dod chags gnyis yin te /
analyzed: yang rnam grangs gzhan yang chags pa dang sred pa gnyis ni 'dod pa dang / sred pa'i 'dod chags gnyis yin te /
translated: there is another enumeration: attachment and craving are desire and craving attachment.

original: go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: go rims bzhin no //
translated: They are respectively.

original: chags pa ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags te /
analyzed: chags pa ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags te /
translated: Attachment is desire realm attachment.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'dod chags so //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'dod chags so //
translated: It is attachment to the realm of desire.

original: sred pa ni sred pa'i 'dod chags te /
analyzed: sred pa ni sred pa'i 'dod chags te /
translated: Craving is craving-attachment.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams las skyes pa'i 'dod chags so //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams las skyes pa'i 'dod chags so //
translated: It is attachment born in the realms of form and the formless.

original: sdug bsngal ni 'dod pa'i khams yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni 'dod pa'i khams yin te /
translated: The realm of suffering is the realm of desire.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sdug bsngal gsum dag las sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gsum dag las sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the realm of desire possesses the suffering of suffering among the three types of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal ni 'dod pa'i khams ni 'dod pa'i khams kho na yod kyi gzhan na med do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal ni 'dod pa'i khams ni 'dod pa'i khams kho na yod kyi gzhan na med do //
translated: The suffering of suffering exists only in the realm of desire, not elsewhere.

original: phung po ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams gnyis yin no //
analyzed: phung po ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams gnyis yin no //
translated: The aggregates are the two realms of form and the formless.

original: de ltar na 'dis ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal rgyu dang bcas pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal rgyu dang bcas pa zad par bya ba'i phyir sgrub pa yin no zhes yongs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dis ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal rgyu dang bcas pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal rgyu dang bcas pa zad par bya ba'i phyir sgrub pa yin no zhes yongs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is taught that this practice is for the complete destruction of the suffering of the realm of desire together with its cause, and of the suffering of the realms of form and the formless together with their causes.

original: rgyas par gsungs nas gro bzhin skyes de ltar na ha cang brtson 'grus brtsams drags na ni @234b rgod pa nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: rgyas par gsungs nas gro bzhin skyes de ltar na ha cang brtson 'grus brtsams drags na ni @234b rgod pa nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: Having taught this in detail, the Buddha said to Naradatta, “Thus, if you apply yourself to meditation with too much effort, you will become agitated.

original: ha cang zhum ches na ni le lo can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ha cang zhum ches na ni le lo can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If you apply yourself with too much slackness, you will become lazy.

original: gro bzhin skyes de bas na mnyam pa nyid du rtogs par byed pa de la yang mtshan mar zung shig / des rlom sems kyang ma byed la /
analyzed: gro bzhin skyes de bas na mnyam pa nyid du rtogs par byed pa de la yang mtshan mar zung shig / des rlom sems kyang ma byed la /
translated: Naradatta, therefore, you should also apprehend the signs of the equanimity that you have realized, but do not become conceited about it.

original: de la bag med par yang ma byed cig ces bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
analyzed: de la bag med par yang ma byed cig ces bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
translated: Do not be heedless about it.” This is a passage from a sutra.

original: 'dis ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: “By this” means

original: gdams ngag 'dis ni sems mnyam pa nyid du yongs su shes par bya ba la sbyar bar mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: gdams ngag 'dis ni sems mnyam pa nyid du yongs su shes par bya ba la sbyar bar mdzad pa yin te /
translated: by this instruction, he is made to apply himself to the understanding of the equanimity of mind.

original: mnyam pa nyid du rtogs par byas la zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid du rtogs par byas la zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
translated: By the words “you should also apprehend the signs of the equanimity that you have realized,”

original: sems mnyam pa nyid kyang sems dmigs pa la ha cang rgod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: sems mnyam pa nyid kyang sems dmigs pa la ha cang rgod pa yang ma yin /
translated: the equanimity of mind is not agitated by the object of meditation.

original: ha cang zhum pa yang ma yin par btang snyoms su byed pa'o //
analyzed: ha cang zhum pa yang ma yin par btang snyoms su byed pa'o //
translated: and not too slack, but rather neutral.

original: de la yang mtshan mar zung shig ces bya ba 'dis ni mi brjed pa'i rgyu la sbyor bar mdzad pa yin no //🔽des kyang rlom sems kyang ma byed la /
analyzed: de la yang mtshan mar zung shig ces bya ba 'dis ni mi brjed pa'i rgyu la sbyor bar mdzad pa yin no // des kyang rlom sems kyang ma byed la /
translated: Here, “grasp it as a sign” is the application to the cause of non-forgetting.

original: de la bag med par yang ma byed cig ces bya ba 'di gnyis kyis ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i rgyu la sbyor bar mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: de la bag med par yang ma byed cig ces bya ba 'di gnyis kyis ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i rgyu la sbyor bar mdzad pa yin no //
translated: “Do not become proud on that account” and “do not become heedless with regard to it” are the two applications to the cause of non-defilement.

original: mi brjed pa'i rgyu ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba ni sems mnyam pa nyid de'i mi brjed pa'i rgyu ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: mi brjed pa'i rgyu ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba ni sems mnyam pa nyid de'i mi brjed pa'i rgyu ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The cause of non-forgetting is the apprehension of a sign, because the cause of non-forgetting of that sameness of mind is the apprehension of a sign.

original: mtshan ma de yang bsam gtan pa rnams kho na'i mngon sum yin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma de yang bsam gtan pa rnams kho na'i mngon sum yin no //
translated: And that sign is directly perceived only by contemplatives.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i rgyu ni nga rgyal med pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i rgyu ni nga rgyal med pa ste /
translated: The cause of non-defilement is the absence of pride,

original: mnyam pa nyid des khengs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid des khengs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one does not become inflated by that sameness.

original: gzhan yang bag yod pa yang yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang bag yod pa yang yin te /
translated: Moreover, one is heedful.

original: ro myong bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ro myong bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he does not savor it.

original: des rlom sems kyang ma byed la /
analyzed: des rlom sems kyang ma byed la /
translated: Do not be conceited about it.🔽Do not be heedless of it.

original: de la bag med par yang ma byed cig ces bya ba'i don ji skad gsungs pa'i lung phog pa 'di ni nga rgyal sred pa shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa'i gnyen por go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: de la bag med par yang ma byed cig ces bya ba'i don ji skad gsungs pa'i lung phog pa 'di ni nga rgyal sred pa shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa'i gnyen por go rims bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the scriptures that he has received is the antidote to the meditative concentration of those who are dominated by pride and craving, respectively.

original: ji ltar zhe na /🔽nga rgyal shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa'i mnyen por des rlom sems kyang ma byed la zhes bya bar lung pog pha yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / nga rgyal shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa'i mnyen por des rlom sems kyang ma byed la zhes bya bar lung pog pha yin no //
translated: How is that?🔽The meditative concentration of those who are dominated by pride is softened by the scriptures, “Do not be conceited about it.”

original: sred pa'i shas che ba'i bsam gtam pa'i gnyen por ni de la bag med par yang ma byed cig ces bya bar lung phog ma yin no //
analyzed: sred pa'i shas che ba'i bsam gtam pa'i gnyen por ni de la bag med par yang ma byed cig ces bya bar lung phog ma yin no //
translated: The antidote to the meditative concentration of those who are dominated by craving is the scriptures, “Do not be heedless of it.”

original: smras pa ci'i phyir lta ba shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa'i gnyen po dang the tshom shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa'i gnyen por lung phog pa mdzad che na /
analyzed: smras pa ci'i phyir lta ba shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa'i gnyen po dang the tshom shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa'i gnyen por lung phog pa mdzad che na /
translated: Why did the Buddha give the antidote to the meditative concentration of those who are dominated by views and the antidote to the meditative concentration of those who are dominated by doubt?

original: bden pa gzigs pa'i phyir shes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: bden pa gzigs pa'i phyir shes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Because they see the truth.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni lta ba dang the tshom gnyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni lta ba dang the tshom gnyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Likewise” means like the two, view and doubt.

original: de la nga rgyal shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa ni bsam gtan des khengs par @235a * //🔽'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la nga rgyal shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa ni bsam gtan des khengs par @235a * // 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Among them, one who is a meditator with a predominance of pride becomes conceited by that meditative absorption.

original: sred pa shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa ni bsam gtan dag la ro myong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sred pa shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa ni bsam gtan dag la ro myong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One who is a meditator with a predominance of craving experiences the taste of meditative absorption.

original: lta ba shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa ni bsam gtan la brten nas rtag pa la sogs par lta ba 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa ni bsam gtan la brten nas rtag pa la sogs par lta ba 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: One who is a meditator with a predominance of view is one in whom the view of permanence, etc., arises in dependence on meditative absorption.

original: the tshom shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa ni bsam gtan la brten nas ci 'di mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam yin nam /🔽'on te gzhan zhig yin snyam pa dang / ci bdag 'das pa'i dus na byung ba'am /
analyzed: the tshom shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa ni bsam gtan la brten nas ci 'di mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam yin nam / 'on te gzhan zhig yin snyam pa dang / ci bdag 'das pa'i dus na byung ba'am /
translated: One who is a meditator with a predominance of doubt is one in whom doubt arises in dependence on meditative absorption, such as “Is this the path to nirvana?🔽Or is it something else? ” and “Did I exist in the past?

original: 'on te ma byung snyam zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te ma byung snyam zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Or did I not exist? ” and so on.

original: nyon mongs pa rgyu'i gnas skabs 'di dag kyang bsam gtan la snyoms par zhugs pa 'di dag kho na la 'byung ngo //🔽nga rgyal shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rgyu'i gnas skabs 'di dag kyang bsam gtan la snyoms par zhugs pa 'di dag kho na la 'byung ngo // nga rgyal shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: These afflicted meditative attainments also occur only in these meditative attainments.

original: the tshom shas che ba'i bsam gtan zhes bya ba'i bar gyi don ci zhe na /
analyzed: the tshom shas che ba'i bsam gtan zhes bya ba'i bar gyi don ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the expression “meditative attainment of one who is predominantly afflicted by pride,” and so on, up to “meditative attainment of one who is predominantly afflicted by perplexity”?

original: sred pa shas che ba ni 'di la bsam gtan sred pa lhag pa can du bsam gtan byed pa'i ngang tshul yod pas 'di ni sred pa shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa shas che ba ni 'di la bsam gtan sred pa lhag pa can du bsam gtan byed pa'i ngang tshul yod pas 'di ni sred pa shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa'o //
translated: One who is predominantly afflicted by craving is one who is inclined to practice meditative attainment with a predominance of craving for meditative attainment.

original: yang na de ni sred pa shas che ba yang yin bsam gtan yang yin pas sred pa shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa'o //
analyzed: yang na de ni sred pa shas che ba yang yin bsam gtan yang yin pas sred pa shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa'o //
translated: Or else, he is both predominantly afflicted by craving and one who is in meditative attainment, thus he is one who is predominantly afflicted by craving and in meditative attainment.

original: the tshom shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa zhes bya ba'i bar la yang de bzhin dus byar bar bya'o //
analyzed: the tshom shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa zhes bya ba'i bar la yang de bzhin dus byar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for the expression “meditative attainment of one who is predominantly afflicted by perplexity.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyang ring po nas shing gi sdong po chen po zhig 'bar zhing rab tu 'bar la kun du rab tu mched cing me lce gcig tu gyur te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyang ring po nas shing gi sdong po chen po zhig 'bar zhing rab tu 'bar la kun du rab tu mched cing me lce gcig tu gyur te /
translated: The Blessed One saw from afar a great tree trunk burning, blazing, and glowing, a single flame.

original: lam mer 'bar ba gzigs so zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
analyzed: lam mer 'bar ba gzigs so zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
translated: This is the passage from the sutra.

original: go rims bzhin du sbyar bar bya ba ni lam mer 'bar ba zhes bya ba ni ma g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du sbyar bar bya ba ni lam mer 'bar ba zhes bya ba ni ma g-yo ba'o //
translated: The application according to the order is as follows: Blazing is the unmoving.

original: dge slong dag byis ba so so'i skye bo thos ba dang mi ldan pa rnams ni phung po lnga po 'di dag la rtag pa nyid dang brtan pa nyid du yang dag par rjes su lta /
analyzed: dge slong dag byis ba so so'i skye bo thos ba dang mi ldan pa rnams ni phung po lnga po 'di dag la rtag pa nyid dang brtan pa nyid du yang dag par rjes su lta /
translated: Monks, the foolish, untrained ordinary person regards these five aggregates as permanent, stable, eternal, blissful, healthy, self, and belonging to self.🔽The application according to the order is as follows: Regarded is the view.

original: bde ba nyid dang / nad med pa nyid dang / bdag dang bdag gi nyid du sbyar bar bya ba ni rjes su lta ba yin no zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
analyzed: bde ba nyid dang / nad med pa nyid dang / bdag dang bdag gi nyid du sbyar bar bya ba ni rjes su lta ba yin no zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
translated: This is the passage from the sutra.

original: de la kun du rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams la 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid skye ba dang 'jig pa gnyis dang mi ldan pa yin no snyam du de ltar kun du rmongs pa nas /
analyzed: de la kun du rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams la 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid skye ba dang 'jig pa gnyis dang mi ldan pa yin no snyam du de ltar kun du rmongs pa nas /
translated: Delusion about the five appropriated aggregates is the delusion that they are not endowed with the two characteristics of conditioned states, i.e., origination and cessation.🔽The self is not the aggregates,

original: rang yang bdag ma yin la /
analyzed: rang yang bdag ma yin la /
translated: and the self is empty of the aggregates.🔽The delusion that the self is empty of the aggregates is the view of annihilation.

original: bdag gzhan gyis kyang stong pa'i bar du yin no snyam du kun du rmongs pa ni go rims bzhin du rtag pa la sogs pa nyid @235b du lta zhes bya ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gzhan gyis kyang stong pa'i bar du yin no snyam du kun du rmongs pa ni go rims bzhin du rtag pa la sogs pa nyid @235b du lta zhes bya ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The view of the transitory aggregates is the view of the transitory collection.🔽The view of the transitory collection is the view that the five appropriated aggregates are permanent, etc.🔽The view of the transitory collection is the view that the five appropriated aggregates are permanent, etc.🔽The view of the transitory collection is the view that the five appropriated aggregates are permanent, etc.🔽The view of the transitory collection is the view that the five appropriated aggregates are permanent, etc.

original: ji ltar na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams ni skye ba dang 'jig pa gnyis dang ldan pa yin na de ltar kun du rmongs pa ni de dag la rtag pa nyid du yang dag par rjes su lta la /🔽bdag gzhan gyis stong pa'i bar du yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams ni skye ba dang 'jig pa gnyis dang ldan pa yin na de ltar kun du rmongs pa ni de dag la rtag pa nyid du yang dag par rjes su lta la / bdag gzhan gyis stong pa'i bar du yin la /
translated: The view of the transitory collection is the view that the five appropriated aggregates are permanent, etc.🔽The view of the transitory collection is the view that the five appropriated aggregates are permanent, etc.🔽The view of the transitory collection is the view that the five appropriated aggregates are permanent, etc.🔽The view of the transitory collection is the view that the five appropriated aggregates are permanent, etc.🔽The view of the transitory collection is the view that the five appropriated aggregates are permanent, etc.🔽The view of the transitory collection is the view that the five appropriated aggregates are permanent, etc.🔽The view of the transitory collection is the view that the five appropriated aggregates are permanent, etc.🔽The view of the transitory collection is the view that the five appropriated aggregates are permanent, etc.🔽The view of the transitory collection is the view that the five appropriated aggregates are permanent, etc.🔽The view of the transitory collection is the view that the five appropriated aggregates are permanent, etc.🔽The view of the transitory collection is the view that the five appropriated aggregates are permanent, etc.🔽The view of the transitory collection is the view that the five appropriated aggregates are permanent, etc.🔽The view of the transitory collection is the view that the five appropriated aggregates are permanent, etc.🔽The view of the transitory collection is the view that the five appropriated aggregates are permanent, etc.🔽The view of the transitory collection is the view that the five appropriated aggregates are permanent, etc.🔽The view of the transitory collection is the view that the five appropriated aggregates are permanent, etc.

original: de ltar kun du rmongs pa ni bdag gi nyid du yang dag par rjes su lta ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar kun du rmongs pa ni bdag gi nyid du yang dag par rjes su lta ba yin no //
translated: The view of the transitory collection is the view that the five appropriated aggregates are permanent, etc.🔽The view of the transitory collection is the view

original: rtag pa dang bde ba dang / bdag tu phyin ci log pa rnams te /
analyzed: rtag pa dang bde ba dang / bdag tu phyin ci log pa rnams te /
translated: The two views of permanence and happiness and the two views of self and what belongs to a self are the four errors.

original: lta ba gnyis dang gnyis kyis yongs su bstan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lta ba gnyis dang gnyis kyis yongs su bstan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The two views of permanence and happiness are the error of permanence, and the two views of self and what belongs to a self are the error of self.

original: ji ltar byas pas she na /🔽rtag pa nyid du lta ba dang / brten pa nyid du lta bas ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams la rtag pa phyin ci log pa yin par yongs su bstan pa yin par rig par bya'o //🔽bde ba nyid du lta ba dang / nad med pa nyid du lta bas ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams la bde bar phyin ci log pa yin par bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas she na / rtag pa nyid du lta ba dang / brten pa nyid du lta bas ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams la rtag pa phyin ci log pa yin par yongs su bstan pa yin par rig par bya'o // bde ba nyid du lta ba dang / nad med pa nyid du lta bas ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams la bde bar phyin ci log pa yin par bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: How are they errors?🔽The two views of permanence and happiness are errors in regard to the five aggregates as objects of clinging, because they are taught as the error of permanence.

original: bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag gir lta bas ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams la bdag tu phyin ci log yin par yongs su bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag gir lta bas ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams la bdag tu phyin ci log yin par yongs su bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: The two views of self and what belongs to a self are errors in regard to the five aggregates as objects of clinging, because they are taught as the error of self.

original: tshul 'chos pa dang / khags  gdang / gzhogs slong dang / thob kyis 'jal ba dang / rnyed pas rnyed par byed 'dod pa dang zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //

original: ji ltar na yo byad bsnyungs pa kun du ston ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na yo byad bsnyungs pa kun du ston ce na /
translated: How does he demonstrate the avoidance of possessions?

analyzed: chos smra ba ni mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos rnams ston pa'o //

original: gcig ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la gcig ni lus kyis yin te tshul 'chos ba'o //
analyzed: gcig ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la gcig ni lus kyis yin te tshul 'chos ba'o //
translated: One is by way of the body, which is hypocrisy.

original: gnyis pa ni dag gis yin te kha gsag go //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni dag gis yin te kha gsag go //
translated: The second is by way of speech, which is flattery.

original: lhag ma gzhogs slong la sogs pa 'cho ba log pa rnams ni lus dang ngag gis yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma gzhogs slong la sogs pa 'cho ba log pa rnams ni lus dang ngag gis yin no //
translated: The remaining four, hinting and so on, are by way of both body and speech.

original: ji ltar byas pas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas she na /
translated: How is this?

original: re zhig lus kyis ni gzhogs slong nyid de /
analyzed: re zhig lus kyis ni gzhogs slong nyid de /
translated: First, by way of the body, there is hinting.

original: rnyed par bya ba'i bsam pas lus kyis gnod pa'i gzhi kun du ston pa'i phyir dang / phongs pa'i gzhi kun du ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnyed par bya ba'i bsam pas lus kyis gnod pa'i gzhi kun du ston pa'i phyir dang / phongs pa'i gzhi kun du ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: With the intention of obtaining something, one displays the basis of harm with the body and displays the basis of need.

original: ngag gis ni bsam pa'i gzhi bsngags par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ngag gis ni bsam pa'i gzhi bsngags par byed pa'o //
translated: By way of speech, one praises the basis of one's desire.

original: thob kyis 'jal ba nyid kyang yin te /
analyzed: thob kyis 'jal ba nyid kyang yin te /
translated: There is also extortion.

original: ngag gis rnam pa gsum bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ngag gis rnam pa gsum bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the three types of speech.

original: lus kyis kyang thog ma kho nar bslang ba byas nas phyis yang dang yang du mi smra bar mdun du 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyis kyang thog ma kho nar bslang ba byas nas phyis yang dang yang du mi smra bar mdun du 'dug pa'o //
translated: By way of the body, one first makes a request and later sits in front of the person without speaking again and again.

original: 'tsho ba log par rnyed pas rnyed par byed 'dod pa yang yin te /
analyzed: 'tsho ba log par rnyed pas rnyed par byed 'dod pa yang yin te /
translated: He is one who desires to obtain gain through wrong livelihood.

original: lus kyis ni gcig po ji skad bstan pa yin la ngag gis ni gnyis yin no //
analyzed: lus kyis ni gcig po ji skad bstan pa yin la ngag gis ni gnyis yin no //
translated: He is one who obtains gain through one of the three actions of body, and through two of the three actions of speech.

original: smras pa / gzhogs slong la sogs pa 'tsho ba log pa lhag ma rnams las chig gang yin pa la de dag ji ltar na kha gsag ma yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / gzhogs slong la sogs pa 'tsho ba log pa lhag ma rnams las chig gang yin pa la de dag ji ltar na kha gsag ma yin te /
translated: Objection: Among the remaining wrong livelihoods, such as hinting, which is one of them? How can it be flattery?

original: kha gsag kyang ngag gi las yin pas so //
analyzed: kha gsag kyang ngag gi las yin pas so //
translated: Because flattery is also verbal action.🔽In response, Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / gzhan mgu bar bya ba'i phyir smra ba 'tsho ba lag pa gnyis pa ni 'dir kha gsag yin par dgongs kyi /
analyzed: bshad pa / gzhan mgu bar bya ba'i phyir smra ba 'tsho ba lag pa gnyis pa ni 'dir kha gsag yin par dgongs kyi /
translated: Here flattery is considered to be the speech of one who has two hands, that is, who speaks in order to please others.

original: bsam pa'i gzhi bsngags pa byed pa la sogs pa'i chig thams cad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bsam pa'i gzhi bsngags pa byed pa la sogs pa'i chig thams cad ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not all speech that praises and so on, which is the basis of intention.

original: de bas na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de bas na nyes pa med do //
translated: Therefore there is no fault.

original: zla ba phyed cing tshes bco lnga la rgyal po chen po bzhi dag rang nyid kyis mi'i 'jig rten na mar 'dzin pa dang / phar 'dzin pa dang / dge slong du 'dzin pa dang / bram zer 'dzin pa dang / rigs kyi nang na rgan rabs la ri mo byed pa dang /

translated: How many in the world respect their mothers, respect their fathers, respect ascetics, respect brahmins, respect the elders in their family,

analyzed: ji ltar de shes par bya zhe na /

translated: The phrase “houses, etc.” includes roads, etc.

analyzed: zas dang / skom la sogs pa gang yin pa dang / kun dga' rab la sogs pa'o //
translated: Food and drink, etc. includes gardens, etc.

original: 'jig rten rjes su 'dzin pa'i phyir gang yin pa 'di gnyi ga yang sbyin ba las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'jig rten rjes su 'dzin pa'i phyir gang yin pa 'di gnyi ga yang sbyin ba las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi yin mod kyi /
translated: Both of these are the bases of the merit that arises from giving, because they are given to others.

original: tha dad par smos pa ni khyad par dang khyad par med par sbyin pa'i dbye ba yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tha dad par smos pa ni khyad par dang khyad par med par sbyin pa'i dbye ba yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: But they are mentioned separately in order to demonstrate the classification of giving in terms of specific and non-specific distinctions.

original: khyad par gyi dbye ba yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir dang / khyad par med pa'i dbye ba yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par gyi dbye ba yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir dang / khyad par med pa'i dbye ba yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The specific distinction is demonstrated in order to demonstrate the non-specific distinction.

original: go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ji ltar byas pas she na /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ji ltar byas pas she na /
translated: How is this done?

original: bla ma dang yon gnas pa ni tshig gnyis dang gnyis kyis yang dag par bsgrub pa bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: bla ma dang yon gnas pa ni tshig gnyis dang gnyis kyis yang dag par bsgrub pa bstan pa yin te /
translated: The two phrases “to superiors” and “to those worthy of worship” demonstrate the specific distinction.

original: re zhig bla ma rnams la ni mar 'dzin pa dang / phar 'dzin pa zhes bya ba 'di gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: re zhig bla ma rnams la ni mar 'dzin pa dang / phar 'dzin pa zhes bya ba 'di gnyis kyis so //
translated: The first two lines show that the teacher is to be honored as a father and mother.

original: yon gnas rnams la ni dge sbyong du 'dzin pa dang / bram zer 'dzin pa zhes bya ba 'di gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: yon gnas rnams la ni dge sbyong du 'dzin pa dang / bram zer 'dzin pa zhes bya ba 'di gnyis kyis so //
translated: The next two lines show that the one worthy of offerings is to be honored as a śramaṇa and a brahmin.

original: gzhi rnams kyi re res ni rgan po rnams dang / rgud pa rnams dang / rang gi las dang / bsod nams byed pa las yang dag par bsgrub par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhi rnams kyi re res ni rgan po rnams dang / rgud pa rnams dang / rang gi las dang / bsod nams byed pa las yang dag par bsgrub par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Each of the four bases is taught to be the means of accomplishing the respect for the elderly, the sick, one’s own karma, and the meritorious.

original: tshig re res ni re res so //
analyzed: tshig re res ni re res so //
translated: Each of the four lines shows each of the four bases.

original: smras pa tshig du dag gis she na /
analyzed: smras pa tshig du dag gis she na /
translated: How many words are there?

original: gzhi rnams kyi re res te /
analyzed: gzhi rnams kyi re res te /
translated: Each of the four bases is taught by one word.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: re zhig rgan po rnams la ni rigs kyi nang na rgan rabs la ri mo byed pa zhes bya ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: re zhig rgan po rnams la ni rigs kyi nang na rgan rabs la ri mo byed pa zhes bya ba'i tshig go //
translated: First, the elderly are to be honored by the word “the elderly are to be honored in the family.”

original: rgud pa rnams la ni don byed pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gcig gis so //
analyzed: rgud pa rnams la ni don byed pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gcig gis so //
translated: The sick are to be honored by the word “the sick are to be honored.”

original: rang gi las la ni bya ba byed pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gcig gis so //
analyzed: rang gi las la ni bya ba byed pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gcig gis so //
translated: One’s own karma is to be honored by the word “one’s own karma is to be honored.”

original: bsod nams byed pa la ni bsod nams byed pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gcig gis yang dag par sgrub par bstan pa yin no //🔽tshig 'jig rten @237a * //
analyzed: bsod nams byed pa la ni bsod nams byed pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gcig gis yang dag par sgrub par bstan pa yin no // tshig 'jig rten @237a * //
translated: The phrase one who performs merit is taught to be the accomplishment of merit.🔽The phrase in this world and the next is taught to be the cause of that accomplishment.

original: 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol zhes bya ba de la sogs pa lhag ma rnams kyis ni yang dag par bsgrub pa de nyid kyi rgyu dang bsod nams bya ba'i rnam pa'i dbye ba yang dag par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol zhes bya ba de la sogs pa lhag ma rnams kyis ni yang dag par bsgrub pa de nyid kyi rgyu dang bsod nams bya ba'i rnam pa'i dbye ba yang dag par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The remaining phrases, such as in this world and the next, indicate the classification of the aspects of meritorious action.

original: de la 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol gyi kha na ma thob rnams la 'jigs par lta ba zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di dag gis ni yang dag par bsgrubs pa de nyid kyi rgyu yang dag par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol gyi kha na ma thob rnams la 'jigs par lta ba zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di dag gis ni yang dag par bsgrubs pa de nyid kyi rgyu yang dag par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase one who sees fear in this world and the next indicates the cause of that accomplishment.

original: sbyin pa byed pa nas /
analyzed: sbyin pa byed pa nas /
translated: The phrase one who gives gifts indicates the classification of the aspects of meritorious action.

original: tshul khrims yang dag par blangs nas gnas pa zhes bya ba'i bar 'di rnams kyis ni bsod nams bya ba'i rnam pa'i dbye ba yang dag par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims yang dag par blangs nas gnas pa zhes bya ba'i bar 'di rnams kyis ni bsod nams bya ba'i rnam pa'i dbye ba yang dag par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase one who, having undertaken morality, abides indicates the classification of the aspects of meritorious action.

original: rgyas par gsungs nas kye sh'a ri'i bu 'jig rten na chos smra ba ni su dag yin /
analyzed: rgyas par gsungs nas kye sh'a ri'i bu 'jig rten na chos smra ba ni su dag yin /
translated: Having taught this in detail, he said, Kye! Shariputra, who are the Dharma teachers in the world?

original: legs par zhugs pa ni su dag yin /
analyzed: legs par zhugs pa ni su dag yin /
translated: Who are the ones who have entered well?

original: bde bar gshegs pa ni su dag yin /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa ni su dag yin /
translated: Who are the ones who have gone to bliss?

original: 'dzam bu'i grib ma can gang su dag 'dod chags gdul ba'i phyir dang / zhe sdang gdul ba'i phyir dang / gti mug gdul ba'i phyir chos ston pa 'di ni 'jig rten na chos smra ba dag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i grib ma can gang su dag 'dod chags gdul ba'i phyir dang / zhe sdang gdul ba'i phyir dang / gti mug gdul ba'i phyir chos ston pa 'di ni 'jig rten na chos smra ba dag ces bya ba'o //
translated: Those who teach the Dharma in the world for the sake of taming desire, for the sake of taming anger, and for the sake of taming delusion are called the Dharma teachers in the world.

original: gang su dag 'dod chags gdul ba'i phyir zhugs pa dang / zhe sdang gdul ba'i phyir dang / gti mug gdul ba'i phyir zhugs pa 'di ni legs par zhugs pa dag ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang su dag 'dod chags gdul ba'i phyir zhugs pa dang / zhe sdang gdul ba'i phyir dang / gti mug gdul ba'i phyir zhugs pa 'di ni legs par zhugs pa dag ces bya'o //
translated: Those who have entered for the sake of taming desire, for the sake of taming anger, and for the sake of taming delusion are called the ones who have entered well.

original: gang su dag 'dod chags ma lus par spangs pa dang / yongs su shes pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug ma lus par spangs pa dang / yongs su shes pa 'di ni 'jig rten na bde bar gshegs pa dag ces bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
analyzed: gang su dag 'dod chags ma lus par spangs pa dang / yongs su shes pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug ma lus par spangs pa dang / yongs su shes pa 'di ni 'jig rten na bde bar gshegs pa dag ces bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //

original: 'dir ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la mdo sde'i dum bu 'dir ni nges par legs pa las brtsams nas te ched du byas nas sems can gnyis te rnam pa gnyis dris pa dang / lan btab pa yin no //

original: dris pa ni kun du rgyu 'dzam bu'i grib ma can gyis so //
analyzed: dris pa ni kun du rgyu 'dzam bu'i grib ma can gyis so //

original: dris pa ni yang dag par smra ba dang / byed pa po yin no //
analyzed: dris pa ni yang dag par smra ba dang / byed pa po yin no //

original: byed pa po yang rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba yin no//
analyzed: byed pa po yang rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba yin no//

original: lan btab pa gang dag ce na /

analyzed: yang dag par smra ba dang / byed pa po rnam pa gnyis po yang 'di dag nyid yin no //

original: ji ltar dris she na /
analyzed: ji ltar dris she na /

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'jig rten na chos smra ba ni su dag yin zhes bya ba ni yang dag par smra ba yin no //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'jig rten na chos smra ba ni su dag yin zhes bya ba ni yang dag par smra ba yin no //

original: gang su dag 'dod chags gdul ba'i phyir zhugs pa dang / zhe sdang gdul ba'i phyir dang / gti mug gdul ba'i phyir zhugs pa 'di ni legs par zhugs pa dag ces bya'o zhes bya pa ni yang dag par byed pa po ste /
analyzed: gang su dag 'dod chags gdul ba'i phyir zhugs pa dang / zhe sdang gdul ba'i phyir dang / gti mug gdul ba'i phyir zhugs pa 'di ni legs par zhugs pa dag ces bya'o zhes bya pa ni yang dag par byed pa po ste /
translated: Those who enter to subdue attachment, to subdue aversion, and to subdue delusion are said to be well entered.

original: brtson pa rnams lan btab pa yin no //
analyzed: brtson pa rnams lan btab pa yin no //
translated: This is the reply to those who strive.

original: gang su dag 'dod chags ma lus par spangs pa dang / yongs su shes pa dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug ma lus par spangs pa dang / yongs su shes pa 'di ni 'jig rten na bde bar gshegs pa dag ces bya'o zhes bya bas kyang byed pa po ste /
analyzed: gang su dag 'dod chags ma lus par spangs pa dang / yongs su shes pa dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug ma lus par spangs pa dang / yongs su shes pa 'di ni 'jig rten na bde bar gshegs pa dag ces bya'o zhes bya bas kyang byed pa po ste /
translated: Those who completely abandon attachment, completely abandon aversion and completely abandon delusion, and completely understand them are said to be blissful in the world.

original: grol ba rnams kyi lan btab pa yin no //🔽'dzam bu'i grib ma can gang su dag 'dod chags gdul ba'i phyir dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung bas /
analyzed: grol ba rnams kyi lan btab pa yin no // 'dzam bu'i grib ma can gang su dag 'dod chags gdul ba'i phyir dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung bas /
translated: This is the reply to those who are liberated.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams kho na smos kyi /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams kho na smos kyi /
translated: Those who enter to subdue attachment, to subdue aversion and to subdue delusion, and those who completely abandon attachment, completely abandon aversion and completely abandon delusion, and completely understand them are said to be blissful in the world.🔽This is the reply to those who strive and to those who are liberated.🔽The reply to those who strive and to those who are liberated is stated in the sūtra:🔽Those who enter to subdue attachment, to subdue aversion and to subdue delusion, and those who completely abandon attachment, completely abandon aversion and completely abandon delusion, and completely understand them are said to be blissful in the world.🔽This is the reply to those who strive and to those who are liberated.

original: lta ba dang / nga rgyal dang / the tshom rnams ma yin pa ni de rnams kyis go rims bzhin du tshor ba gsum la bcings pa'i phyir te //
analyzed: lta ba dang / nga rgyal dang / the tshom rnams ma yin pa ni de rnams kyis go rims bzhin du tshor ba gsum la bcings pa'i phyir te //
translated: It is not view, pride, or doubt, because they respectively bind one to the three feelings.

original: ji ltar 'dod chags kyis ni bde pa'i tshor ba la bcings so //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod chags kyis ni bde pa'i tshor ba la bcings so //
translated: How is it that attachment binds one to the feeling of pleasure?

original: 'di ltar zhe sdang gis ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la bcings so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhe sdang gis ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la bcings so //
translated: It is because aversion binds one to the feeling of pain.

original: 'di ltar gti mug gis ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa la bcings so //
analyzed: 'di ltar gti mug gis ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa la bcings so //
translated: It is because delusion binds one to the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain.

original: smras pa / tshor ba gsum po de la bcings par ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /🔽'di ltar zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: smras pa / tshor ba gsum po de la bcings par ji ltar shes par bya zhe na / 'di ltar zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: How is it known that one is bound to these three feelings?

original: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis dmigs pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa dang / bde ba'i tshor ba la ni 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis dmigs pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa dang / bde ba'i tshor ba la ni 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur /
translated: It is because, as extensively explained, the Bhagavān said that attachment increases in the pleasant feeling,

original: sdug bsngal la ni khong khro ba /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la ni khong khro ba /
translated: aversion increases in the painful feeling,🔽and delusion increases in the feeling that is neither pleasant nor painful.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa la ni ma rig pa'o zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa la ni ma rig pa'o zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: and in the neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling, it is ignorance.

original: ji ltar rigs par zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'os par te /
analyzed: ji ltar rigs par zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'os par te /
translated: As is appropriate means as is fitting.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the desire realm, attachment, aversion, and ignorance are abandoned.

original: de'i gong ma rnams su ni 'dod chags dang ma rig pa gnyis spangs @238a * //🔽pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gong ma rnams su ni 'dod chags dang ma rig pa gnyis spangs @238a * // pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Above that, attachment and ignorance are abandoned.🔽Obtainment is the characteristic of the latent state of abandonment.

original: thob pa bag la nyal gyi mtshan nyid spangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sa bon de nyid ma bton cing nyams par ma byas pa ni thob pa yin te /
analyzed: thob pa bag la nyal gyi mtshan nyid spangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sa bon de nyid ma bton cing nyams par ma byas pa ni thob pa yin te /
translated: The seed of affliction that has not been extracted and not been destroyed is obtainment.

original: bag la nyal yang de nyid yin no //
analyzed: bag la nyal yang de nyid yin no //
translated: That is also the latent state.

original: nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu po chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa'i rnam pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu po chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa'i rnam pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nine aspects of affliction, such as the small of the small, are abandoned.

original: 'di ltar chen po'i chen po'i rnam pa nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar chen po'i chen po'i rnam pa nas brtsams nas /
translated: Thus, beginning with the great of the great aspect,

original: chung ngu'i chung ngu'i rnam pa'i bar du spangs pas so //
analyzed: chung ngu'i chung ngu'i rnam pa'i bar du spangs pas so //
translated: because the aspects of the smallest of the small are abandoned.

original: gang su dag 'dod chags ma lus par spangs pa zhes gang gsungs pa'i spangs pas ni rnam par grol ba ston to //
analyzed: gang su dag 'dod chags ma lus par spangs pa zhes gang gsungs pa'i spangs pas ni rnam par grol ba ston to //

original: de la rnam par grol ba ni de kho na nyid las 'dod chags la sogs ba bsal ba'i sems dri ma med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de la rnam par grol ba ni de kho na nyid las 'dod chags la sogs ba bsal ba'i sems dri ma med pa nyid yin no //
translated: Liberation is the stainlessness of mind that is free from attachment and so on.

original: yongs su shes pas ni rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba ston to zhes bya ba'i skabs dang sbyar te /
analyzed: yongs su shes pas ni rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba ston to zhes bya ba'i skabs dang sbyar te /
translated: The phrase, “The knowledge and insight of liberation,” indicates the complete understanding of that.

original: spangs pa dang yongs su shes pa zhes gang gsungs pa 'dis so //🔽ye shes nyid mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: spangs pa dang yongs su shes pa zhes gang gsungs pa 'dis so // ye shes nyid mthong ba yin te /
translated: The abandonment and complete understanding that are referred to in the statement, “Whoever has abandoned all attachment,”🔽indicate the knowledge and insight of liberation.

original: rnam par grol bar shes shing mthong ba ni rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'o //🔽de ltar na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: rnam par grol bar shes shing mthong ba ni rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'o // de ltar na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /

original: ma lus par spangs pa ni so so rang gis rig par bya ba nyid du bstan pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: ma lus par spangs pa ni so so rang gis rig par bya ba nyid du bstan pa nyid yin te /
translated: The abandonment of all is taught to be just the realization of each one for oneself.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzhan la rag las pa dang / som nyi dang ldan pa rnams bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la rag las pa dang / som nyi dang ldan pa rnams bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is for the sake of removing dependence on others and doubt.

original: gang dag nyon mongs pa spangs pa la gzhan la rag las pa dang / som nyi dang ldan pa dang / the tshom dang ldan pa ni gzhan la rag las pa dang ldan pa dang som nyi dang ldan pa de rnams te bsal ba'i phyir ni dga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang dag nyon mongs pa spangs pa la gzhan la rag las pa dang / som nyi dang ldan pa dang / the tshom dang ldan pa ni gzhan la rag las pa dang ldan pa dang som nyi dang ldan pa de rnams te bsal ba'i phyir ni dga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who abandon the defilements are dependent on others, have doubt, and have uncertainty. For the sake of removing that dependence on others and doubt, for the sake of delighting them,

original: gcin nad dang / 'byung po'i gdon smos pa ni de gnyis ni byang du zin kyang dus gzhan 'ga' zhig na yang ldang bas so //
analyzed: gcin nad dang / 'byung po'i gdon smos pa ni de gnyis ni byang du zin kyang dus gzhan 'ga' zhig na yang ldang bas so //
translated: the mention of urinary disease and spirit possession is because even if those two are cured, they may arise again at some other time.

original: 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag las bzlog nas te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag las bzlog nas te /
translated: Having turned away from mundane meditative attainments.

original: ji ltar bzlog ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar bzlog ce na /
translated: How is it turned away?

original: 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag ni ji srid du bgrod par bya bar mi 'dod de /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag ni ji srid du bgrod par bya bar mi 'dod de /
translated: Mundane meditative attainments are not desired as far as the end of the peak of existence.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du 'gro ba'i phyir dang / mya ngan las 'das par mi 'gro ba'i phyir dang / 'gro ba bzang po ma yin par 'gro ba'i phyir dang / slar yang ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du 'gro ba'i phyir dang / mya ngan las 'das par mi 'gro ba'i phyir dang / 'gro ba bzang po ma yin par 'gro ba'i phyir dang / slar yang ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they go as far as the peak of cyclic existence, because they do not go to nirvana, because they go to a bad destination, and because they return again.

original: mya ngan las 'das par gshegs pa dag ni de ltar gshegs pa dag yin no zhes bya ba ni ji srid du bgrod par bya bar gshegs pa dag yin /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par gshegs pa dag ni de ltar gshegs pa dag yin no zhes bya ba ni ji srid du bgrod par bya bar gshegs pa dag yin /
translated: Those who go to nirvana go in that way.

original: 'gro ba la @238b bzang por gshegs pa dag yin /
analyzed: 'gro ba la @238b bzang por gshegs pa dag yin /
translated: They go to a good destination.

original: phyir mi ldog par gshegs pa dag yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog par gshegs pa dag yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They go without returning.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ji skad du bstan pa de ltar na mya ngan las 'das pa ni bla na med pa nyid yin par bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ji skad du bstan pa de ltar na mya ngan las 'das pa ni bla na med pa nyid yin par bstan pa yin te /
translated: Thus, as it has been taught, nirvana is taught to be unsurpassed.

original: mya ngan las 'das par gshegs nas mya ngan las 'das pa las pha rol na gshegs par bya ba med pas so //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par gshegs nas mya ngan las 'das pa las pha rol na gshegs par bya ba med pas so //
translated: Because having gone to nirvana, there is no going beyond nirvana.

original: dge ba nyid kyang yin par bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: dge ba nyid kyang yin par bstan pa yin te /
translated: It is also taught to be virtuous,

original: bzang por gshegs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzang por gshegs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the good way to go.

original: rtag pa nyid du bstan pa yang yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa nyid du bstan pa yang yin te /
translated: It is also taught to be permanent,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa las phyir mi ldog par gshegs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa las phyir mi ldog par gshegs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the way to go that does not turn back from nirvana.

original: dge slong dag 'di ltar sa bon yang yod la /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di ltar sa bon yang yod la /
translated: Monks, it is like this: if there is a seed,

original: ma grugs pa dang / ma rul ba dang / rlung dang / nyi mas ma gdungs pa dang / gsar pa dang / snying po dang ldan pa dang / legs par gnas pa yang yin la /
analyzed: ma grugs pa dang / ma rul ba dang / rlung dang / nyi mas ma gdungs pa dang / gsar pa dang / snying po dang ldan pa dang / legs par gnas pa yang yin la /
translated: and if it is not damaged, not rotten, not destroyed by wind or sun, fresh, with an intact core, and well planted,

original: sa'i smag dang chu yang yod na /
analyzed: sa'i smag dang chu yang yod na /
translated: and if there is earth and water,

original: de lta bu'i sa bon de dag ni 'phel zhing rgyas la yangs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i sa bon de dag ni 'phel zhing rgyas la yangs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: then that seed will grow, extend, and fully develop.

original: dge slong dag de bzhin du 'di ltar las kyang yod la /
analyzed: dge slong dag de bzhin du 'di ltar las kyang yod la /
translated: Monks, it is like this: if there is karma,

original: nyon mongs pa rnams dang / sred pa dang lta ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa yang yod na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams dang / sred pa dang lta ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa yang yod na /
translated: and if there are the afflictions, craving, views, pride, and ignorance,

original: de lta bu ni tshe phyi ma la 'du byed rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu ni tshe phyi ma la 'du byed rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
translated: This is the passage from the sutra.

original: las la nyon mongs pa rnams grogs su 'gyur bas skye ba skyed par byed de /
analyzed: las la nyon mongs pa rnams grogs su 'gyur bas skye ba skyed par byed de /
translated: The afflictions assist karma in generating rebirth.

original: ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How do we know this?

original: dgra bcom pa nyid la nyon mongs pa zad pa ni mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid la nyon mongs pa zad pa ni mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when the arhat has exhausted the afflictions, he is not reborn.

original: las la yang nus pa yod de /
analyzed: las la yang nus pa yod de /
translated: Karma also has the ability to generate rebirth.

original: nyon mongs pa ma zad na las ji lta ba bzhin du skye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ma zad na las ji lta ba bzhin du skye ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because even when the afflictions are exhausted, one is reborn in accordance with one’s karma.
