original: da ltar byung ba'i tshe rabs la nyon mongs pas yongs su gdung ba yin te /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i tshe rabs la nyon mongs pas yongs su gdung ba yin te /
translated: In this very life, they are tormented by the afflictions.

original: lus dang sems yongs su gdung bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang sems yongs su gdung bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they torment the body and the mind.

original: lus yongs su gdung bar byed pa'i phyir dang / sems yongs su gdung bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus yongs su gdung bar byed pa'i phyir dang / sems yongs su gdung bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They torment the body and the mind.

original: ji ltar na sdug bsngal gyi rnam par smin pa can yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sdug bsngal gyi rnam par smin pa can yin zhe na /
translated: How do they have suffering as their effect?

original: tshe phyi ma la ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i phyir ro //🔽ji ltar na /
analyzed: tshe phyi ma la ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i phyir ro // ji ltar na /
translated: Because they lead to a bad destiny in a future life.

original: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi bar 'gyur ba yin zhe na /🔽skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi bar 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi bar 'gyur ba yin zhe na / skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi bar 'gyur ba ni /
translated: How do they lead to birth, old age and death?

original: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba dang mthun pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba dang mthun pa ste /
translated: Birth, old age and death are favorable to birth, old age and death.

original: yul ring por skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul ring por skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they lead to birth, old age and death in a distant place.

original: dge slong ngam /
analyzed: dge slong ngam /
translated: The monk

original: dge slong ma gang la la cung zad cung zad dang / @240b yang tsam yud tsam dang / tha na se gol gtogs pa tsam yang sems can srog chags su gyur pa thams cad la byams pa'i sems sgom par byed pa'i dge slong ngam /
analyzed: dge slong ma gang la la cung zad cung zad dang / @240b yang tsam yud tsam dang / tha na se gol gtogs pa tsam yang sems can srog chags su gyur pa thams cad la byams pa'i sems sgom par byed pa'i dge slong ngam /
translated: “Any nun who cultivates a loving mind toward all living beings, even for a moment, even for a short time, even for a mere instant, even for the time it takes to snap her fingers,

original: dge slong ma 'di ni ston pa'i bstan pa bzhin byed pa /
analyzed: dge slong ma 'di ni ston pa'i bstan pa bzhin byed pa /
translated: this nun practices in accordance with the Teacher’s instructions.

original: mi gtong bar sgom pa /
analyzed: mi gtong bar sgom pa /
translated: She cultivates without abandoning.

original: lhag mthong dang ldan pa /
analyzed: lhag mthong dang ldan pa /
translated: She has insight.

original: khyim stong pa rnams rgyas par byed pa /
analyzed: khyim stong pa rnams rgyas par byed pa /
translated: She fills empty houses.

original: rang gi don gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson pa /
analyzed: rang gi don gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson pa /
translated: She is dedicated to the practice of her own goal.

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa rnams kyis ma smad pa /
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa rnams kyis ma smad pa /
translated: She is not criticized by wise companions in the celibate life.🔽She eats the alms of the country with full awareness of the results.”

original: yul 'khor gyi bsod snyoms 'bras bu yod par za ba zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
analyzed: yul 'khor gyi bsod snyoms 'bras bu yod par za ba zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
translated: This is the section on the sutras.

original: ston pa'i bstan pa bzhin du bsgrub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' bzhin du bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ston pa'i bstan pa bzhin du bsgrub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' bzhin du bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Because she practices in accordance with the Teacher’s instructions” means because she practices in accordance with the Blessed One’s words.

original: de ltar brtson pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ltar brtson pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because he strives in that way.

original: ji ltar de ltar brtson zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de ltar brtson zhe na /
translated: How does he strive in that way?

original: brtson 'grus mi gtong ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus mi gtong ba nyid kyis so //
translated: By not abandoning his effort.

original: tshang pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni tshang pa mtshungs par spyod pa de kho na rtogs pa rnams kyis so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshang pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni tshang pa mtshungs par spyod pa de kho na rtogs pa rnams kyis so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: By the wise who are his companions in the celibate life means by those who are his companions in the celibate life and who understand reality.

original: de'i 'bras bu dang bcas pa nyid du byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa po rnams kyi bsod snyoms dang bcas pa nyid du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu dang bcas pa nyid du byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa po rnams kyi bsod snyoms dang bcas pa nyid du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he makes it fruitful means because he makes his generosity fruitful.

original: ston pa la yang dag par sgrub par yongs su bstan pa'i phyir de'i bstan pa bzhin du bsgrub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ston pa la yang dag par sgrub par yongs su bstan pa'i phyir de'i bstan pa bzhin du bsgrub pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because he practices in accordance with his teaching means because he practices in accordance with the teaching of the Master.

original: ston pa'i bstan pa bzhin byed pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
analyzed: ston pa'i bstan pa bzhin byed pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
translated: This is indicated by the words “he practices in accordance with the teaching of the Master.”

original: bstan pa las yang dag par sgrub par yongs su bstan pa ni rtag tu las khyad par du 'phags pa las sbyor ba'i phyir dang ste /
analyzed: bstan pa las yang dag par sgrub par yongs su bstan pa ni rtag tu las khyad par du 'phags pa las sbyor ba'i phyir dang ste /
translated: The practice in accordance with the teaching is indicated by the fact that he always applies himself to the most excellent actions.

original: mi gtong bar bsgom pa zhes bya ba 'dis so //
analyzed: mi gtong bar bsgom pa zhes bya ba 'dis so //
translated: This is the meditation called “not letting go”.

original: phyin ci ma log par sbyor ba'i phyir dang ste /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log par sbyor ba'i phyir dang ste /
translated: Because of application without error,

original: lhag mthong dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'dis so //
analyzed: lhag mthong dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'dis so //
translated: this is the meditation called “endowed with insight”.

original: rnam par ma g-yengs par sbyor ba'i phyir dang ste /
analyzed: rnam par ma g-yengs par sbyor ba'i phyir dang ste /
translated: Because of application without distraction,

original: khyim stong pa rnams rgyas par byed pa zhes bya ba 'dis so //
analyzed: khyim stong pa rnams rgyas par byed pa zhes bya ba 'dis so //
translated: this is the meditation called “filling empty houses”.

original: chog mi shes par sbyor ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: chog mi shes par sbyor ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because of application without satisfaction,

original: rang gi don gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson pa zhes bya ba 'dis so //
analyzed: rang gi don gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson pa zhes bya ba 'dis so //
translated: this is the meditation called “diligent in the application of one’s own aim”.

original: dge slong gi las khyad par du 'phags pa ni bsam gtan yin par rig par bya ba ni las khyad par du 'phags pa la sbyor ba'i phyir zhes gang bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong gi las khyad par du 'phags pa ni bsam gtan yin par rig par bya ba ni las khyad par du 'phags pa la sbyor ba'i phyir zhes gang bstan pa yin no //
translated: It should be understood that the superior activity of a monk is meditation, because it is taught that “it is the application to superior activity”.

original: rgyu 'di rnams kyis ni bstan pa la yang dag par sgrub par yongs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu 'di rnams kyis ni bstan pa la yang dag par sgrub par yongs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: By these causes, the correct practice in the teaching is shown.

original: gzhan yang ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang ste /
translated: Moreover,

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang bstan pa la yang dag par sgrub par yongs su bstan pa zhes bya ba ni rtag tu bsgom @241a * //🔽ba'i phyir dang ste /
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang bstan pa la yang dag par sgrub par yongs su bstan pa zhes bya ba ni rtag tu bsgom @241a * // ba'i phyir dang ste /
translated: Another classification is indicated: “the teaching of correct practice” is the cultivation of the perfections, because they are cultivated constantly.

original: mi gtong bar sgom pa zhes bya ba 'dis so //🔽kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin par bsgom pa'i phyir dang ste /🔽lhag mthong dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
analyzed: mi gtong bar sgom pa zhes bya ba 'dis so // kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin par bsgom pa'i phyir dang ste / lhag mthong dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
translated: “The cultivation of non-abandonment” is indicated by the word “cultivation.”

original: bar chad med par bsgom pa'i phyir dang ste /
analyzed: bar chad med par bsgom pa'i phyir dang ste /
translated: “The cultivation of non-defilement” is indicated by the word “cultivation endowed with insight.”

original: khyim stong pa rnams rgyas par byed pa zhes bya ba 'dis so //🔽chog mi shes pang bsgom pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: khyim stong pa rnams rgyas par byed pa zhes bya ba 'dis so // chog mi shes pang bsgom pa'i phyir te /
translated: “The cultivation of uninterruptedness” is indicated by the word “cultivation of the empty villages.”

original: rang gi don dang sbyor ba la rjes su brtson pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
analyzed: rang gi don dang sbyor ba la rjes su brtson pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
translated: “The cultivation of non-satisfaction” is indicated by the word “cultivation of one’s own and others’ aims.”🔽“The teaching of correct practice for fellow brahmacarins” is indicated by the word “practice of the concordance with the determination for enlightenment.”

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams la yang dag par yongs su sgrub par bstan pa ni don mthun pa nyid du sbyor ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams la yang dag par yongs su sgrub par bstan pa ni don mthun pa nyid du sbyor ba'i phyir te /
translated: “The teaching of correct practice for the world” is indicated by the word “practice of the concordance with the perfections.”

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa rnams kyis ma smad pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //🔽sbyin par byed pa rnams la yang dag par sgrub par yongs su bstan pa ni de'i sbyin pa 'bras bu chen po nyid du sbyor ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa rnams kyis ma smad pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so // sbyin par byed pa rnams la yang dag par sgrub par yongs su bstan pa ni de'i sbyin pa 'bras bu chen po nyid du sbyor ba'i phyir te /
translated: By the words “not despised by wise companions in the celibate life.”🔽The teaching of the accomplishment of the givers is shown by the words “the gift that is the cause of great fruit for the giver.”

original: yul 'khor gyi bsod snyoms 'bras bu yod par bza' ba zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
analyzed: yul 'khor gyi bsod snyoms 'bras bu yod par bza' ba zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
translated: The words “the gift that is the cause of great fruit for the giver” show the accomplishment of the givers.

original: kye goo ta ma gang gis na da ltar mi rnams stobs chung ba dang / gnod pa mang ba dang / mthu chung ba dang / tshe thung ba'i rgyu ni gang lags /
analyzed: kye goo ta ma gang gis na da ltar mi rnams stobs chung ba dang / gnod pa mang ba dang / mthu chung ba dang / tshe thung ba'i rgyu ni gang lags /
translated: “O Gautama, what is the cause of the present weakness, many afflictions, little strength, and short life of humans?

original: rkyen ni gang lags /
analyzed: rkyen ni gang lags /
translated: What is the condition?”

original: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bram ze gro bzhin skyes la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bram ze gro bzhin skyes la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the Brahmin Kolita:🔽“Kolita, the cause and condition of the present weakness, many afflictions, little strength, and short life of humans is the fact that they have abandoned the ten wholesome courses of action and do not practice them.

original: bram ze da ltar mi rnams ni chos ma yin par chags pas chags pa dang / mi rigs par chags pas zil gyis non pa dang / chos log pas dkris pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
analyzed: bram ze da ltar mi rnams ni chos ma yin par chags pas chags pa dang / mi rigs par chags pas zil gyis non pa dang / chos log pas dkris pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
translated: The brahmin said, “People of the present time are attached to what is contrary to the Dharma, overcome by improper attachments, and entangled in false doctrines.” This is the section of the sutra.

original: chom rkun dang / mthu stobs dang / brid pa la sogs pas ni chom rkun gyis dang / mthu stobs kyis dang / brid pas so //
analyzed: chom rkun dang / mthu stobs dang / brid pa la sogs pas ni chom rkun gyis dang / mthu stobs kyis dang / brid pas so //
translated: By means of theft, force, and deception, etc. means by means of theft, force, and deception.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni log par lung 'bogs pa dang / 'jigs par bstan pa la sogs pas pha rol gyi nor don du gnyer ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni log par lung 'bogs pa dang / 'jigs par bstan pa la sogs pas pha rol gyi nor don du gnyer ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The word “etc.” refers to those who seek the wealth of others by means of false scriptural exegesis, by means of threats, etc.

original: pha rol la 'tshe ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni pha rol 'tshe ba dang 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol la 'tshe ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni pha rol 'tshe ba dang 'brel pa ste /
translated: Possessing violence toward others means being connected with violence toward others.

original: pha rol la 'tshe bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: pha rol la 'tshe bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means “causing violence toward others.”

original: rgyal bo'i chos sam /
analyzed: rgyal bo'i chos sam /
translated: The king’s Dharma

original: bram ze'i chos ni re zhig rgyal po'i chos su byas pa ni rkang pa'i phyed gcad ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bram ze'i chos ni re zhig rgyal po'i chos su byas pa ni rkang pa'i phyed gcad ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Brahmins’ Dharma is the king’s Dharma, such as “cutting off half the foot” and so on.

original: bram ze'i chos kyang ba lang gi mchod sbyin byas la lor ba lang gi brtul zhugs byas na zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bram ze'i chos kyang ba lang gi mchod sbyin byas la lor ba lang gi brtul zhugs byas na zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Brahmins’ Dharma is “having performed the cow sacrifice, one should practice the cow vow for a year” and so on.

original: des ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba dang / des ni yul @241b yongs su spyad pa las brtsams nas mi rnams la log par sgrub pa yod par bstan pa ni da ltar mi rnams ni chos ma yin par chags pas chags pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
analyzed: des ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba dang / des ni yul @241b yongs su spyad pa las brtsams nas mi rnams la log par sgrub pa yod par bstan pa ni da ltar mi rnams ni chos ma yin par chags pas chags pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
translated: “By that” means that, beginning from the enjoyment of objects, it shows that there is wrong practice among humans, with the words “nowadays humans are attached to non-Dharma out of attachment.”

original: longs spyod yongs su tshol ba las brtsams nas ni mi rigs par chags pas zil gyis non pa zhes bya ba 'dis so //
analyzed: longs spyod yongs su tshol ba las brtsams nas ni mi rigs par chags pas zil gyis non pa zhes bya ba 'dis so //
translated: Beginning from the pursuit of enjoyments, it shows that they are overwhelmed by improper attachment, with the words “overwhelmed by improper attachment.”

original: bde 'gro yongs su tshol ba las brtsams nas ni log pa'i chos kyis dkris pa zhes bya ba 'dis so //
analyzed: bde 'gro yongs su tshol ba las brtsams nas ni log pa'i chos kyis dkris pa zhes bya ba 'dis so //
translated: Beginning from the pursuit of happy rebirths, it shows that they are entangled in wrong Dharma, with the words “entangled in wrong Dharma.”

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi gtam dus sngar bya ba gang yin pa de ni 'di lta ste /🔽sbyin pa'i gtam dang / tshul khrims kyi gtam dang / mtho ris kyi gtam dang / 'dod pa rnams la ro myong ba dang / nyes dmigs dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / nges par 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi gtam dus sngar bya ba gang yin pa de ni 'di lta ste / sbyin pa'i gtam dang / tshul khrims kyi gtam dang / mtho ris kyi gtam dang / 'dod pa rnams la ro myong ba dang / nyes dmigs dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / nges par 'byung ba dang /
translated: The topics that the Blessed Buddhas taught in the past are as follows:🔽the topic of generosity, the topic of moral discipline, the topic of rebirth in the heavenly worlds, the topic of the disadvantages of desire, the topic of the afflictions, the topic of purification, the topic of renunciation,

original: rab tu dben pa dang / phan yon dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams rgya cher yang dag par rab tu ston par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: rab tu dben pa dang / phan yon dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams rgya cher yang dag par rab tu ston par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: the topic of solitude, the topic of the advantages, and the topic of the spiritual qualities that are conducive to liberation.

original: gang gi tshe de sems rangs pa dang / sems nyams bde ba dang / sems dga' ba dang / sems sgrib pa med pa dang / yang dag phul can gyi chos bstan pa kun shes par bya ba skal ba dang ldan pa dang / nus par kun du mkhyen par gyur pa de'i tshe sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi yang dag phul can gyi chos bstan pa gang yin pa de ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de sems rangs pa dang / sems nyams bde ba dang / sems dga' ba dang / sems sgrib pa med pa dang / yang dag phul can gyi chos bstan pa kun shes par bya ba skal ba dang ldan pa dang / nus par kun du mkhyen par gyur pa de'i tshe sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi yang dag phul can gyi chos bstan pa gang yin pa de ni 'di lta ste /
translated: When he has a delighted mind, a mind at ease, a mind of joy, a mind free from obscurations, and when he knows that he is fortunate and able to understand the teaching of the excellent truth, then the Blessed Buddhas teach him the excellent truth, which is this:🔽the noble truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path.

original: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mo zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis de la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag yang dag par rab tu ston par mdzad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mo zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis de la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag yang dag par rab tu ston par mdzad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
translated: The Blessed One teaches him the four noble truths in their entirety.🔽This is the passage from the sutra.

original: de ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gtam sngar bya ba ni mdor na ste /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gtam sngar bya ba ni mdor na ste /
translated: The explanation of the passage is as follows.

original: mdor bsdu na longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu las brtsams nas rig par bya ba ni sbyin pa'i gtam zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu las brtsams nas rig par bya ba ni sbyin pa'i gtam zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
translated: In brief, the discourse on generosity is indicated by the phrase “one should know” that which begins with the cause of perfect wealth.

original: lus phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu las brtsams nas rig par bya ba ni tshul khrims kyi gtam zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
analyzed: lus phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu las brtsams nas rig par bya ba ni tshul khrims kyi gtam zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
translated: The discourse on morality is indicated by the phrase “one should know” that which begins with the cause of a perfect body.

original: phun sum tshogs ba de gnyi ga'i khyad par dang / longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa'i khyad par dang / lus phun sum tshogs pa'i khyad par las brtsams nas rig par bya ba ni mtho ris kyi gtam zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs ba de gnyi ga'i khyad par dang / longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa'i khyad par dang / lus phun sum tshogs pa'i khyad par las brtsams nas rig par bya ba ni mtho ris kyi gtam zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
translated: The discourse on heaven is indicated by the phrase “one should know” that which begins with the distinction between those two perfections, the distinction in the perfection of wealth, and the distinction in the perfection of body.

original: de las phyir phyogs par byed pa'i gzhi las brtsams nas rig par bya ba ni 'dod pa @242a * //
analyzed: de las phyir phyogs par byed pa'i gzhi las brtsams nas rig par bya ba ni 'dod pa @242a * //
translated: The discourse on the disadvantages of sense objects is indicated by the phrase “one should know” that which begins with the basis for turning away from that.

original: rnams la ro myang ba dang / nyes dmigs zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
analyzed: rnams la ro myang ba dang / nyes dmigs zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
translated: The discourse on the enjoyment of sense objects and their disadvantages is indicated by the phrase “one should know” the enjoyment of sense objects and their disadvantages.

original: de las nges par 'byung ba'i thabs las brtsams nas rig par bya ba ni nges par 'byung ba dang / rab tu dben pa dang / phan yon dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs dang / mthun pa'i chos rnams rgya cher yang dag par rig pa ston par mdzad pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
analyzed: de las nges par 'byung ba'i thabs las brtsams nas rig par bya ba ni nges par 'byung ba dang / rab tu dben pa dang / phan yon dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs dang / mthun pa'i chos rnams rgya cher yang dag par rig pa ston par mdzad pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
translated: The method of definite emergence from that is taught by the words “the correct understanding of the means of definite emergence, the correct understanding of the factors that contribute to definite emergence, the correct understanding of the factors that contribute to complete enlightenment, and the correct understanding of the factors that are conducive to those.”🔽The words “by means of these two” refer to the two topics of the enjoyment of the desire realm and the teaching of its disadvantages.

original: de gnyis kyis kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'dod pa rnams la ro myang ba dang / de'i nyes dmigs bstan pa 'di gnyis kyis ni 'di ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar byed do //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'dod pa rnams la ro myang ba dang / de'i nyes dmigs bstan pa 'di gnyis kyis ni 'di ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar byed do //
translated: The enjoyment of the desire realm is the cause of affliction, while the teaching of its disadvantages is the cause of purification.

original: de la ro myong bar byed pas ni kun nas nyon mongs par byed do //
analyzed: de la ro myong bar byed pas ni kun nas nyon mongs par byed do //
translated: The enjoyment of the desire realm is the cause of affliction because it causes beings to become afflicted.

original: de'i nyes dmigs bstan pas ni rnam par byang bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i nyes dmigs bstan pas ni rnam par byang bar byed do //
translated: The teaching of its disadvantages is the cause of purification because it causes beings to become purified.

original: de las nges par 'byung ba'i thabs kyang yin te /
analyzed: de las nges par 'byung ba'i thabs kyang yin te /
translated: The method of definite emergence from that is taught by the words “the correct understanding of the means of definite emergence, the correct understanding of the factors that contribute to definite emergence, the correct understanding of the factors that contribute to complete enlightenment, and the correct understanding of the factors that are conducive to those.”

original: de las ni de las phyir phyogs par byed pa'i gzhi ni 'dod pa rnams la ro chung ba nyid dang / nyes dmigs mang ba nyid yin par rig par bya'o //🔽'phags par te khyad par du ches lhag pa dang / ches gya nom pa yin te /
analyzed: de las ni de las phyir phyogs par byed pa'i gzhi ni 'dod pa rnams la ro chung ba nyid dang / nyes dmigs mang ba nyid yin par rig par bya'o // 'phags par te khyad par du ches lhag pa dang / ches gya nom pa yin te /
translated: The basis for turning away from that is the small taste of desires and their many dangers.🔽They are superior to those of the gods, and they are also more sublime.

original: de la lha rdzas kyi rang bzhin yin pa de nyid kyis ches lhag pa yin la /
analyzed: de la lha rdzas kyi rang bzhin yin pa de nyid kyis ches lhag pa yin la /
translated: They are superior because they are divine in nature.

original: kha dog la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pas ches gya nom pa dag yin no //
analyzed: kha dog la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pas ches gya nom pa dag yin no //
translated: They are more sublime because they are perfect in color and so on.

original: gtam 'di'i phan yon yongs su bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gtam dus sngar byas pa 'di'i phan yon yongs su bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gtam 'di'i phan yon yongs su bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gtam dus sngar byas pa 'di'i phan yon yongs su bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The benefits of this story have been taught. The benefits of this story that was told earlier have been taught.

original: go rims bzhin du sems dga' ba zhes bya ba ni rangs pa'i rnam par bshad pa yin la /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du sems dga' ba zhes bya ba ni rangs pa'i rnam par bshad pa yin la /
translated: The mind is delighted means that it is explained as being pleased.

original: sems sgrib pa med pa zhes bya ba ni nyams bde ba'i bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: sems sgrib pa med pa zhes bya ba ni nyams bde ba'i bshad pa yin no //
translated: The mind is free from obscurations means that it is explained as being comfortable.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mchog tu bde ba nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / sgrib pa lnga dang mi ldan pa'i phyir te go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: mchog tu bde ba nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / sgrib pa lnga dang mi ldan pa'i phyir te go rims bzhin no //
translated: because it is endowed with supreme bliss and because it is not associated with the five hindrances, respectively.

original: sgrib pa lnga ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom mo //
analyzed: sgrib pa lnga ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom mo //
translated: The five hindrances are: sensual desire, malice, torpor-and-sleep, restlessness-and-worry, and doubt.

original: sems de'i phan yon yongs su bstan pa ni sems dga' ba dang / sems sgrib pa med pa'i phan yon yongs su bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems de'i phan yon yongs su bstan pa ni sems dga' ba dang / sems sgrib pa med pa'i phan yon yongs su bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The benefits of this mind are shown by the benefits of a joyful mind and a mind free from obscurations.

original: de la sems dga' ba nyid kyis ni skal ba dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: de la sems dga' ba nyid kyis ni skal ba dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Here, the mind is endowed with good fortune through its very joyfulness.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: dga' ba la sogs pa'i rgyu'i rim pas so //
analyzed: dga' ba la sogs pa'i rgyu'i rim pas so //
translated: Through the sequence of the causes of joy, etc.

original: dga' ba la sogs pa nyid kyi rgyu ste /
analyzed: dga' ba la sogs pa nyid kyi rgyu ste /
translated: Joy, etc. are the causes of that mind.

original: rgyu yin pas dga' ba la sogs pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: rgyu yin pas dga' ba la sogs pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Since they are the causes, they are the causes of joy, etc.

original: dga' ba la sogs ba'i @242b rgyu'i rim pas ni dga' ba la sogs pa'i rgyu'i rim pas so //
analyzed: dga' ba la sogs ba'i @242b rgyu'i rim pas ni dga' ba la sogs pa'i rgyu'i rim pas so //
translated: Through the sequence of the causes of joy, etc. means through the sequence of the causes of joy, etc.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: rab tu dga' bas dga' ba skye'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' bas dga' ba skye'o //
translated: joy arises from that faith.

original: yid dga' ni shin tu sbyang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid dga' ni shin tu sbyang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the mind is joyful, it becomes fit.

original: lus shin tu sbyangs na bde ba myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus shin tu sbyangs na bde ba myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the body is fit, one experiences pleasure.

original: bde na sems mnyam par 'jog go //
analyzed: bde na sems mnyam par 'jog go //
translated: When there is pleasure, the mind becomes concentrated.

original: sems mnyam par gzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems mnyam par gzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya'o //
translated: When the mind is concentrated, one knows and sees things as they really are.

original: sems sgrib pa med pa nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: sems sgrib pa med pa nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni bshad zin to //
translated: The phrase “due to the mind being free from obscurations” is explained in detail.

original: kun du mkhyen par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni kun du mkhyen pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: kun du mkhyen par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni kun du mkhyen pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The phrase “one becomes omniscient” means that one possesses omniscience.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The phrase “in another way” is explained in detail.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang skal ba dang ldan pa nyid kyis ni rigs phun sum tshogs pa yongs su bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang skal ba dang ldan pa nyid kyis ni rigs phun sum tshogs pa yongs su bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: In another way, the excellence of the spiritual gene is indicated by the possession of good fortune.

original: nus pa nyid kyis ni yongs su smin pa phun sum tshogs pa yongs su bstan par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: nus pa nyid kyis ni yongs su smin pa phun sum tshogs pa yongs su bstan par rig par bya ste /
translated: The excellence of complete maturation is indicated by the possession of ability.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de'i tshe na de la gnyi ga phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe na de la gnyi ga phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: At that time, both are perfect.

original: 'di ltar gtam du sngar bya bas rgyud snod du byas pa na sems rangs pa dang / nyams bde bar gyur pa la rigs dang / yongs su smin pa phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gtam du sngar bya bas rgyud snod du byas pa na sems rangs pa dang / nyams bde bar gyur pa la rigs dang / yongs su smin pa phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, when the mind is satisfied and happy in the process of being made a suitable recipient for the teaching, the spiritual gene and full maturation are perfect.

original: rigs ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs rnams las gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: rigs ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs rnams las gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: The spiritual gene is any one of the spiritual genes of the disciples, etc.

original: yongs su smin pa ni rgyud la 'bras bu nye bar gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su smin pa ni rgyud la 'bras bu nye bar gnas pa yin no //
translated: Full maturation is the presence of the result in the gene.

original: snga nas yod pa gtam du sngar bya ba'i tshe nas rigs kho nar phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: snga nas yod pa gtam du sngar bya ba'i tshe nas rigs kho nar phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: The spiritual gene is perfect from the very beginning, from the time of the process of being made a suitable recipient for the teaching.

original: rigs ma smos na ste /
analyzed: rigs ma smos na ste /
translated: If the spiritual gene is not mentioned,

original: gal te nus pa zhes bya ba tsam zhig smos kyi /
analyzed: gal te nus pa zhes bya ba tsam zhig smos kyi /
translated: if only the word “ability” is used,

original: skal ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'di ma smos na /
analyzed: skal ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'di ma smos na /
translated: and the word “endowed” is not used,

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis yang dag phul can gyi chos bstan pa ni rigs dang yongs su smin pa nyid ga la ltos pa'o zhes bya ba bstan par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis yang dag phul can gyi chos bstan pa ni rigs dang yongs su smin pa nyid ga la ltos pa'o zhes bya ba bstan par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then it will not be taught that the teaching of the supreme Dharma of the Buddhas depends on the spiritual gene and full maturation.

original: yang dag phul can gyi gtam 'di gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag phul can gyi gtam 'di gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the discourse that is the highest truth?

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa'i gtam ni yang dag phul can te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa'i gtam ni yang dag phul can te /
translated: The discourse on the four noble truths is the highest truth.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gnyis kyis ngan 'gro dang 'khor ba las yang dag phul du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gnyis kyis ngan 'gro dang 'khor ba las yang dag phul du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is that?🔽Because the two paths of seeing and cultivation are the highest truth in that they transcend the miserable realms and cyclic existence.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyis ni ngan 'gro las yang dag phul du byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyis ni ngan 'gro las yang dag phul du byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: The path of seeing is the highest truth in that it transcends the miserable realms,

original: ngan 'gro sel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngan 'gro sel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it eliminates the miserable realms.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyis ni 'khor ba las yang dag phul du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyis ni 'khor ba las yang dag phul du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The path of cultivation is the highest truth in that it transcends cyclic existence.

original: 'bras bu de dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'bras bu de dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it possesses that result means because it possesses the result of nirvana.

original: yang 'byung ba pa'i sred pa bzhin te /🔽'bras bu yang srid pa @243a * //
analyzed: yang 'byung ba pa'i sred pa bzhin te / 'bras bu yang srid pa @243a * //
translated: It is like craving for rebirth,

original: yin pa'i phyir ro /🔽// / rnam par bshad pa rigs pa'i bshad pa /
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir ro / // / rnam par bshad pa rigs pa'i bshad pa /
translated: because the result is rebirth.

original: bam po bcu pa /
analyzed: bam po bcu pa /
translated: The Explanation of the Rational System of Exposition

original: dge slong dag gzugs ni mi rtag pa ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag gzugs ni mi rtag pa ste /
translated: “Monks, form is impermanent.

original: gang mi rtag pa de ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: gang mi rtag pa de ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: What is impermanent is suffering.

original: gang sdug bsngal ba de ni bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: gang sdug bsngal ba de ni bdag med pa'o //
translated: What is suffering is not self.🔽What is not self is not mine.

original: gang dag med pa de thams cad ni bdag gi ma yin /
analyzed: gang dag med pa de thams cad ni bdag gi ma yin /
translated: It is not my self.

original: de ni bdag ma yin /
analyzed: de ni bdag ma yin /
translated: It is not what I am.

original: de ni bdag gi bdag ma yin no zhes des de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi legs pa'i shes rab kyis blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ni bdag gi bdag ma yin no zhes des de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi legs pa'i shes rab kyis blta bar bya'o //
translated: It is not what I have.” In this way, one should see it with right wisdom, just as it is.

original: gzugs la ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i bar la yang legs pa'i shes rab kyis blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i bar la yang legs pa'i shes rab kyis blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should see it with right wisdom, just as it is, up to consciousness.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pas de ltar mthong na gzugs la yid 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pas de ltar mthong na gzugs la yid 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: When the noble disciple who has learning sees in this way, he becomes disenchanted with form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la yid 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la yid 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He becomes disenchanted with feeling, with perception, with volitional formations, and with consciousness.

original: yid 'byung na 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid 'byung na 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When he is disenchanted, he becomes dispassionate.

original: 'dod chags dang bral na rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral na rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
translated: The passage, when one is free from attachment, one is liberated, is a scriptural citation.🔽Here, the passage, “the cause of disgust, freedom from attachment, and liberation is taught in order,” teaches that disgust, freedom from attachment, and liberation are causes.

original: 'dir yid byung ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang rnam par grol ba dang rnam par grol ba rnams kyi rgyur gyur pa ni go rims bzhin du yongs su bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni yid byung ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang /
analyzed: 'dir yid byung ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang rnam par grol ba dang rnam par grol ba rnams kyi rgyur gyur pa ni go rims bzhin du yongs su bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni yid byung ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang /
translated: The cause of disgust is the cause of freedom from attachment.

original: rnam par grol ba rnams kyi rgyur gyur pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba rnams kyi rgyur gyur pa ste /
translated: The cause of freedom from attachment is the cause of liberation.

original: rgyur gyur pa ni go rims bzhin du yongs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyur gyur pa ni go rims bzhin du yongs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: The cause of disgust is taught first, the cause of freedom from attachment is taught second, and the cause of liberation is taught third.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is this so?

original: yid 'byung ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: yid 'byung ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rgyu yin la /
translated: Disgust is the cause of freedom from attachment.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni rnam par grol ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni rnam par grol ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Freedom from attachment is the cause of liberation.

original: de'i thob pa chad pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyi thob pa chad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i thob pa chad pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyi thob pa chad pa'o //
translated: The cessation of the obtainment of attachment is the cessation of the obtainment of attachment.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang ni ji skad bshad pa'i don 'di nyid do //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang ni ji skad bshad pa'i don 'di nyid do //
translated: Another explanation is that the meaning is the same as what was explained above.

original: dga' ba sngon du song ba'i 'dod chags zhes bya ba ni yid bde ba sngon du song ba'i 'dod chags so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽de'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'di ltar dga' ba sngon du song ba'i 'dod chags dang / gzugs la sogs pa dag la 'dod chags sngon du song ba'i sems rang dbang med par 'jug pa nyid kyi 'ching ba yod pas de'i phyir go rims bzhin du de'i gnyen po dga' ba dang /
analyzed: dga' ba sngon du song ba'i 'dod chags zhes bya ba ni yid bde ba sngon du song ba'i 'dod chags so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'di ltar dga' ba sngon du song ba'i 'dod chags dang / gzugs la sogs pa dag la 'dod chags sngon du song ba'i sems rang dbang med par 'jug pa nyid kyi 'ching ba yod pas de'i phyir go rims bzhin du de'i gnyen po dga' ba dang /
translated: Attachment preceded by joy is attachment preceded by mental satisfaction.

original: 'dod chags dang / 'ching ba rnams kyi gnyen po yid 'byung ba la sogs pa rnams ni yid 'byung ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba @243b dang / rnam par grol ba rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / 'ching ba rnams kyi gnyen po yid 'byung ba la sogs pa rnams ni yid 'byung ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba @243b dang / rnam par grol ba rnams so //
translated: Since attachment preceded by joy and the mind preceded by attachment to form and so on are bound, the antidotes to joy, attachment, and bondage are renunciation, freedom from attachment, and liberation, respectively.

original: yid 'byung ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rnam par grol ba rnams dus tha dad pa nyid ma yin par mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi go rims kyi bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: yid 'byung ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rnam par grol ba rnams dus tha dad pa nyid ma yin par mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi go rims kyi bshad pa yin te /
translated: The explanation of the order of the opposites is as follows:

original: de la yid byung ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni dga' ba yin no //🔽'dod chags dang bral ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni 'dod chags yin no //
analyzed: de la yid byung ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni dga' ba yin no // 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni 'dod chags yin no //
translated: The opposite of disenchantment is delight.🔽The opposite of freedom from attachment is attachment.

original: rnam par grol ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni 'ching ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni 'ching ba yin no //
translated: The opposite of liberation is bondage.

original: de ltar na mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi go rims kyi bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi go rims kyi bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the explanation of the order of the opposites.

original: dper na ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag ces bya ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag ces bya ba lta bu ste /
translated: For example, “through the cessation of ignorance, the karmic forces cease,”

original: ma rig pa 'gag pa la sogs pa yang dus tha dad pa ma yin pa yang go rims kyi bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa 'gag pa la sogs pa yang dus tha dad pa ma yin pa yang go rims kyi bshad pa yin no //
translated: and the cessation of ignorance, etc., are not at different times. This is the explanation of the order.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyas par gsungs nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyas par gsungs nas /
translated: Moreover, the Blessed One has taught in detail with other synonyms.

original: 'di la ji ltar dge slong rnam pa gang dag dang / rtags gang dag dang / mtshan ma gang dag gis sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dpen pa rtog pa dang bcas pa dpyod pa dang bcas pa dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can gyi bsam gtan dang po rdzogs par byas te gnas la /
analyzed: 'di la ji ltar dge slong rnam pa gang dag dang / rtags gang dag dang / mtshan ma gang dag gis sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dpen pa rtog pa dang bcas pa dpyod pa dang bcas pa dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can gyi bsam gtan dang po rdzogs par byas te gnas la /
translated: Here, how does a monk, through whatever aspects, through whatever signs, through whatever marks, having completed the first concentration that possesses investigation, that possesses analysis, and is joyful and blissful, isolated from desires and isolated from evil nonvirtuous phenomena,

original: de rnam pa de dag dang / rtags de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag yid la mi byed cing /
analyzed: de rnam pa de dag dang / rtags de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag yid la mi byed cing /
translated: not attend to those aspects, those signs, and those marks,

original: 'on kyang don yod pa'i gzugs su gtogs pa nas /
analyzed: 'on kyang don yod pa'i gzugs su gtogs pa nas /
translated: but rather attends to the form that is included in the formless,🔽up to the consciousness that is included in the formless?

original: rnam par shes par gtogs pa'i bar gang yin pa la dmigs pa yin zhes de ltar rgyas par gsungs nas /
analyzed: rnam par shes par gtogs pa'i bar gang yin pa la dmigs pa yin zhes de ltar rgyas par gsungs nas /
translated: Having said that in detail,

original: de chos de dag la nad nyid dang zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: de chos de dag la nad nyid dang zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: it says, “He attends to those phenomena as disease,” and so on.

original: 'dir ni rnam par bshad pa 'di ji ltar na ste rnam pa gang gis na 'chi ba med pa'i dbyings la sems nye bar sbyor ba zhes gang gsungs pa zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa yid la byed pa las 'dod chags dang
analyzed: 'dir ni rnam par bshad pa 'di ji ltar na ste rnam pa gang gis na 'chi ba med pa'i dbyings la sems nye bar sbyor ba zhes gang gsungs pa zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa yid la byed pa las 'dod chags dang
translated: One becomes free from attachment to the mental attention of nirvana.

original: bral bar 'gyur ba la /🔽phyis rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bsam pa brjod dgos so //
analyzed: bral bar 'gyur ba la / phyis rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bsam pa brjod dgos so //
translated: Later, one becomes liberated.

original: gal te mya ngan las 'das pa yid la byed pa las 'dod chags kyi thob pa chad pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te mya ngan las 'das pa yid la byed pa las 'dod chags kyi thob pa chad pa yin te /
translated: If the attainment of attachment is severed through mental attention of nirvana,

original: de ltar na sngar 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na sngar 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur pa yin la /
translated: then one becomes free from attachment previously.🔽If one abides without that, later one becomes liberated.

original: de dang mi ldan par gnas gyur pa ni phyis rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba de lta na ni snga ma dang 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir khyad par 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: de dang mi ldan par gnas gyur pa ni phyis rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba de lta na ni snga ma dang 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir khyad par 'ga' yang med do //
translated: If that is so, then there is no difference at all because it is just like the previous case.

original: 'on te mya ngan las 'das pa yid la byed pa kho nas 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mya ngan las 'das pa yid la byed pa kho nas 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if you claim that one becomes free from attachment by taking nirvana to mind,

original: @244a * // de lta na ni thob pa yod bzhin du ji ltar na 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: @244a * // de lta na ni thob pa yod bzhin du ji ltar na 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur la /
translated: then how can one become free from attachment while still possessing the attainment?🔽And how can one later become liberated?

original: ji ltar na phyis rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bsam pa brjod dgos so //
analyzed: ji ltar na phyis rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bsam pa brjod dgos so //
translated: You must explain the meaning of this passage.

original: rgyas par gsungs nas /🔽sems zhes bya ba'am /🔽yid ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: rgyas par gsungs nas / sems zhes bya ba'am / yid ces bya ba'am /
translated: After explaining this in detail,🔽the Buddha said:🔽Whatever is called mind,

original: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba yang rung ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba yang rung ste /
translated: thought, or consciousness,

original: gang 'di skad ces bya ba de ni byis pa so so'i skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pas yun ring po nas byi dor byas shing sbas la bdag gir byas pa dang / 'di ni bdag gi yin /
analyzed: gang 'di skad ces bya ba de ni byis pa so so'i skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pas yun ring po nas byi dor byas shing sbas la bdag gir byas pa dang / 'di ni bdag gi yin /
translated: that the foolish, the untrained, the ordinary person, who is not a noble being, has long cherished, concealed, and held as “mine.”

original: 'di ni nga bdag yin /
analyzed: 'di ni nga bdag yin /
translated: This is mine,🔽this I am, this is my self.

original: 'di ni bdag gi bdag yin no zhes bya ba khas blangs la gzung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gi bdag yin no zhes bya ba khas blangs la gzung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
translated: This is the passage from the sutra.

original: ci'i phyir byi dor byas shing sbas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir byi dor byas shing sbas pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it polished and hidden?

original: bshad pa / 'di ltar de bdag gir byas pas so //🔽ji ltar de bdag gir byas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: bshad pa / 'di ltar de bdag gir byas pas so // ji ltar de bdag gir byas pa yin zhe na /
translated: Because it is appropriated.🔽How is it appropriated?

original: bshad pa 'di ltar khas blang ba la gzung bas so //
analyzed: bshad pa 'di ltar khas blang ba la gzung bas so //
translated: Because it is grasped by the view that it is mine.

original: de'i rjes su 'brang bas zhes bya ba ni bdag gi ba dang / bdag gir rnam par lta ba gnyis kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'brang bas zhes bya ba ni bdag gi ba dang / bdag gir rnam par lta ba gnyis kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term “that which follows it” means that which follows the two views of “mine” and “I.”

original: rjes su 'brang ba ni rjes su 'gro ba'o //🔽khas blangs pa ni lta bas te /
analyzed: rjes su 'brang ba ni rjes su 'gro ba'o // khas blangs pa ni lta bas te /
translated: That which follows is that which goes after.🔽The view is the appropriation, because it is the appropriation in two ways.

original: rnam pa gnyis kyis khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes gang bstan pa'i rnam pa gnyis po de ni 'di ni bdag gi yin zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'i tshig gsum po dag gis sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyis khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes gang bstan pa'i rnam pa gnyis po de ni 'di ni bdag gi yin zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'i tshig gsum po dag gis sbyor bar byed do //
translated: The two ways that were taught are applied by the three statements beginning with “This is mine.”

original: rnam pa gnyis po zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni bdag tu lta ba rnam pa gnyis po lhan cig skyes pa dang / kun du brtags pa dang / go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis po zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni bdag tu lta ba rnam pa gnyis po lhan cig skyes pa dang / kun du brtags pa dang / go rims bzhin no //
translated: The two types of view of the self are the innate view of the self and the imaginary view of the self, respectively.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is this so?

original: bdag tu lta ba lhan cig skyes pa dang ni 'di ni nga bdag yin zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba lhan cig skyes pa dang ni 'di ni nga bdag yin zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The innate view of the self is the thought “I am.”

original: ri dags dang bya la sogs pa yang yod pa'o //
analyzed: ri dags dang bya la sogs pa yang yod pa'o //
translated: It is found even among animals, birds, and so on.

original: kun du brtags ba dang ni 'di ni bdag gi bdag yin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: kun du brtags ba dang ni 'di ni bdag gi bdag yin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The imaginary view of the self is the thought “This is my self.”

original: mu stegs can rnams la gang yod pa'o //
analyzed: mu stegs can rnams la gang yod pa'o //
translated: It is found only among the tīrthikas.

original: khas blangs pa ni zhen pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khas blangs pa ni zhen pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term “acceptance” means “attachment.”

original: gzhan yang ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang ste /
translated: Moreover,

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang bdag tu lta ba rnam pa gnyis po zhes bya ba ni gzhi tha mi dad pa dang / gzhi tha dad pa dang / go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang bdag tu lta ba rnam pa gnyis po zhes bya ba ni gzhi tha mi dad pa dang / gzhi tha dad pa dang / go rims bzhin no //
translated: the two types of view of the self are the view of the self that has a nondifferent basis and the view of the self that has a different basis, respectively.

original: de la bdag tu lta ba gzhi tha mi dad pa ni gzhi nye bar len pa'i phung po'i mtshan nyid la tha mi dad par bzung nas 'di ni bdag yin no snyam pa'o //🔽'jig tshogs la lta ba gzhi tha dad pa dang ni gzugs la sogs pa de rnams las gang @244b yang rung ba zhig bzung nas /
analyzed: de la bdag tu lta ba gzhi tha mi dad pa ni gzhi nye bar len pa'i phung po'i mtshan nyid la tha mi dad par bzung nas 'di ni bdag yin no snyam pa'o // 'jig tshogs la lta ba gzhi tha dad pa dang ni gzugs la sogs pa de rnams las gang @244b yang rung ba zhig bzung nas /
translated: The view of self that is not different from its basis is the view that thinks, “This is the self,” when it is grasped as not different from the characteristics of the aggregates that are its basis.

original: 'di ni bdag gi bdag yin no snyam pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gi bdag yin no snyam pa'o //
translated: The view of the perishing aggregates that is different from its basis is the view that thinks, “This is the self of the self,” when any of the aggregates such as form are grasped.

original: de'i rjes la mthun pa'i sred pa gnyis po zhes bya ba ni bdag gi ba'i rnam pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i sred pa dang / bdag tu lta ba rnam pa gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i sred pa ste gzung ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i rjes la mthun pa'i sred pa gnyis po zhes bya ba ni bdag gi ba'i rnam pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i sred pa dang / bdag tu lta ba rnam pa gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i sred pa ste gzung ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The two types of craving that are in accordance with that are the craving that is in accordance with the aspect of the self of the self and the craving that is in accordance with the aspect of the two types of views of the self. This means that they are the objects.

original: de'i rjes su mthun pa'i sred pa yang bdag dang / bdag gi ba'i rnam par lta ba'i mjug thogs su der lta ba'i rjes su 'brang bas chags pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su mthun pa'i sred pa yang bdag dang / bdag gi ba'i rnam par lta ba'i mjug thogs su der lta ba'i rjes su 'brang bas chags pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The craving that is in accordance with that is the attachment that follows the view of the self and the self of the self, because it follows that view.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / bdag tu lta ba gnyis kyis dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyis ni 'di ni bdag yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / bdag tu lta ba gnyis kyis dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyis ni 'di ni bdag yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Another explanation: by the two, the pride thinking “I am” and the view of self, means that by the pride thinking “I am,” one thinks “This is my self.”

original: bdag tu lta bas ni 'di ni bdag gi bdag yin no zhes bya ba dang / 'di ni bdag gi yin zhes bya ba bdag gi ba'i rnam pa'i rnam grangs dang por gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: bdag tu lta bas ni 'di ni bdag gi bdag yin no zhes bya ba dang / 'di ni bdag gi yin zhes bya ba bdag gi ba'i rnam pa'i rnam grangs dang por gsungs pa ste /
translated: By the view of self, one thinks “This is the self of my self” and “This is mine,” which is the first category of “mine.”

original: de mngon par khas blangs pa'i phyir khas blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de mngon par khas blangs pa'i phyir khas blangs pa yin no //
translated: Since one accepts that, it is acceptance.

original: de'i rjes su mthun pa'i sred pa gnyis kyi ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi rjes su mthun pa dang / bdag tu lta ba'i rjes su mthun pa dang / rnam grangs dang po bdag gi ba'i rjes su mthun pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes su mthun pa'i sred pa gnyis kyi ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi rjes su mthun pa dang / bdag tu lta ba'i rjes su mthun pa dang / rnam grangs dang po bdag gi ba'i rjes su mthun pa ste /
translated: The two cravings that conform to that are the craving that conforms to the pride thinking “I am” and the craving that conforms to the view of self, which is the first category of “mine.”

original: de la chags pa'i phyir gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: de la chags pa'i phyir gzung ba yin no //
translated: Since one is attached to that, it is grasping.

original: 'di thams cad ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'di ni bdag gi yin zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'di ni bdag gi yin zhes bya ba nas /
translated: All of this is mine, etc.

original: khas blang sa la bzung ba yin no zhes bya ba'i bar ni bdag gir byas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khas blang sa la bzung ba yin no zhes bya ba'i bar ni bdag gir byas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase “this is mine” up to “I am this” is called “appropriation.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de'i rnam pa dang / de'i rgyu nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa dang / de'i rgyu nyid kyis so //
translated: Because of its aspect and because of its cause.

original: de'i rnam pa ni bdag gi ba'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa ni bdag gi ba'i rnam pa ste /
translated: Its aspect is the aspect of “mine.”

original: 'di ni bdag gi yin zhes bya ba 'dis so //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gi yin zhes bya ba 'dis so //
translated: It is this that is called “mine.”

original: de'i rgyu nyid kyis kyang yin te /🔽bdag gi ba'i rnam pa'i rgyus te /🔽'di ni nga bdag yin /
analyzed: de'i rgyu nyid kyis kyang yin te / bdag gi ba'i rnam pa'i rgyus te / 'di ni nga bdag yin /
translated: It is also because of its cause.🔽The cause of the aspect of “mine” is the cause of the aspect of “I.”🔽This is my self.

original: 'di ni bdag yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di gnyis kyis so //
translated: This is my self.

original: smras pa / ji ltar na de'i rgyu nyid kyis te /
analyzed: smras pa / ji ltar na de'i rgyu nyid kyis te /
translated: How is it that it is because of its cause?

original: 'di gnyis kyis de bdag gir byas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyis de bdag gir byas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that these two phrases “this is mine” and “this is I” are the cause of appropriation?

original: bdag gi rnam pa yod na bdag gi ba'i rnam pa yang gdon mi za bar 'byung bas so //
analyzed: bdag gi rnam pa yod na bdag gi ba'i rnam pa yang gdon mi za bar 'byung bas so //
translated: When the aspect of “mine” exists, the aspect of “I” will certainly arise.

original: mdor na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mdor na mdo sde'i dum bu 'dis ni byis pa rnams kyi so so rnam par shes pa la bdag tu lta ba log par bsgrub pa dang / sred pa log par bsgrub pa las dang bcas pa yin par yongs su bstan pa yin no //🔽de la las ni byi dor byas shing sbas pa zhes bya ba'i tshig @245a * //
analyzed: mdor na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mdor na mdo sde'i dum bu 'dis ni byis pa rnams kyi so so rnam par shes pa la bdag tu lta ba log par bsgrub pa dang / sred pa log par bsgrub pa las dang bcas pa yin par yongs su bstan pa yin no // de la las ni byi dor byas shing sbas pa zhes bya ba'i tshig @245a * //
translated: In brief, as it is said in detail, in brief, this passage from the sutra shows that the childish establish the view of self in the individual consciousnesses and establish craving in the act of grasping.

original: gnyis kyis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis kyis rig par bya'o //
translated: The act is to be understood by the two terms “polished and concealed.”

original: bdag tu lta ba log par sgrub pa nyid bzung ba zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di bor te /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba log par sgrub pa nyid bzung ba zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di bor te /
translated: The establishment of the view of self is to be understood by the term “grasping.”

original: bdag gir byas pa dang / 'di ni bdag gi yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig lnga dag gis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gir byas pa dang / 'di ni bdag gi yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig lnga dag gis rig par bya'o //
translated: The establishment of the view of self is to be understood by the five terms “mine,” “this is mine,” and so on.

original: sred pa log par bsgrub pa yang bzung ba zhes bya ba 'dis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sred pa log par bsgrub pa yang bzung ba zhes bya ba 'dis rig par bya'o //
translated: The establishment of craving is to be understood by the term “grasping.”

original: bdag tu lta ba nyid log par bsgrub pa yin pas bdag tu lta ba log par bsgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba nyid log par bsgrub pa yin pas bdag tu lta ba log par bsgrub pa yin no //
translated: The establishment of the view of self is the establishment of the view of self.

original: de bzhin du sred pa nyid log par bsgrub pa yin pas sred pa log par bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sred pa nyid log par bsgrub pa yin pas sred pa log par bsgrub pa'o //
translated: In the same way, craving is established as a perversion, so craving is established as a perversion.

original: re zhig rnam grangs dang po'i bsdus pa'i don ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: re zhig rnam grangs dang po'i bsdus pa'i don ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of the inclusion in the first enumeration.

original: gnyis pa'i ni bdag tu lta ba dang / nga rgyal dang / sred pa log par bsgrub pa yin par yongs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa'i ni bdag tu lta ba dang / nga rgyal dang / sred pa log par bsgrub pa yin par yongs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: The second is the teaching of the establishment of the perversions of the view of self, pride, and craving.

original: ji ltar byas pas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas she na /
translated: How is it done?

original: re zhig bdag tu lta ba log par bsgrub pa las dang bcas par yongs su bstan pa ni snga ma bzhin du bzung ba dang / 'di ni nga bdag yin zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di gnyis bor te'o //
analyzed: re zhig bdag tu lta ba log par bsgrub pa las dang bcas par yongs su bstan pa ni snga ma bzhin du bzung ba dang / 'di ni nga bdag yin zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di gnyis bor te'o //
translated: The teaching of the establishment of the perversion of the view of self together with its action is like the previous one, except that the two phrases “this is my self” are omitted.

original: nga rgyal log par bsgrub pa las dang bcas pa yang 'di ni nga bdag yin zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
analyzed: nga rgyal log par bsgrub pa las dang bcas pa yang 'di ni nga bdag yin zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
translated: The establishment of the perversion of pride together with its action is by the phrase “this is my self.”

original: sred pa log par bsgrub pa las dang bcas pa yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sred pa log par bsgrub pa las dang bcas pa yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The establishment of the perversion of craving together with its action is like the previous one.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dper na grong ngam grong rdal dang ha cang mi ring ba zhig na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dper na grong ngam grong rdal dang ha cang mi ring ba zhig na /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Suppose there were a river not far from a village or town,

original: mdag ma me lce med pa du ba med pa'i mdag mas gang ba'i klung zhig yod la de nas mi byis pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa /
analyzed: mdag ma me lce med pa du ba med pa'i mdag mas gang ba'i klung zhig yod la de nas mi byis pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa /
translated: filled with embers without flames or smoke.

original: rmongs pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa /
analyzed: rmongs pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa /
translated: A child, not a fool,

original: shes rab kyi rang bzhin can bde ba 'dod pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi rang bzhin can bde ba 'dod pa /
translated: with a nature of wisdom, who desires happiness,

original: sdug bsngal la mi dga' ba /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la mi dga' ba /
translated: who does not like suffering,

original: gson par 'dod pa /
analyzed: gson par 'dod pa /
translated: who desires life,

original: 'chi bar mi 'dod pa /🔽'chi ba la mi dga' ba zhig 'ongs pa dang / de 'di snyam du mdag ma me lce med pa du ba med pa'i mdag mas gang ba'i klung 'dir bdag lhung na bdag 'chi ba'am /
analyzed: 'chi bar mi 'dod pa / 'chi ba la mi dga' ba zhig 'ongs pa dang / de 'di snyam du mdag ma me lce med pa du ba med pa'i mdag mas gang ba'i klung 'dir bdag lhung na bdag 'chi ba'am /
translated: who does not desire death,🔽who does not like death, would come to that river.

original: 'chi ba la thug pa tsam gyis sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: 'chi ba la thug pa tsam gyis sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas /
translated: He would think, ‘If I fall into this river filled with embers without flames or smoke, I will die or will come to a state like death and will suffer.’

original: de de las bsring bar sems pa dang / sring ba sngon du gnyer bar byed cing /
analyzed: de de las bsring bar sems pa dang / sring ba sngon du gnyer bar byed cing /
translated: Thinking that, he would think of escaping from it, and would strive to escape.

original: bsring ba la so sor brtags nas sems 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: bsring ba la so sor brtags nas sems 'jog par byed do //
translated: He places his mind by investigating in order to extend it.

original: mdag ma'i klung dang 'dra bar 'dod pa rnams kyang de bzhin du gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
analyzed: mdag ma'i klung dang 'dra bar 'dod pa rnams kyang de bzhin du gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
translated: The desire realm is like a river of embers.

original: so sor brtags nas sems 'jog pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyis dpyad nas @245b sems gtod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: so sor brtags nas sems 'jog pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyis dpyad nas @245b sems gtod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Placing the mind by investigating means that after examining with wisdom, one focuses the mind.🔽This is the meaning of the passage.

original: ji ltar don du gnyer ba dang yid la byed pa skye ba de ni yon tan nyid du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung bas ston to //
