original: rol tu phyin pa bcu dag ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa drug dang / gzhan yang bzhi ste thabs mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /🔽ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: rol tu phyin pa bcu dag ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa drug dang / gzhan yang bzhi ste thabs mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /🔽ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The ten perfections are the six perfections such as generosity, plus four more: the perfection of skillful means, the perfection of aspiration, the perfection of power, and the perfection of wisdom.

original: sa bcu dag ni rab tu dga' ba dang / dri ma med pa dang / 'od byed pa dang / 'od 'phro ba can dang / shin tu sbyang dka' ba dang / mngon du gyur pa dang / ring du song ba dang / mi g-yo ba dang /
analyzed: sa bcu dag ni rab tu dga' ba dang / dri ma med pa dang / 'od byed pa dang / 'od 'phro ba can dang / shin tu sbyang dka' ba dang / mngon du gyur pa dang / ring du song ba dang / mi g-yo ba dang /
translated: The ten stages are the Joyous, the Stainless, the Shining, the Blazing, the Difficult to Master, the Manifested, the Far-reaching, the Unshakable,

original: legs pa'i blo gros dang / chos kyi sprin no //
analyzed: legs pa'i blo gros dang / chos kyi sprin no //
translated: the Excellent Intelligence, and the Cloud of Dharma.

original: rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi sde ni gang las sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / nyan thos rnams kyi phul du byung ba bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi sde ni gang las sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / nyan thos rnams kyi phul du byung ba bstan pa ni /
translated: The marvelous Dharma is that from which the excellences of the Buddhas, Bodhisattvas, and Sravakas are taught.

original: rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi mdo sde rnams las so //
analyzed: rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi mdo sde rnams las so //
translated: The marvelous Dharma is the Sutras.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: gzhan rnams zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo gzhan rnams kyis so //
analyzed: gzhan rnams zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo gzhan rnams kyis so //
translated: others means other ordinary beings.

original: chos kyi rjes su mthun par ni mdo sde dang mthun par ro //
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su mthun par ni mdo sde dang mthun par ro //
translated: In accordance with the Dharma means in accordance with the Sutras.

original: de'i don rnam par 'chad pas ni mdo sde'i don rnam par 'chad pas ma mo zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i don rnam par 'chad pas ni mdo sde'i don rnam par 'chad pas ma mo zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The explanation of its meaning is the explanation of the meaning of the Sutras.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: mdo sde'i don bshad pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mdo sde'i don bshad pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is the basis for the explanation of the meaning of the Sutras.

original: mdo sde'i don gzhan bshad pa'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mdo sde'i don gzhan bshad pa'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the Sutras is explained on the basis of the Abhidharma.

original: ji ltar na chos kyi mtshan nyid la mngon du phyogs par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na chos kyi mtshan nyid la mngon du phyogs par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does it make the characteristics of the dharmas evident?

original: mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log par ston pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log par ston pa nyid kyis so //
translated: By teaching the characteristics without error.

original: de ltar na sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis po 'di ni sde snod gsum du bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis po 'di ni sde snod gsum du bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the Buddha's word, which is twelvefold, is included in the three Baskets.

original: ji ltar byas pas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas she na /
translated: How is it included?

original: re zhig chos mngon pa ni ji skad du bstan pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: re zhig chos mngon pa ni ji skad du bstan pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: The Abhidharma is as it has been presented.

original: gleng gzhi'i sde dang / de lta bu byung ba'i sde de ni 'dul ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: gleng gzhi'i sde dang / de lta bu byung ba'i sde de ni 'dul ba kho na yin te /
translated: The Vaibhasikas say: The Nidana and the Vyakarana are the Vinaya,

original: der 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they include the Vinaya.

original: lhag ma ni mdo de yin te /
analyzed: lhag ma ni mdo de yin te /
translated: The remaining nine are the Sutra.

original: de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu yin no //
translated: That is how it is.

original: gzhan dag na re don rnams kyi ni gleng gzhi'i sde gang yin pa de ni 'dul ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re don rnams kyi ni gleng gzhi'i sde gang yin pa de ni 'dul ba yin no //
translated: Others say: The Nidana is the Vinaya, because it is the basis for the meaning of the Vinaya.

original: gtan la phebs par bstan pa gang yin pa de ni chos mngon pa yin la /
analyzed: gtan la phebs par bstan pa gang yin pa de ni chos mngon pa yin la /
translated: The Abhidharma is that which teaches the ascertainment of the meaning of the Sutras.🔽The Vaibhasikas say: The Abhidharma is that which teaches the ascertainment of the meaning of the Sutras.

original: lhag ma ni mdo sde yin te /
analyzed: lhag ma ni mdo sde yin te /
translated: The remaining two are the Sutras.🔽Thus, these are the three Baskets.🔽The Abhidharma is that which teaches the ascertainment of the meaning of the Sutras.

original: 'di ni sde snod gsum yin no zhes bshad do zhes zer te /
analyzed: 'di ni sde snod gsum yin no zhes bshad do zhes zer te /
translated: The Abhidharma is that which teaches the ascertainment of the meaning of the Sutras.🔽The Vaibhasikas say: The Abhidharma is that which teaches the ascertainment of the meaning of the Sutras.🔽The remaining two are the Sutras.🔽Thus, these are the three Baskets.🔽The Abhidharma is that which teaches the ascertainment of the meaning of the Sutras.

original: gtan la phebs par bstan pa ni gtan la bab par bstan pa'i sde'o //
analyzed: gtan la phebs par bstan pa ni gtan la bab par bstan pa'i sde'o //
translated: The Abhidharma is that which teaches the ascertainment of the meaning of the Sutras.🔽The Vaibhasikas say: The Abhidharma is that which teaches the ascertainment of the meaning of the Sutras.🔽The remaining two are the Sutras.🔽Thus, these are the three Baskets.

original: nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis te /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis te /
translated: The Abhidharma is that which teaches the ascertainment of the meaning of the Sutras.🔽The Abhidharma is that which teaches the ascertainment of the meaning of the Sutras.🔽The Vaibhasikas say: The Abhidharma is that which teaches the ascertainment of the meaning of the Sutras.🔽The remaining two are the Sutras.🔽Thus, these are the three Baskets.🔽The Abhidharma is that which teaches the ascertainment of the meaning of the Sutras.🔽The Abhidharma is that which teaches the ascertainment of the meaning of the Sutras.

original: nges pa'i tshig gi rnam pas na shin tu rgyas pa'i sde zhes bya ba yin no //🔽yon tan dang skyon skye ba dang 'grib pa thams cad kyi mthar @247b thug pa'i gnas ni yon tan skye ba thams cad kyi mthar thug pa'i gnas dang / skyon 'grib pa thams cad kyi mthar thug pa'i gnas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir na'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig gi rnam pas na shin tu rgyas pa'i sde zhes bya ba yin no //🔽yon tan dang skyon skye ba dang 'grib pa thams cad kyi mthar @247b thug pa'i gnas ni yon tan skye ba thams cad kyi mthar thug pa'i gnas dang / skyon 'grib pa thams cad kyi mthar thug pa'i gnas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir na'o //
translated: The Vaibhasikas say: The Abhidharma is that which teaches the ascertainment of the meaning of the Sutras.🔽The remaining

original: chos shin tu zab pa dang rgya che ba la mos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chos shin tu zab pa la mos pa'i phyir dang / chos shin tu rgya che ba la mos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos shin tu zab pa dang rgya che ba la mos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chos shin tu zab pa la mos pa'i phyir dang / chos shin tu rgya che ba la mos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of their interest in the extremely profound and vast Dharma.

original: rtogs par dka' ba'i don gyis na shin tu zab pa yin la /
analyzed: rtogs par dka' ba'i don gyis na shin tu zab pa yin la /
translated: The extremely profound is due to the difficulty of realizing the meaning.

original: mthus ni shin tu rgya che ba yin no //
analyzed: mthus ni shin tu rgya che ba yin no //
translated: The extremely vast is due to the power of the Dharma.

original: bdag dang gzhan du mnyam pa nyid du ni bsam pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan du mnyam pa nyid du ni bsam pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The equality of self and other is due to the attainment of the attitude.🔽The equality of the two, self and other, is the equality of self and other.

original: bdag dang gzhan gnyis su mnyam pa nyid ni bdag ji ltar bde ba dang sdug bsngal thams cad nye bar zhi ba 'dod pa ltar gzhan dag la yang de bzhin du ste /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gnyis su mnyam pa nyid ni bdag ji ltar bde ba dang sdug bsngal thams cad nye bar zhi ba 'dod pa ltar gzhan dag la yang de bzhin du ste /
translated: Just as one desires for oneself the pacification of all suffering and the attainment of all happiness, so one should also desire that for others.

original: de ltar bdag dang gzhan gnyis la mnyam pa nyid ni bdag dang gzhan du mnyam pa nyid de /
analyzed: de ltar bdag dang gzhan gnyis la mnyam pa nyid ni bdag dang gzhan du mnyam pa nyid de /
translated: Thus, the equality of the two, self and other, is the equality of self and other.

original: de'i bsam pa ni sems pa dang 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: de'i bsam pa ni sems pa dang 'dod pa ste /
translated: The attitude is the thought and the desire.

original: bdag dang gzhan du mnyam pa nyid kyis bsam pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan du mnyam pa nyid kyis bsam pa'o //
translated: The attitude of the equality of self and other is the attitude of the equality of self and other.

original: de thob pa de'i phyir bdag dang gzhan du mnyam pa nyid kyi bsam pa thob pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de thob pa de'i phyir bdag dang gzhan du mnyam pa nyid kyi bsam pa thob pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has attained that, he has attained the attitude of sameness with regard to self and others.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa la zhes bya ba la /
translated: On the pure stage of superior intention,

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa ni sa dang po yin no //🔽sems can thams cad dang mi mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sku yang dag par 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad dang mi mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sku yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa ni sa dang po yin no // sems can thams cad dang mi mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sku yang dag par 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad dang mi mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sku yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phyir te /
translated: the pure stage of superior intention is the first stage.🔽Because he accomplishes the incomparable body of the Buddha for all sentient beings.

original: thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because he accomplishes the incomparable body of the Buddha for all sentient beings, he has attained it.

original: mtshungs pa med pa'i sde zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: mtshungs pa med pa'i sde zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: It is also called the stage of the incomparable assembly.

original: nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis ni mtshungs pa dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis ni mtshungs pa dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir ro /
translated: In the manner of an etymological explanation, it is free from comparison.

original: rgyas pa'i phyir na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni go ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyas pa'i phyir na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni go ba yin no //
translated: The meaning of the verse on the stage of expansion is understood.

original: don bshad pa ni tshig gi don bshad pa'i phyogs shig bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: don bshad pa ni tshig gi don bshad pa'i phyogs shig bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning is explained in order to indicate a portion of the explanation of the words.

original: tshig gi don bshad pa'i phyogs ni tshig gi don bshad pa'i phyogs so //🔽tshig gi don bshad pa'i phyogs de bstan pa'i phyir ni bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshig gi don bshad pa'i phyogs ni tshig gi don bshad pa'i phyogs so // tshig gi don bshad pa'i phyogs de bstan pa'i phyir ni bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: The portion of the explanation of the words is the portion of the explanation of the words.🔽In order to indicate that portion of the explanation of the words is in order to teach that portion.

original: ched du tshig gi don bshad pa'i phyogs shig bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ched du tshig gi don bshad pa'i phyogs shig bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to teach that portion of the explanation of the words, in order to indicate a portion of the explanation of the words.

original: phyogs 'dis ni ste /
analyzed: phyogs 'dis ni ste /
translated: By this portion,

original: don gyi phyogs 'dis ni blo dang ldan pa rnams kyis tshig gzhan ma bstan pa rnams kyi don yang brtag par bya'o //🔽rnam par bshad pa rigs pa'i bshad pa las le'ur bcad pa @248a * //
analyzed: don gyi phyogs 'dis ni blo dang ldan pa rnams kyis tshig gzhan ma bstan pa rnams kyi don yang brtag par bya'o // rnam par bshad pa rigs pa'i bshad pa las le'ur bcad pa @248a * //
translated: by this portion of the meaning, the wise should also investigate the meaning of the other words that are not taught.

original: gnyis so / //
analyzed: gnyis so / //
translated: In the Principles of Exegesis, two chapters.

original: / de ltar re zhig tshig gi don ni brjod pa gang gis brjod par bya ba gang yin pa ste zhes rgyas par gsungs pa dang / tshig gi don bshad pa'i phyogs shig bstan pa'i phyir mdo sde'i dum bu'i tshig brgya dag gi don yang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: / de ltar re zhig tshig gi don ni brjod pa gang gis brjod par bya ba gang yin pa ste zhes rgyas par gsungs pa dang / tshig gi don bshad pa'i phyogs shig bstan pa'i phyir mdo sde'i dum bu'i tshig brgya dag gi don yang bshad pa yin no //
translated: And in order to indicate one way of explaining the meaning of the words, the meaning of the hundred words of the sūtra passage is also explained.

original: gzhan yang rnam pa bzhi dag gis tshig gi don rig par bya ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam pa bzhi dag gis tshig gi don rig par bya ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Moreover, the meaning of the words should be understood by means of four aspects.

original: bstan du yod pa dang / bstan du med pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang /
analyzed: bstan du yod pa dang / bstan du med pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang /
translated: The classification of the aspects of the visible, invisible, etc. The term “etc.” includes the wholesome, unwholesome, indeterminate, desire realm, form realm,

original: gzugs med pa dang / rab tu ldan pa dang / mi ldan pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa dang / rab tu ldan pa dang / mi ldan pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: formless realm, associated, unassociated, etc.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa'i nye rgyu yang byas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa la sogs pa so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi po dag gi nye rgyu ste /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa'i nye rgyu yang byas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa la sogs pa so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi po dag gi nye rgyu ste /
translated: The four analytical knowledges are the proximate causes of the analytical knowledge of the teaching, etc.

original: rgyu yang bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu yang bstan pa yin no //
translated: The causes of the four analytical knowledges are also taught.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: tshig gi don gyi rnam grangs kyis ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa'i nye rgyu byas pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig gi don gyi rnam grangs kyis ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa'i nye rgyu byas pa yin no //
translated: The proximate cause of the analytical knowledge of the teaching is the enumeration of the meanings of the words.

original: mtshan nyid kyis ni don so sor yang dag par rig pa yin /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis ni don so sor yang dag par rig pa yin /
translated: The analytical knowledge of the meaning is by way of the characteristics.

original: nges pa'i tshig gis ni nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa yin /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig gis ni nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa yin /
translated: The analytical knowledge of language is by way of etymological definitions.

original: rab tu dbye bas ni spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa yin no //
analyzed: rab tu dbye bas ni spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa yin no //
translated: The analytical knowledge of brilliance is by way of the divisions.🔽The meaning of the words should be understood by way of the four aspects.

original: rnam pa bzhi dag gis tshig gi don rig par bya ste zhes bya ba 'di ni nges pa med do //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi dag gis tshig gi don rig par bya ste zhes bya ba 'di ni nges pa med do //
translated: This is not definite.

original: gdul ba'i khyad par la ltos nas len 'ga' ni kha cig bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: gdul ba'i khyad par la ltos nas len 'ga' ni kha cig bshad par bya ste /
translated: Some should be explained by way of the distinctions of the disciples.

original: dper na bza' blta bu'i mdo las 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bza' blta bu'i mdo las 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the Sūtra of the Garuḍa King says:

original: don snga phyi 'brel pa'i mtshams sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni don snga ma dang phyi mar 'brel pa ni don snga phyi 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: don snga phyi 'brel pa'i mtshams sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni don snga ma dang phyi mar 'brel pa ni don snga phyi 'brel pa ste /
translated: The connection of the meaning of the past and future is the connection of the meaning of the past and future.

original: de nyid mtshams sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid mtshams sbyar ba yin no //
translated: That itself is the connection.🔽Bhikṣus, I will explain the noble Dharma’s seal, realization, and the very pure view.

original: dge slong dag 'phags pa'i chos kyi phyag rgya rtogs pa dang / mthong ba shin tu rnam par dag pa bshad par bya'o zhes gsungs nas de'i rtogs pa gsungs par mjug thogs kho nar bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'phags pa'i chos kyi phyag rgya rtogs pa dang / mthong ba shin tu rnam par dag pa bshad par bya'o zhes gsungs nas de'i rtogs pa gsungs par mjug thogs kho nar bka' stsal pa /
translated: Having said that, immediately after teaching its realization, he said:

original: dge slong dag gang zhig 'di skad du bdag gis ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa nyid dang / cung zad med pa nyid ma thob par mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa'i ye shes bskyed par bya'o zhes zer ba ni tshig tsam ste zhes rgyas par 'byung ba 'di la /
analyzed: dge slong dag gang zhig 'di skad du bdag gis ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa nyid dang / cung zad med pa nyid ma thob par mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa'i ye shes bskyed par bya'o zhes zer ba ni tshig tsam ste zhes rgyas par 'byung ba 'di la /
translated: Bhikṣus, whoever says, “I will generate the wisdom of the absence of pride without attaining emptiness, the absence of marks, and the absence of anything,” is just speaking words.

original: mtshams sbyar ba brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshams sbyar ba brjod par bya'o //
translated: This should be connected.

original: mtshams sbyor ba ni 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba ni 'brel pa yin no //
translated: The connection is the relation.

original: 'phags pa'i chos kyi phyag rgya @248b ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa nyid dang / cung zad med pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos kyi phyag rgya @248b ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa nyid dang / cung zad med pa nyid do //
translated: The seals of the noble dharmas are emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: de la stong pa nyid ni bdag med pa dang / stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa gnyis dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam pa gnyis can yin no //
analyzed: de la stong pa nyid ni bdag med pa dang / stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa gnyis dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam pa gnyis can yin no //
translated: Among them, emptiness is a twofold samādhi that is associated with the two aspects of selflessness and emptiness.

original: mtshan ma med pa nyid ni 'gog pa'i rnam pa rnams dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam pa bzhi can yin te /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa nyid ni 'gog pa'i rnam pa rnams dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam pa bzhi can yin te /
translated: Signlessness is a fourfold samādhi that is associated with the aspects of cessation.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni mtshan ma bcu dang 'bral ba'i phyir mtshan ma med pa yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni mtshan ma bcu dang 'bral ba'i phyir mtshan ma med pa yin no //
translated: Because nirvāṇa is free from the ten signs, it is signless.

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni mtshan ma med pa can yin no //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni mtshan ma med pa can yin no //
translated: The samādhi that focuses on that is signless.

original: cung zad med pa nyid la cung zad ni 'dod chags cung zad dang / zhe sdang cung zad dang gti mug cung zad de /

original: spyad par mi bya zhes bya ba la brten par mi bya ba ni 'dod pa rnams la 'dod pa'i bsod nyams kyi sbyor ba gang yin pa dang / bdag nyid dub par gnas pa'i sbyor ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: spyad par mi bya zhes bya ba la brten par mi bya ba ni 'dod pa rnams la 'dod pa'i bsod nyams kyi sbyor ba gang yin pa dang / bdag nyid dub par gnas pa'i sbyor ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase should not be practiced means that one should not engage in the practice of sensual enjoyment and the practice of self-mortification with regard to the sense objects.

original: de la sdig pa spyod pa'i gnyen por ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa yin no //🔽'dod pa'i bsod nyams la sbyor ba'i mtha'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de la sdig pa spyod pa'i gnyen por ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa yin no // 'dod pa'i bsod nyams la sbyor ba'i mtha'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: The training in superior morality is the antidote to the practice of evil.

original: 'dod pa spyod pa'i gnyen por ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa spyod pa'i gnyen por ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa yin no //
translated: The training in superior mind is the antidote to the practice of sensual enjoyment, as stated in the verse, Having understood that sensual enjoyments are the enemy, one should not pursue sensual enjoyment.

original: bdag nyid dub par gnas pa la sbyor ba'i dbang du mdzad nas drag po spyod pa'i gnyen por ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid dub par gnas pa la sbyor ba'i dbang du mdzad nas drag po spyod pa'i gnyen por ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa yin no //
translated: The training in superior wisdom is the antidote to the practice of self-mortification, as stated in the verse, “Having understood that self-mortification is a great evil, one should not engage in self-mortification.”

original: bde 'gro dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu gnyis su yin no zhes bya ba ni bslab pa gsum rnams go rims ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: bde 'gro dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu gnyis su yin no zhes bya ba ni bslab pa gsum rnams go rims ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: The three trainings are the causes of the two kinds of knowledge, mundane and supramundane, and of the two kinds of happy rebirth.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: bde 'gro'i rgyu nyid yin pas na lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa yin no //🔽'jig rten pa'i rnam par dag pa'i rgyu nyid yin pas na lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa yin no //
analyzed: bde 'gro'i rgyu nyid yin pas na lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa yin no // 'jig rten pa'i rnam par dag pa'i rgyu nyid yin pas na lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa yin no //
translated: The training in superior morality is the cause of happy rebirth.🔽The training in superior mind is the cause of mundane purity.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par dag pa'i rgyu nyid yin pas na lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par dag pa'i rgyu nyid yin pas na lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa yin no //
translated: The training in superior wisdom is the cause of supramundane purity.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba'i rten nyid kyis kyang bslab pa gsum rnams dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba'i rten nyid kyis kyang bslab pa gsum rnams dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ba yin no //
translated: The three trainings are also applied in order, respectively, as the basis of concentration, wisdom, and liberation.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa ni @250b ting nge 'dzin gyi rten du 'gyur bas gzhag pa yin la /
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa ni @250b ting nge 'dzin gyi rten du 'gyur bas gzhag pa yin la /
translated: The training in superior morality is posited as the basis of concentration.

original: de bzhin du shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba'i rkyen du 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba'i rkyen du 'gyur bas so //
translated: Similarly, the training in superior wisdom is the basis of liberation.

original: gnyis 'byung ba ni rgyu nyid ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gnyis 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid du byed pa dang / mnyam par 'jog par byed pa dang / rnam par grol bar byed pa pas go rims bzhin du bslab pa gsum du gzhag go //
analyzed: gnyis 'byung ba ni rgyu nyid ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gnyis 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid du byed pa dang / mnyam par 'jog par byed pa dang / rnam par grol bar byed pa pas go rims bzhin du bslab pa gsum du gzhag go //
translated: The cause of the arising of the two is the cause of the arising of the two, the cause of the arising of concentration and the cause of the arising of liberation.

original: ji ltar byas pas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas she na /
translated: How is this so?

original: gcig gis te /🔽lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pas ni gnyis skye ba ste /
analyzed: gcig gis te / lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pas ni gnyis skye ba ste /
translated: By the first,

original: ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab skye ba'i rgyu nyid yin la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab skye ba'i rgyu nyid yin la /
translated: the training in superior morality is the cause of the arising of the two, concentration and wisdom.🔽By the second,

original: gnyis pas te lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pas ni sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa mnyam par 'jog par byed pa yin zhing /
analyzed: gnyis pas te lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pas ni sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa mnyam par 'jog par byed pa yin zhing /
translated: the training in superior mind is the cause of the arising of concentration.

original: gsum pas te /
analyzed: gsum pas te /
translated: By the third,

original: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pas ni sems mnyam par gzhag pa rnam par grol bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pas ni sems mnyam par gzhag pa rnam par grol bar byed pa yin no //
translated: the training in superior wisdom is the cause of the arising of liberation.

original: bsdus pa'i tshig su bcad pa ni rgyu bcu po de dag rnams kyi yin no //
analyzed: bsdus pa'i tshig su bcad pa ni rgyu bcu po de dag rnams kyi yin no //
translated: This verse is a summary of the ten causes.

original: sdom brtson zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: sdom brtson zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The term “one who is diligent in the vows” is an extended form.

original: sdom brtson dang / tshangs par spyod pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / 'gro ba dang / las rnam pa gsum ni /
analyzed: sdom brtson dang / tshangs par spyod pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / 'gro ba dang / las rnam pa gsum ni /
translated: The three types of “one who is diligent in the vows,” “one who practices pure conduct,” “one who is afflicted,” “one who goes,” and “one who acts” are as follows:

original: sdom brtson tshangs spyod kun nyon mongs //
analyzed: sdom brtson tshangs spyod kun nyon mongs //
translated: One who is diligent in the vows, one who practices pure conduct, one who is afflicted,

original: 'gro dang las rnam gsum phyir te //
analyzed: 'gro dang las rnam gsum phyir te //
translated: one who goes, and one who acts, because of three types.

original: de dag gi phyir zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi phyir zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The term “because of” should be supplied.

original: de bzhin du nyon mongs skabs dang ste /🔽nyon mongs pa'i gnas skabs dang / spyod pa dang / rnam par dang / rten dang / byed pa rnam gsum ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du nyon mongs skabs dang ste / nyon mongs pa'i gnas skabs dang / spyod pa dang / rnam par dang / rten dang / byed pa rnam gsum ni /
translated: Similarly, the term “one who is afflicted” is an extended form.

original: nyon mongs skabs dang spyod dang dag / rten dang byed rnam gsum phyir te //
analyzed: nyon mongs skabs dang spyod dang dag / rten dang byed rnam gsum phyir te //
translated: The three types of “one who is afflicted” are the one who is afflicted in terms of the occasion, the one who is afflicted in terms of conduct, the one who is afflicted in terms of purification, the one who is afflicted in terms of the basis, and the one who is afflicted in terms of action.🔽One who is afflicted in terms of the occasion, conduct, purification, basis, and action,🔽because of three types.

original: de dag gi phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag gi phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The term “because of” should be supplied.

original: sbyor ba 'di ni da ltar byung ba bzhin du 'das pa'i dus la bya ba rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba 'di ni da ltar byung ba bzhin du 'das pa'i dus la bya ba rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: This application is not appropriate for the past, as it is for the present.

original: sbyor ba de lta bu ni 'jig rten na yang ma mthong la /
analyzed: sbyor ba de lta bu ni 'jig rten na yang ma mthong la /
translated: Such an application is not seen in the world.

original: da ltar byung ba ni da ltar nyid yin pas zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis kyang ma yin no zhes smra'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba ni da ltar nyid yin pas zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis kyang ma yin no zhes smra'o //
translated: Nor is it the present because it is the present itself.

original: dngos po tsam la zhes bya ba ni bya ba tsam la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dngos po tsam la zhes bya ba ni bya ba tsam la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Merely a thing” means merely an action.

original: las dang bcas pa'i byed pa por bshad pa ni rigs pa ma yin zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: las dang bcas pa'i byed pa por bshad pa ni rigs pa ma yin zhes bya ba de la /
translated: It is not logical to explain it as the agent that possesses the action.

original: las ni shes par bya ba gang yin pa de dang / rnam par shes par bya ba gang yin pa de yin te /
analyzed: las ni shes par bya ba gang yin pa de dang / rnam par shes par bya ba gang yin pa de yin te /
translated: The object of the action is that which is to be known and that which is to be cognized.

original: las de dang lhan cig pa ni las dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: las de dang lhan cig pa ni las dang bcas pa ste /
translated: That which possesses that action is the one that possesses the action.

original: rab tu shes par byed ces bya ba dang / rnam par shes par byed ces bya ba'i byed pa por bshad pa ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes dper na 'gro @251a * //
analyzed: rab tu shes par byed ces bya ba dang / rnam par shes par byed ces bya ba'i byed pa por bshad pa ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes dper na 'gro @251a * //
translated: It is not logical to explain it as the agent that causes the action to be known or the agent that causes the action to be cognized, just as it is not logical to explain it as the agent that causes going to go to the village.

original: ba grong du 'gro bar byed ces bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba'i sgra de ltar sbyor ba na 'jig rten na mthong ngo //
analyzed: ba grong du 'gro bar byed ces bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba'i sgra de ltar sbyor ba na 'jig rten na mthong ngo //
translated: When the word “goer” is used in this way, it is seen in the world.

original: de bzhin du mig dang gzugs la brten nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'di la yang 'jig rten tshad mar byas kyang sbyor ba 'di rigs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du mig dang gzugs la brten nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'di la yang 'jig rten tshad mar byas kyang sbyor ba 'di rigs pa ma yin la /
translated: Even if you accept the world’s perspective, this syllogism is not correct.

original: byed pa po gcig pu dag la dus snga ma shos kyi dang / gzhan dang gzhan phrad pa la nas zhes bya ba 'byung bas by'a ka ra na'i tshul khrims kyang ma yin no zhes smra'o //
analyzed: byed pa po gcig pu dag la dus snga ma shos kyi dang / gzhan dang gzhan phrad pa la nas zhes bya ba 'byung bas by'a ka ra na'i tshul khrims kyang ma yin no zhes smra'o //
translated: Nor is it a rule of the grammarians, because the term “from” occurs in the sense of “having met with” the first of a series of actions and “having met with” other and other things.

original: gang zhig gis brten nas zhes bya ba ni gang zhig gis rnyed nas so //
analyzed: gang zhig gis brten nas zhes bya ba ni gang zhig gis rnyed nas so //
translated: “That which is dependent” means that which is obtained.

original: 'di la mig dang gzugs las rgal nas mig gi rnam par shes pa yod do zhes bya ba lta bur gzhan dang gzhan phrad pa yang med par bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la mig dang gzugs las rgal nas mig gi rnam par shes pa yod do zhes bya ba lta bur gzhan dang gzhan phrad pa yang med par bsams pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the passage is that consciousness does not exist apart from the eye and form, as if it were something that “meets with” other and other things.

original: tshor ba gang ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: tshor ba gang ci yang rung ste /
translated: Whatever is feeling

original: de thams cad ni tshor ba'i tshogs drug go zhes ni ma gsungs la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de thams cad ni tshor ba'i tshogs drug go zhes ni ma gsungs la zhes bya ba la /
translated: is included in the six groups of feeling.

original: ji skad gsungs she na /
analyzed: ji skad gsungs she na /
translated: What does the sūtra say?

original: mdo sde de nyid las tshor ba nye bar len pa'i phung po gang zhe na /
analyzed: mdo sde de nyid las tshor ba nye bar len pa'i phung po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the appropriated aggregate of feeling?🔽It is the six collections of feeling.🔽And similarly, it states:🔽What is the appropriated aggregate of consciousness?

original: tshor ba'i tshogs drug rnams so zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug rnams so zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: tshor ba'i tshogs drug rnams so zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug rnams so zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ngo //
translated: It is the six collections of consciousness.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni de bzhin du skye mched bcu gnyis po mig gi skye mched dang / gzugs kyi skye mched dang / yid kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched ces bya ba'i bar 'di rnams las bcu char dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni de bzhin du skye mched bcu gnyis po mig gi skye mched dang / gzugs kyi skye mched dang / yid kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched ces bya ba'i bar 'di rnams las bcu char dang /
translated: Similarly, the twelve bases—the eye base and form base, up to the mind base and entity base—are the ten physical bases and the two bases of phenomena.

original: bcu gcig pa chos kyi skye mched kyi phyogs rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs kyang gzugs yin bzhin du mig gi skye mched dang / gzugs kyi skye mched ces gcig pu zhig gzugs kyi skye mched du gsungs pa yang mtshan nyid 'dra ba la dgongs pa med par bye brag tu bshad pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bcu gcig pa chos kyi skye mched kyi phyogs rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs kyang gzugs yin bzhin du mig gi skye mched dang / gzugs kyi skye mched ces gcig pu zhig gzugs kyi skye mched du gsungs pa yang mtshan nyid 'dra ba la dgongs pa med par bye brag tu bshad pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is illogical to explain this separately without considering that the intention is that they have similar characteristics.

original: gzugs dang tshor ba yang mtshan nyid 'dra ba'i skabs su bab la /🔽mig la sogs pa'i skye mched bcu rnams dang / bcu gcig pa'i phyogs kyang gzugs kyi mtshan nyid yin par 'dra ba bzhin du /
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba yang mtshan nyid 'dra ba'i skabs su bab la / mig la sogs pa'i skye mched bcu rnams dang / bcu gcig pa'i phyogs kyang gzugs kyi mtshan nyid yin par 'dra ba bzhin du /
translated: Also, form and feeling are similar in that they are mentioned in the context of having similar characteristics.🔽It is illogical to explain this separately without considering that the intention is that the eleven bases are similar in that the ten bases such as the eyes and the part of the eleventh base that is form have similar characteristics.🔽It is illogical to explain this separately without considering that the intention is that the eleven bases are similar in that the ten bases such as the eyes and the part of the eleventh base that is form have similar characteristics.🔽For example, it is illogical to explain this separately without considering that the intention is that the eleven bases are similar in that the ten bases such as the eyes and the part of the eleventh base that is form have similar characteristics.

original: ji skad du gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung ste zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs pa lta bur dgos pa med par byed brag tu bshad pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //🔽kha cig las /
analyzed: ji skad du gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung ste zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs pa lta bur dgos pa med par byed brag tu bshad pa ni rigs pa ma yin no // kha cig las /
translated: For example, it is illogical to explain this separately without considering that the intention is that the eleven bases are similar in that the ten bases such as the eyes and the part of the eleventh base that is form have similar characteristics.🔽For example, it is illogical to explain this separately without considering that the intention is that the eleven bases are similar in that the ten bases such as the eyes and the part of the eleventh base that is form have similar characteristics.🔽For example, it is illogical to explain this separately without considering that the intention is that the eleven bases are similar in that the ten bases such as the eyes and the part of the eleventh base that is form have similar characteristics.🔽For example, it is illogical to explain this separately without considering that the intention is that the eleven bases are similar in that the ten bases such as the eyes and the part of the eleventh base that is form have similar characteristics.🔽For example, it is illogical to explain this separately without considering that the intention is that the eleven bases are similar in that the ten bases such as the eyes and the part of the eleventh base that is form have similar characteristics.

original: bram ze'i bden pa gsum dag ces gsungs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: bram ze'i bden pa gsum dag ces gsungs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: For example, it is illogical to explain this separately without considering that the intention is that the eleven bases are similar in that the ten bases such as the eyes and the part of the eleventh base that is form have similar characteristics.

original: bram ze dang kun du rgyu dag ngas rang gis mngon par shes te mngon par rdzogs par byang chub nas bstan @251b pa gang yin pa 'di dag ni bram ze'i bden pa gsum dag go //
analyzed: bram ze dang kun du rgyu dag ngas rang gis mngon par shes te mngon par rdzogs par byang chub nas bstan @251b pa gang yin pa 'di dag ni bram ze'i bden pa gsum dag go //
translated: “Brahmins and wandering mendicants, I have directly known and taught this truth since my perfect awakening.

original: bram ze dang kun du rgyu dag gsum gang dag ce na /
analyzed: bram ze dang kun du rgyu dag gsum gang dag ce na /
translated: What are the three truths of the brahmins?

original: bram ze dang kun du rgyu dag na re 'di skad du sems can thams cad ni gsad par bya ba ma yin no zhes zer zhing /
analyzed: bram ze dang kun du rgyu dag na re 'di skad du sems can thams cad ni gsad par bya ba ma yin no zhes zer zhing /
translated: Brahmins and wandering mendicants say, ‘No sentient being should be killed.’

original: smra na bden par smras pa yin te /
analyzed: smra na bden par smras pa yin te /
translated: When they say this, they speak the truth.

original: brdzun pa ma yin la /
analyzed: brdzun pa ma yin la /
translated: It is not a lie.

original: des de dag mchog go snyam du mi sems /
analyzed: des de dag mchog go snyam du mi sems /
translated: They do not think, ‘This is supreme.’

original: 'dra'o snyam du mi sems /
analyzed: 'dra'o snyam du mi sems /
translated: They do not think, ‘This is equal.’

original: dman pa'o snyam du mi sems /
analyzed: dman pa'o snyam du mi sems /
translated: They do not think, ‘This is inferior.’

original: dge sbyong ngo snyam du mi sems /
analyzed: dge sbyong ngo snyam du mi sems /
translated: They do not think, ‘This is a spiritual practitioner.’

original: bram ze'o snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: bram ze'o snyam du mi sems so //
translated: They do not think, ‘This is a brahmin.’

original: de ltar 'dir bden pa gang yin pa de la gnas nas 'jig rten thams cad la byams pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa 'di ni bram ze'i bden pa dang po ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'dir bden pa gang yin pa de la gnas nas 'jig rten thams cad la byams pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa 'di ni bram ze'i bden pa dang po ste /
translated: In this way, they abide in the truth and dwell in a state of love for the entire world. This is the first truth of the brahmins.

original: ngas rang gis mngon par shes te /
analyzed: ngas rang gis mngon par shes te /
translated: I have directly perceived🔽

original: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub nas bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub nas bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: I have realized this through my own knowledge and vision, and I teach it to others.

original: gzhan yang bram ze dang / kun du rgyu dag na re 'di skad du kun 'byung ba'i chos can gang yin pa ci yang rung ste /🔽de thams cad ni 'gog pa'i chos can yin no zhes zer zhing smra na bden par smras pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang bram ze dang / kun du rgyu dag na re 'di skad du kun 'byung ba'i chos can gang yin pa ci yang rung ste / de thams cad ni 'gog pa'i chos can yin no zhes zer zhing smra na bden par smras pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, brahmins and wandering mendicants say, “Whatever is a phenomenon that originates is a phenomenon that ceases.

original: brdzun pa ma yin la /
analyzed: brdzun pa ma yin la /
translated: If they say this, they speak the truth and not falsehood.

original: des de dag mchog go snyam du mi sems zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: des de dag mchog go snyam du mi sems zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'i bar du ste /
translated: They do not think, ‘This is the highest.’

original: de ltar 'dir bden pa gang yin pa de la gnas nas 'jig rten thams cad la 'byung ba dang 'jig par rjes su lta zhing gnas pa 'di ni bram ze'i bden pa gnyis pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar 'dir bden pa gang yin pa de la gnas nas 'jig rten thams cad la 'byung ba dang 'jig par rjes su lta zhing gnas pa 'di ni bram ze'i bden pa gnyis pa yin te /
translated: In this way, brahmins, having abided in the truth, they observe the arising and passing away of the entire world. This is the second brahmin truth.

original: ngas rang gis mngon par shes te mngon par rdzogs par byang chub nas bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ngas rang gis mngon par shes te mngon par rdzogs par byang chub nas bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: I have realized this through my own knowledge and vision, and I teach it to others.

original: gzhan yang bram ze dang kun du rgyu dag na re 'di skad du nga'i bya ba ni gang na yang med /
analyzed: gzhan yang bram ze dang kun du rgyu dag na re 'di skad du nga'i bya ba ni gang na yang med /
translated: Also, brahmins and wandering mendicants say, “My action does not exist anywhere.

original: cung zad kyang med la /🔽nga yang gang na yang med /
analyzed: cung zad kyang med la / nga yang gang na yang med /
translated: It does not exist at all.🔽I do not exist anywhere.

original: gang gi yang ma yin /
analyzed: gang gi yang ma yin /
translated: I do not belong to anyone.🔽I do not exist at all.”

original: cung zad kyang med do zhes zer zhing smra na bden pa kho nar smras pa yin te brdzun pa ma yin la /
analyzed: cung zad kyang med do zhes zer zhing smra na bden pa kho nar smras pa yin te brdzun pa ma yin la /
translated: If they say this and speak this way, they speak only the truth, not lies.

original: des de dag mchog go snyam du mi sems zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: des de dag mchog go snyam du mi sems zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'i bar du ste /
translated: They do not think, “This is supreme.”

original: de ltar 'dir ni bden pa gang yin pa 'di la gnas nas 'jig rten thams cad la nga yir 'dzin pa med pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa 'di ni bram ze'i bden pa gsum pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar 'dir ni bden pa gang yin pa 'di la gnas nas 'jig rten thams cad la nga yir 'dzin pa med pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa 'di ni bram ze'i bden pa gsum pa yin te /
translated: Thus, in this context, the third truth of brahmins is that they abide in this truth and abide in the nature of nonapprehending mine with regard to the entire world.

original: ngas rang gis mngon par shes te mngon par rdzogs par byang chub nas bstan pa gang yin pa'o zhes rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: ngas rang gis mngon par shes te mngon par rdzogs par byang chub nas bstan pa gang yin pa'o zhes rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: This is what I have taught through my own higher knowledge and complete enlightenment.”

original: kha cig las bden pa ni gcig kho na ste gnyis pa med do zhes bya ba dang / mi rnams kyi ni 'di na bsod @252a * //
analyzed: kha cig las bden pa ni gcig kho na ste gnyis pa med do zhes bya ba dang / mi rnams kyi ni 'di na bsod @252a * //
translated: And: In this world, humans do both,🔽what is meritorious and what is sinful.

original: nams dang / sdig pa gang yin pa gnyi ga byed pa de zhes de ltar tshigs su bcad pa las byed pa po bshad nas //
analyzed: nams dang / sdig pa gang yin pa gnyi ga byed pa de zhes de ltar tshigs su bcad pa las byed pa po bshad nas //
translated: Thus, the verse explains the agent.

original: byed pa po ni mi dmigs so zhes 'byung ba ni snga phyi 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: byed pa po ni mi dmigs so zhes 'byung ba ni snga phyi 'gal ba yin no //
translated: But the statement, “The agent is not perceived,” contradicts the former and latter statements.

original: ci 'di zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: ci 'di zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: What is this?

original: ci 'di rdzas kyi dbang du mdzad de gsungs te /
analyzed: ci 'di rdzas kyi dbang du mdzad de gsungs te /
translated: Is this stated from the perspective of substance?

original: rdul phra rab kyi rdzas brgyad dang dgu la sogs pa tshogs pa rnams las sa'i khams la sogs pa rdzas re re'i dbang du mdzad de ched du mdzad de gsungs sam /
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi rdzas brgyad dang dgu la sogs pa tshogs pa rnams las sa'i khams la sogs pa rdzas re re'i dbang du mdzad de ched du mdzad de gsungs sam /
translated: Is it stated from the perspective of each substance, such as the earth element, from the collection of eight or nine substances of subtle particles?

original: 'on te gong bu ste /
analyzed: 'on te gong bu ste /
translated: Or is it stated from the perspective of a composite?

original: gzugs can 'dul ba ma yin pa de nyid khyad par du ma phye pa las sam /
analyzed: gzugs can 'dul ba ma yin pa de nyid khyad par du ma phye pa las sam /
translated: Is it stated from the perspective of that which is not a form, without distinguishing its specific features?

original: 'on te rigs las te /
analyzed: 'on te rigs las te /
translated: Or is it stated from the perspective of type?

original: gzugs kyi rigs te gzugs kyi rnam pa 'di snyed cig ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rigs te gzugs kyi rnam pa 'di snyed cig ni 'di lta ste /
translated: This is the type of form, this is the aspect of form, this is the extent of form,

original: gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung /
analyzed: gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung /
translated: whatever form there is,

original: de thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'o zhes bya ba las sam /
analyzed: de thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'o zhes bya ba las sam /
translated: all of that is the four great elements and form derived from the four great elements.🔽Or, the individual characteristics of the primary elements and the derivative elements would not exist, because

original: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa rnams kyis so so'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni sa'i khams la sogs pa 'byung ba rnams dang / gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa 'byung ba las gyur pa rnams kyi so so'i mtshan nyid med par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa rnams kyis so so'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni sa'i khams la sogs pa 'byung ba rnams dang / gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa 'byung ba las gyur pa rnams kyi so so'i mtshan nyid med par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: the individual characteristics of the primary elements such as the earth element and the derivative elements such as form and sound would not exist.

original: sa'i khams la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid sra ba nyid la sogs pa med pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa 'byung ba las gyur pa rnams kyis so so'i mtshan nyid mig gi rnam par shes pas rnam par bya ba nyid la sogs pa yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa'i khams la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid sra ba nyid la sogs pa med pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa 'byung ba las gyur pa rnams kyis so so'i mtshan nyid mig gi rnam par shes pas rnam par bya ba nyid la sogs pa yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The individual characteristics of the primary elements such as the earth element would not exist because solidity and so on would not exist. The individual characteristics of form and so on, the derivative elements, would not exist because the eye consciousness and so on would not exist.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: thams cad kyang mtshan nyid thams cad du 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: thams cad kyang mtshan nyid thams cad du 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: because all would have all characteristics.

original: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa thams cad kyang re re yang mtshan nyid thams cad du gyur pa'i phyir na mtshan nyid gang gis na 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa de nges par gzung bar bya /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa thams cad kyang re re yang mtshan nyid thams cad du gyur pa'i phyir na mtshan nyid gang gis na 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa de nges par gzung bar bya /
translated: Because each of the primary elements and the derivative form would have all characteristics, by what characteristic would the primary elements and the derivative form be ascertained?

original: gzhan yang dbang po thams cad kyis 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ro //🔽ji ltar 'byung ba rnams lus kyis gzung bar bya ba bzhin du gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro zhes bya ba 'byung ba las gyur pa yang de bzhin du 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gzhan yang dbang po thams cad kyis 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ro // ji ltar 'byung ba rnams lus kyis gzung bar bya ba bzhin du gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro zhes bya ba 'byung ba las gyur pa yang de bzhin du 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Moreover, it follows that all would be apprehended by all sense faculties.🔽Just as the primary elements are apprehended by the body, so too would form, sound, smell, and taste, which are derivative form.

original: ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa 'byung ba las gyur pa dag mig gi dbang po la sogs pas gzung bar bya ba yin pa bzhin du 'byung ba rnams kyang de bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa 'byung ba las gyur pa dag mig gi dbang po la sogs pas gzung bar bya ba yin pa bzhin du 'byung ba rnams kyang de bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: Or just as form, etc., which are derivative form, are apprehended by the eye faculty, etc., so too would the primary elements.

original: 'on te gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni gong bu'i dbang du mdzad de @252b gsungs so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni gong bu'i dbang du mdzad de @252b gsungs so zhe na /
translated: Or else, the passage “Whatever form there is” and so on refers to the collection of form.

original: gzugs 'dus pa 'od la sogs pa dang / sa la sogs pa thams cad la 'byung ba bzhi char dmigs par thal bar 'gyur na 'od dag la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gzugs 'dus pa 'od la sogs pa dang / sa la sogs pa thams cad la 'byung ba bzhi char dmigs par thal bar 'gyur na 'od dag la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: If you maintain that the four primary elements are observed in all collections of form, such as light and so on, and in earth and so on, then the following error would ensue: The four primary elements would also be observed in light.

original: nor bu'i 'od la gsher ba dang tsha ba gnyis ka med cing /
analyzed: nor bu'i 'od la gsher ba dang tsha ba gnyis ka med cing /
translated: In the light of a jewel, both fluidity and heat do not exist.

original: rdo ba la sogs pa dag la yang de gnyi ga med do //
analyzed: rdo ba la sogs pa dag la yang de gnyi ga med do //
translated: In a stone and so on, both of those do not exist.

original: brtan pa rdo rje dang rdo ba la sogs pa dag la yang zhing g-yo ba nyid med pa yin no //🔽'byung ba gzhan shas che bas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: brtan pa rdo rje dang rdo ba la sogs pa dag la yang zhing g-yo ba nyid med pa yin no // 'byung ba gzhan shas che bas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: In a diamond, stone, and so on, which are solid, buoyancy and motility do not exist.🔽The primary elements are observed in the collection of form, such as light and so on, and in earth and so on, because the primary elements are predominant in those.

original: shas che bas ni stobs dang ldan pas sam mtshan nyid brtas pas so //
analyzed: shas che bas ni stobs dang ldan pas sam mtshan nyid brtas pas so //
translated: The primary elements are predominant in those because they are powerful or because their characteristics are developed.

original: 'byung ba gzhan gyis 'byung ba gzhan zil gyis gnon na mi dmigs te /
analyzed: 'byung ba gzhan gyis 'byung ba gzhan zil gyis gnon na mi dmigs te /
translated: When one primary element predominates over another primary element, the other is not observed.

original: dper na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba yin no zhe na /
translated: For example,

original: 'dir slob dpon gyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dir slob dpon gyis gsungs pa /
translated: The master says:

original: yod par rab tu grub na ni 'od la sogs pa la sra ba la sogs pa yang 'byung ba gzhan shas che bas 'byung ba gzhan zil gyis non na mi dmigs so zhes bya ba 'di shes par yang nus na /
analyzed: yod par rab tu grub na ni 'od la sogs pa la sra ba la sogs pa yang 'byung ba gzhan shas che bas 'byung ba gzhan zil gyis non na mi dmigs so zhes bya ba 'di shes par yang nus na /
translated: If it were well established that they exist, then it would be possible to understand that when one element predominates over another, such as solidity in light and so on, the other element is suppressed and not observed.

original: yod par rab tu ma grub na 'od la sogs pa la sra ba nyid la sogs pa yod pa 'di shes par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yod par rab tu ma grub na 'od la sogs pa la sra ba nyid la sogs pa yod pa 'di shes par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: But if it is not well established that they exist, then it is not possible to understand that solidity and so on exist in light and so on.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sngon po la sogs pa kha dog gi rnam pa thams cad la ser po dang dmar po la sogs pa kha dog la sogs pa'i bye brag thams cad yod par thal bar gyur na mi rung bas so //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa kha dog gi rnam pa thams cad la ser po dang dmar po la sogs pa kha dog la sogs pa'i bye brag thams cad yod par thal bar gyur na mi rung bas so //
translated: Because it would be illogical to say that all aspects of color such as blue and so on exist in all colors such as yellow and red and so on.

original: 'od la sogs pa gang la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni skyur ba'i ros chu zil gyis non na mi dmigs pa lta bu zhes gang smras pa yin te /
analyzed: 'od la sogs pa gang la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni skyur ba'i ros chu zil gyis non na mi dmigs pa lta bu zhes gang smras pa yin te /
translated: As for the statement, “It is like the case of water suppressing the taste of salt,”

original: 'dir slob dpon gyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dir slob dpon gyis gsungs pa /
translated: Here the master says:

original: chur skyur ba btab kyang chu de'i ro ni dmigs pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: chur skyur ba btab kyang chu de'i ro ni dmigs pa kho na yin te /
translated: Even when water is mixed with sour milk, the taste of water alone is observed.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'dzin pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dzin pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the apprehenders are different.

original: gang gi phyir skyur ba bsres pa'i chu dang / ma bsres pa'i chu dang / gzhan dang ma bsres pa'i skyur ba'i ro 'dzin pa tha dad pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skyur ba bsres pa'i chu dang / ma bsres pa'i chu dang / gzhan dang ma bsres pa'i skyur ba'i ro 'dzin pa tha dad pa mthong ngo //
translated: Because the apprehenders of water mixed with sour milk, of water not mixed with sour milk, and of the taste of sour milk not mixed with anything else are seen to be different.

original: de'i phyir der skyur ba btab kyang de'i ro dmigs pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir der skyur ba btab kyang de'i ro dmigs pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, even when sour milk is mixed with it, the taste of water alone is observed.

original: bye brag tu smra ba dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba dag gis smras pa /
translated: Vaibhasikas say:

original: 'o na ni chu dang rdo la sogs pa rnams la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'o na ni chu dang rdo la sogs pa rnams la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Well then, even water, stones and so on

original: sa'i dri bzhin no /
analyzed: sa'i dri bzhin no /
translated: are like the smell of earth.

original: ltar sa la dri yod bzhin du yang rkyen gyi khyad par dang phrad na ste /
analyzed: ltar sa la dri yod bzhin du yang rkyen gyi khyad par dang phrad na ste /
translated: Just as earth has smell, when it encounters special conditions,

original: chu'i khyad par dang phrad na mtshan nyid brtas pas phyis dmigs pa yin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: chu'i khyad par dang phrad na mtshan nyid brtas pas phyis dmigs pa yin no zhes zer na /
translated: when it encounters special water, its characteristics develop and it is later observed.

original: slob dpon gyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis gsungs pa /
translated: The master says:

original: mtshan nyid brtas pa'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: mtshan nyid brtas pa'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: It is because the characteristics are enhanced.🔽

original: skyes pa'i phyir @253a * //
analyzed: skyes pa'i phyir @253a * //
translated: It is because the characteristics are developed, not because they are produced.

original: ma yin pa 'di ji ltar shes par bya /
analyzed: ma yin pa 'di ji ltar shes par bya /
translated: How do you know that?

original: rkyen gyi khyad par dang phrad pas mtshan nyid brtas pa'i phyir dmigs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rkyen gyi khyad par dang phrad pas mtshan nyid brtas pa'i phyir dmigs pa yin gyi /
translated: Because the characteristics are developed through contact with specific conditions, they are perceived.🔽They are not perceived because they are produced.

original: skyes pa'i phyir ma yin no zhe na de lta na ni ha cang thal ches bar gyur te /
analyzed: skyes pa'i phyir ma yin no zhe na de lta na ni ha cang thal ches bar gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then this is an overextension.

original: ji ltar byas pas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas she na /
translated: How is it an overextension?

original: reg bya gzhan bzhin te /
analyzed: reg bya gzhan bzhin te /
translated: It is like another tangible object.

original: ji ltar khyod kyi lugs kyis sra ba nyid dang / gsher ba nyid dang / tsha ba nyid 'dod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar khyod kyi lugs kyis sra ba nyid dang / gsher ba nyid dang / tsha ba nyid 'dod pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the way you assert solidity, fluidity, and heat.

original: de lta na ni gzugs dang dri dang ro gzhan rnams dang / sgra yang rkyen rnyed pas dmigs pa'i phyi rol nas yod pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de lta na ni gzugs dang dri dang ro gzhan rnams dang / sgra yang rkyen rnyed pas dmigs pa'i phyi rol nas yod pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir te /
translated: In that case, it follows that other forms, smells, and tastes, as well as sound, exist externally and are perceived when their conditions are obtained,

original: de dag kyang mtshan nyid brtas pa'i phyir dmigs pa yin gyi skyes pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ha cang thal ches par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang mtshan nyid brtas pa'i phyir dmigs pa yin gyi skyes pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ha cang thal ches par 'gyur ro //
translated: because they are perceived because their characteristics are developed, not because they are produced. This is an overextension.

original: de ltar skyes pa'i phyir dmigs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar skyes pa'i phyir dmigs pa yin gyi /
translated: Because it is produced in that way, it is an object.🔽It is not that it is an object because its characteristics are developed.🔽Having established this through reasoning, he cites a passage from a sutra:

original: mtshan nyid brtas pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya bar rigs pas bsgrubs nas mdo sde'i dum bur byed pa ni mdo sde gzhan las kyang dge slong bsam gtan byed pa dag yin zhing zhes bya ba nas rgyas par gsungs so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid brtas pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya bar rigs pas bsgrubs nas mdo sde'i dum bur byed pa ni mdo sde gzhan las kyang dge slong bsam gtan byed pa dag yin zhing zhes bya ba nas rgyas par gsungs so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: “Monks who practice meditative stabilization, up to and including those who are called ‘those who are free from passion through wisdom,’ are called ‘those who are free from passion through meditative stabilization.’🔽”

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ji ltar shing gi sdong po de la khams sna tshogs dag las khams gzhan de dag 'byung ba de ltar na rkyen gyi khyad par dang phrad pa na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ji ltar shing gi sdong po de la khams sna tshogs dag las khams gzhan de dag 'byung ba de ltar na rkyen gyi khyad par dang phrad pa na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Just as various elements arise from that tree trunk, so too, when it encounters special conditions,

original: khams dag dum bu dag kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: khams dag dum bu dag kyang ma yin te /
translated: the elements do not exist as separate pieces.

original: shing gi sdong po de la sa la sogs pa'i khams dag yod pa dum bu dag kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: shing gi sdong po de la sa la sogs pa'i khams dag yod pa dum bu dag kyang ma yin no //
translated: The elements earth and so on that exist in that tree trunk do not exist as separate pieces.

original: dum bu dag kyang zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa'i khams kyi dum bu dag kyang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dum bu dag kyang zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa'i khams kyi dum bu dag kyang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “And the parts” means the parts of the elements such as earth.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: cha shas gcig la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni shing gi sdong po de'i cha shas gcig la yang ji ltar mos pa bzhin du yongs su 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / de'i cha shas gcig po de la yang dum bu mtha' yas pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa'i khams kyi dum bu mtha' yas pa dag mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cha shas gcig la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni shing gi sdong po de'i cha shas gcig la yang ji ltar mos pa bzhin du yongs su 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / de'i cha shas gcig po de la yang dum bu mtha' yas pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa'i khams kyi dum bu mtha' yas pa dag mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even one part of the tree trunk would be transformed according to the wish, and because an infinite number of parts of that one part are impossible.

original: de'i phyir khams kyi dum bu dag kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir khams kyi dum bu dag kyang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the parts of the elements are also not the seed.

original: khams sna tshogs ni sa bon sna tshogs so //
analyzed: khams sna tshogs ni sa bon sna tshogs so //
translated: The various elements are the various seeds.

original: khams zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu skyed par byed pas na khams so //🔽sa'i dri bzhin no zhes gang smras pa yang /
analyzed: khams zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu skyed par byed pas na khams so // sa'i dri bzhin no zhes gang smras pa yang /
translated: The elements are seeds because they produce results.

original: sa'i dri ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: sa'i dri ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: As for the statement, “like the smell of earth,”🔽the smell of earth is not the seed of the sprout.

original: 'dus pa kha cig la 'byung ba chen po kha cig gang yod par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sa la @253b sogs pa 'dus pa kha cig la chu la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po kha cig yod par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir
analyzed: 'dus pa kha cig la 'byung ba chen po kha cig gang yod par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sa la @253b sogs pa 'dus pa kha cig la chu la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po kha cig yod par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir
translated: because we do not accept that some collections of the great elements have some great elements.

original: ro // de ltar na ni mdo sde dang 'gal te /
analyzed: ro // de ltar na ni mdo sde dang 'gal te /
translated: This contradicts the sutras,

original: skye mched so sor phye ba'i mdo sde dang 'gal te /
analyzed: skye mched so sor phye ba'i mdo sde dang 'gal te /
translated: because it contradicts the sutra that analyzes the sense bases.🔽The sutra that analyzes the sense bases explains:

original: skye mched so so'i mdo sde las skye mched dgu po rnams ni re re yang 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'o zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye mched so so'i mdo sde las skye mched dgu po rnams ni re re yang 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'o zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Each of the nine sense bases is derived from the four great elements.🔽What does it say?

original: ji skad zhe na rgyas par gsungs nas btsun pa nang gi skye mched dmigs gang lags /
analyzed: ji skad zhe na rgyas par gsungs nas btsun pa nang gi skye mched dmigs gang lags /
translated: The sutra says: “Venerable, what is the internal sense base of eyes?”

original: dge slong nang gi skye mched mig ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa yin zhing gzugs can bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong nang gi skye mched mig ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa yin zhing gzugs can bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: “Bhikṣus, the internal sense base of eyes is derived from the four great elements and is visible form that is not demonstrable and has resistance.”

original: de ltar nang gi skye mched gzugs can dag rgyas par gsungs nas /
analyzed: de ltar nang gi skye mched gzugs can dag rgyas par gsungs nas /
translated: Having thus explained the physical internal sense bases in detail,

original: dge slong phyi'i skye mched gzugs ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag rgyur byas pa yin zhing gzugs can bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong phyi'i skye mched gzugs ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag rgyur byas pa yin zhing gzugs can bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: the Buddha said, “Monks, external form is derived from the four great elements and is visible and impeded.

original: de ltar nang gi skye mched gzugs can dag rgyas par gsungs nas /
analyzed: de ltar nang gi skye mched gzugs can dag rgyas par gsungs nas /
translated: Having thus explained the physical internal sense bases in detail,

original: dge slong phyi'i skye mched gzugs ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa yin zhing gzugs can bstan du yod pa thogs pa dang bcas ba yin no //
analyzed: dge slong phyi'i skye mched gzugs ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa yin zhing gzugs can bstan du yod pa thogs pa dang bcas ba yin no //
translated: the Buddha said, “Monks, external form is derived from the four great elements and is visible and impeded.

original: de bzhin du dge slong phyi'i skye mched reg bya ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa yin zhing gzugs can bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong phyi'i skye mched reg bya ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa yin zhing gzugs can bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ba ste /
translated: Similarly, monks, external tangibility is derived from the four great elements and is derived from the four great elements and is invisible and impeded.

original: de rnams las phyi'i skye mched reg bya bzhag ste /
analyzed: de rnams las phyi'i skye mched reg bya bzhag ste /
translated: From among those, external tangibility is posited as the external sense base of tangibility.

original: skye mched dgu dag tu rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skye mched dgu dag tu rig par bya'o //
translated: The other nine sense spheres are the nine sense faculties.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?🔽The sense sphere of tactility is the four great elements and the derived matter that is softness, etc.

original: reg bya'i skye mched ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang / 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa 'byung ba las gyur pa yang yin la 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag ni 'byung ba chen po dag rgyur byas pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: reg bya'i skye mched ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang / 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa 'byung ba las gyur pa yang yin la 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag ni 'byung ba chen po dag rgyur byas pa ma yin pas so //
translated: The four great elements are not derived from the four great elements.

original: lag pa rdob pa lta bu las kyang /
analyzed: lag pa rdob pa lta bu las kyang /
translated: Also, in the passage on clapping the hands,

original: mig gi sha'i gong bu la 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag yod par bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig gi sha'i gong bu la 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag yod par bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is explained that the four great elements exist in the fleshy part of the eye.

original: ji skad du zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad du zhe na /
translated: What does it say?

original: mig gi sha'i gong bu la nang na yod cing rang la yod pas sra ba mkhregs par gyur pa nye bar blangs shing zin pa gang yin pa de ni mig gi sha'i gong bu la yod pa nang gi sa'i khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mig gi sha'i gong bu la nang na yod cing rang la yod pas sra ba mkhregs par gyur pa nye bar blangs shing zin pa gang yin pa de ni mig gi sha'i gong bu la yod pa nang gi sa'i khams zhes bya'o //
translated: The flesh of the eye is the inner earth element that is taken up and grasped as solid and hard that exists in the eye and is found in the eye.

original: de bzhin du mig gi sha'i gong bu la yod pa nang gi rlung gi khams zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du mig gi sha'i gong bu la yod pa nang gi rlung gi khams zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Likewise, the internal wind element is the wind that exists in the mass of flesh of the eye.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ni med pa nyid yin par mngon sum pa yin pas 'di @254a * //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ni med pa nyid yin par mngon sum pa yin pas 'di @254a * //
translated: Since the past and future are non-existent, it is obvious that they do not exist.

original: sgrub mi dgos te /
analyzed: sgrub mi dgos te /
translated: Therefore, it is not necessary to prove that they do not exist.

original: dper na rus sbal gyi sbu med pa nyid yin par mngon sum du 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rus sbal gyi sbu med pa nyid yin par mngon sum du 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is obvious that the hair of a tortoise does not exist.

original: mngon sum dang 'gal ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad de /🔽'das pa yang ma yin la yod pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba 'di snga phyi 'gal ba yang yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum dang 'gal ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad de / 'das pa yang ma yin la yod pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba 'di snga phyi 'gal ba yang yin te /
translated: Not only does this contradict direct perception,🔽it also contradicts what is commonly recognized in the world.🔽If it exists, how can it be past?

original: gal te yod na de ji ltar 'das pa dang / 'das pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten na zad pa /
analyzed: gal te yod na de ji ltar 'das pa dang / 'das pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten na zad pa /
translated: The past is recognized in the world as that which has ceased,

original: 'gag pa / zhig pa /
analyzed: 'gag pa / zhig pa /
translated: that which has been destroyed,🔽that which has been annihilated,

original: rnam par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par gyur pa yin no //
translated: that which has been transformed.

original: gal te yod na de ji ltar ma 'ongs pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te yod na de ji ltar ma 'ongs pa yin te /
translated: If it exists, how can it be future?

original: ma 'ongs pa yang de dang 'dra ba yin no de dang 'dir 'gal ba ni dge slong dag gzugs 'das pa yod do //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa yang de dang 'dra ba yin no de dang 'dir 'gal ba ni dge slong dag gzugs 'das pa yod do //
translated: The past and future exist because the sutra says, “Monks, form of the past and future exists.”

original: gzugs ma 'ongs pa yod do zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de dang / mig skye ba na gang nas kyang mi 'ong la zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs pa gang yin pa 'di dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: gzugs ma 'ongs pa yod do zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de dang / mig skye ba na gang nas kyang mi 'ong la zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs pa gang yin pa 'di dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: This contradicts the statement, “When the eye arises, it does not come from anywhere.”

original: mdo sde las /
analyzed: mdo sde las /
translated: How do you interpret the sutra that states:

original: gzugs rnams kyi nges par 'byung ba ni gzugs med pa'o zhes gsungs pa ji skad ce na /
analyzed: gzugs rnams kyi nges par 'byung ba ni gzugs med pa'o zhes gsungs pa ji skad ce na /
translated: The definite emergence of forms is the formless realm?

original: rgyas par gsungs nas /
analyzed: rgyas par gsungs nas /
translated: The sutra states:

original: 'dod pa rnams kyi nges par 'byung ba ni gzugs dag yin la /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams kyi nges par 'byung ba ni gzugs dag yin la /
translated: The definite emergence of desire realm objects is form.

original: gzugs rnams kyi nges par 'byung ba ni gzugs med pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs rnams kyi nges par 'byung ba ni gzugs med pa'o //
translated: The definite emergence of form is the formless realm.

original: mngon par 'du byas shing mngon par bsags pa gang yin pa ci yang rung de'i nges par 'byung ba ni 'gog pa yin no zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byas shing mngon par bsags pa gang yin pa ci yang rung de'i nges par 'byung ba ni 'gog pa yin no zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The definite emergence of any conditioned and accumulated phenomenon is cessation.

original: gzugs rnams kyi nges par 'byung ba ni gzugs med pa'o zhes bya ba 'di ni rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: gzugs rnams kyi nges par 'byung ba ni gzugs med pa'o zhes bya ba 'di ni rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba yin te /
translated: The statement “the escape from form is the formless realm” contradicts inference.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa rnams ni gzugs la rag las te skye bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa rnams ni gzugs la rag las te skye bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For it is seen that feeling and so on arise in dependence on form.

original: 'di ltar tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rnams ni gzugs la rag las te skye bar mthong gi gzugs med par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rnams ni gzugs la rag las te skye bar mthong gi gzugs med par ni ma yin no //
